2592          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2593          *   }</pre>
2594          *   </li>
2595          * </ul>
2596          * 
2597          * @since 1.3.1
2598          * 
2599          * @see
2600          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.setVideoSize">hcap.video.setVideoSize()</a><br>
2601          *
2602          * @example
2603          * hcap.video.getVideoSize({
2604          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
2605          *          console.log("onSuccess : " + 
2606          *              "\n x = " + s.x +
2607          *              "\n y = " + s.y +
2608          *              "\n width = " + s.width +
2609          *              "\n height = " + s.height);
2610          *      },
2611          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2612          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2613          *      }
2614          * });
2615          */
2616         hcap.video.getVideoSize = function (param) {
2617             hcap_command("get_video_size", param);
2618         };
2619         /**
2620          * Resizes the video size.<br>
2621          * Position and size parameters are on the basis of the resolution of the property "display_resolution".<br>
2622          * Supported size values are dependent on the platform or the model.<br>
2623          *
2624          * @param {Object} param
2625          * <ul>
2626          *   <li>{Number} param.x - x position of the video.</li>
2627          *   <li>{Number} param.y - y position of the video.</li>
2628          *   <li>{Number} param.width - width of the video.</li>
2629          *   <li>{Number} param.height - height of the video.</li>
2630          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
2631          *           Setting to the same x/y/width/height as before will invoke this callback function.
2632          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2633          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2634          *       // No Parameter.
2635          *   }</pre>
2636          *   </li>
2637          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2638          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2639          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2640          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2641          *   }</pre>
2642          *   </li>
2643          * </ul>
2644          * 
2645          * @since 1.3.1
2646          * 
2647          * @see
2648          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.getVideoSize">hcap.video.getVideoSize()</a><br>
2649          *
2650          * @example
2651          * hcap.video.setVideoSize({
2652          *      "x" : 10, 
2653          *      "y" : 10,
2654          *      "width" : 400,
2655          *      "height" : 300,
2656          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2657          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2658          *      }, 
2659          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2660          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2661          *      }
2662          * });
2663          */
2664         hcap.video.setVideoSize = function (param) {
2665             hcap_command("set_video_size", param);
2666         };
2667         /**
2668          * Gets the transparency level of the OSD.<br>
2669          * 
2670          * @param {Object} param
2671          * <ul>
2672          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2673          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2674          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2675          *       // {Number} param.level - transparency level of the OSD (transparent 0 ~ 100 opaque)
2676          *   }</pre>
2677          *   </li>
2678          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2679          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2680          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2681          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2682          *   }</pre>
2683          *   </li>
2684          * </ul>
2685          * 
2686          * @since 1.3.1
2687          * 
2688          * @see
2689          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.setOsdTransparencyLevel">hcap.video.setOsdTransparencyLevel()</a><br>
2690          *
2691          * @example
2692          * hcap.video.getOsdTransparencyLevel({
2693          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
2694          *          console.log("onSuccess : level = " + s.level);
2695          *      }, 
2696          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2697          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2698          *      }
2699          * });
2700          */
2701         hcap.video.getOsdTransparencyLevel = function (param) {
2702             hcap_command("get_osd_transparency_level", param);
2703         };
2704         /**
2705          * Sets the transparency level of the OSD.<br>
2706          *
2707          * @param {Object} param
2708          * <ul>
2709          *   <li>{Number} param.level [Required] - transparency level to be set (transparent 0 ~ 100 opaque)</li>
2710          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
2711          *           Setting to same transparency level as before will invoke this callback function.
2712          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2713          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2714          *       // No Parameter.
2715          *   }</pre>
2716          *   </li>
2717          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2718          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2719          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2720          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2721          *   }</pre>
2722          *   </li>
2723          * </ul>
2724          * 
2725          * @since 1.3.1
2726          * 
2727          * @see
2728          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.getOsdTransparencyLevel">hcap.video.getOsdTransparencyLevel()</a><br>
2729          *
2730          * @example
2731          * hcap.video.setOsdTransparencyLevel({
2732          *      "level" : 30, 
2733          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2734          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2735          *      }, 
2736          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2737          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2738          *      }
2739          * });
2740          */
2741         hcap.video.setOsdTransparencyLevel = function (param) {
2742             hcap_command("set_osd_transparency_level", param);
2743         };
2744         /**
2745          * Gets whether video mute is on or off.<br>
2746          * 
2747          * @param {Object} param
2748          * <ul>
2749          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2750          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2751          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2752          *       // {Boolean} param.videoMute - true if the video mute is on. false if the video mute is off.
2753          *   }</pre>
2754          *   </li>
2755          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2756          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2757          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2758          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2759          *   }</pre>
2760          *   </li>
2761          * </ul>
2762          * 
2763          * @since 1.3.1
2764          * 
2765          * @see
2766          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.setVideoMute">hcap.video.setVideoMute()</a><br>
2767          *
2768          * @example
2769          * hcap.video.isVideoMute({
2770          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
2771          *          console.log("onSuccess : videoMute = " + s.videoMute);
2772          *      }, 
2773          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2774          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2775          *      }
2776          * });
2777          */
2778         hcap.video.isVideoMute = function (param) {
2779             hcap_command("get_video_mute", param);
2780         };
2781         /**
2782          * Turns on or off the video mute. When the channel is changed, the video mute setting is reset to off.<br>
2783          *
2784          * @param {Object} param
2785          * <ul>
2786          *   <li>{Boolean} param.videoMute [Required] - true to turn on video mute, else false.</li>
2787          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
2788          *            Setting to the same setting as before will invoke this callback function.
2789          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2790          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2791          *       // No Parameter.
2792          *   }</pre>
2793          *   </li>
2794          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2795          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2796          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2797          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2798          *   }</pre>
2799          *   </li>
2800          * </ul>
2801          * 
2802          * @since 1.3.1
2803          * 
2804          * @see
2805          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.isVideoMute">hcap.video.isVideoMute()</a><br>
2806          *
2807          * @example
2808          * hcap.video.setVideoMute({
2809          *      "videoMute" : true, 
2810          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2811          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2812          *      }, 
2813          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2814          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2815          *      }
2816          * });
2817          */
2818         hcap.video.setVideoMute = function (param) {
2819             hcap_command("set_video_mute", param);
2820         };
2821         /** 
2822          * @namespace hcap.volume
2823          */
2824         hcap.volume = { };
2825         /**
2826          * Gets the current volume level of the TV.<br>
2827          * 
2828          * @param {Object} param
2829          * <ul>
2830          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2831          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2832          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2833          *       // {Number} param.level - volume level of TV (0~100). -1 if mute
2834          *   }</pre>
2835          *   </li>
2836          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2837          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2838          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2839          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2840          *   }</pre>
2841          *   </li>
2842          * </ul>
2843          * 
2844          * @since 1.3.1
2845          * 
2846          * @see
2847          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.setVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2848          *
2849          * @example
2850          * hcap.volume.getVolumeLevel({
2851          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
2852          *          console.log("onSuccess : level = " + s.level);
2853          *      }, 
2854          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2855          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2856          *      }
2857          * });
2858          */
2859         hcap.volume.getVolumeLevel = function (param) {
2860             hcap_command("get_volume_level", param);
2861         };
2862         /**
2863          * Sets the TV volume level.<br>
2864          *
2865          * @param {Object} param
2866          * <ul>
2867          *   <li>{Number} param.level [Required] - range is 0~100 or -1 if mute.</li>
2868          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2869          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2870          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2871          *       // No Parameter.
2872          *   }</pre>
2873          *   </li>
2874          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
2875          *            Setting to the same volume level as before will invoke this callback function.<br>
2876          *            Setting to a value larger than the property "maximum_volume_level" will also invoke this callback function.
2877          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2878          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2879          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2880          *   }</pre>
2881          *   </li>
2882          * </ul>
2883          * 
2884          * @since 1.3.1
2885          * 
2886          * @see
2887          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.getVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2888          *
2889          * @example
2890          * hcap.volume.setVolumeLevel({
2891          *      "level" : 50, 
2892          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2893          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2894          *      }, 
2895          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2896          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2897          *      }
2898          * });
2899          */
2900         hcap.volume.setVolumeLevel = function (param) {
2901             hcap_command("set_volume_level", param);
2902         };
2903         /**
2904          * Gets the current volume level of the external speaker.<br>
2905          * 
2906          * @param {Object} param
2907          * <ul>
2908          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2909          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2910          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2911          *       // {Number} param.level - volume level of external speaker (0~100).
2912          *   }</pre>
2913          *   </li>
2914          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2915          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2916          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2917          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2918          *   }</pre>
2919          *   </li>
2920          * </ul>
2921          * 
2922          * @since 1.23.0
2923          * 
2924          * @see
2925          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.setExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2926          *
2927          * @example
2928          * hcap.volume.getExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel({
2929          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
2930          *          console.log("onSuccess : level = " + s.level);
2931          *      }, 
2932          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2933          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2934          *      }
2935          * });
2936          */
2937         hcap.volume.getExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel = function (param) {
2938             hcap_command("get_external_speaker_volume_level", param);
2939         };
2940         /**
2941          * Sets the external speaker volume level.<br>
2942          *
2943          * @param {Object} param
2944          * <ul>
2945          *   <li>{Number} param.level [Required] - range is 0~100.</li>
2946          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2947          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2948          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2949          *       // No Parameter.
2950          *   }</pre>
2951          *   </li>
2952          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
2953          *            Setting to the same volume level as before will invoke this callback function.<br>
2954          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2955          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2956          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2957          *   }</pre>
2958          *   </li>
2959          * </ul>
2960          * 
2961          * @since 1.23.0
2962          * 
2963          * @see
2964          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.getExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2965          *
2966          * @example
2967          * hcap.volume.setExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel({
2968          *      "level" : 50, 
2969          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2970          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2971          *      }, 
2972          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2973          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2974          *      }
2975          * });
2976          */
2977         hcap.volume.setExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel = function (param) {
2978             hcap_command("set_external_speaker_volume_level", param);
2979         };
2980         /**
2981          * Gets the current volume level of the Headphone.<br>
2982          * 
2983          * @param {Object} param
2984          * <ul>
2985          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2986          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2987          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2988          *       // {Number} param.level - volume level of Headphone (0~100).
2989          *   }</pre>
2990          *   </li>
2991          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2992          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2993          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2994          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2995          *   }</pre>
2996          *   </li>
2997          * </ul>
2998          * 
2999          * @since 1.22.0
3000          * 
3001          * @see
3002          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
3003          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
3004          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
3005          *
3006          * @example
3007          * hcap.volume.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel({
3008          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
3009          *          console.log("onSuccess : level = " + s.level);
3010          *      }, 
3011          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3012          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3013          *      }
3014          * });
3015          */
3016         hcap.volume.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel = function (param) {
3017             hcap_command("get_headphone_volume_level", param);
3018         };
3019         /**
3020          * Sets the Headphone volume level.<br>
3021          * This is worked only when the healthcare headphone mode is enabled.<br>
3022          *
3023          * @param {Object} param
3024          * <ul>
3025          *   <li>{Number} param.level [Required] - range is 0~100.</li>
3026          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
3027          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3028          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
3029          *       // No Parameter.
3030          *   }</pre>
3031          *   </li>
3032          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
3033          *            Setting to the same volume level as before will invoke this callback function.<br>
3034          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3035          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
3036          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
3037          *   }</pre>
3038          *   </li>
3039          * </ul>
3040          * 
3041          * @since 1.22.0
3042          * 
3043          * @see
3044          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
3045          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
3046          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
3047          *
3048          * @example
3049          * hcap.volume.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel({
3050          *      "level" : 50, 
3051          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3052          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3053          *      }, 
3054          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3055          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3056          *      }
3057          * });
3058          */
3059         hcap.volume.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel = function (param) {
3060             hcap_command("set_headphone_volume_level", param);
3061         };
3062         /**
3063          * Sets the healthcare headphone mode is enabled or disabled.<br>
3064          * 
3065          * @param {Object} param
3066          * <ul>
3067          *   <li>{Boolean} param.enable [Required] - true : enable to healthcare headphone mode, false : disable.</li>
3068          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
3069          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3070          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
3071          *       // No Parameter. 
3072          *   }</pre>
3073          *   </li>
3074          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
3075          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3076          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
3077          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
3078          *   }</pre>
3079          *   </li>
3080          * </ul>
3081          *  
3082          * @since 1.22.0
3083          * 
3084          * @see
3085          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
3086          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
3087          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
3088          * <a href="_global_.html#event:ui_value_changed">{Event} ui_value_changed</a><br>
3089          *
3090          * @example
3091          * hcap.volume.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode({
3092          *      "enable" : true,
3093          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3094          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3095          *      }, 
3096          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3097          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3098          *      }
3099          * });
3100          */
3101         hcap.volume.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode = function (param) {
3102             hcap_command("set_healthcare_headphone_mode", param);
3103         };
3104         /**
3105          * Gets whether healthcare headphone mode is enabled or disabled.<br>
3106          * 
3107          * @param {Object} param
3108          * <ul>
3109          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
3110          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3111          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
3112          *       // {Boolean} param.enable - true if the healthcare headphone mode is enabled. false if the healthcare headphone mode is disabled.
3113          *   }</pre>
3114          *   </li>
3115          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
3116          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3117          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
3118          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
3119          *   }</pre>
3120          *   </li>
3121          * </ul>
3122          *  
3123          * @since 1.22.0
3124          * 
3125          * @see
3126          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
3127          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
3128          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
3129          *
3130          * @example
3131          * hcap.volume.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode({
3132          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
3133          *          console.log("onSuccess : healthcare headphone mode = " + param.enable);
3134          *      }, 
3135          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3136          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3137          *      }
3138          * });
3139          */
3140         hcap.volume.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode = function (param) {
3141             hcap_command("get_healthcare_headphone_mode", param);
3142         };
3143         /**
3144          * @namespace hcap.channel
3145          */
3146         hcap.channel = {};
3147         /**
3148          * No stream PID.
3149          * @since 1.3.1
3150          * @constant
3151          */
3152         hcap.channel.NO_STREAM_PID = 0x1fff;
3153         /**
3154          * @namespace ChannelType
3155          */
3156         hcap.channel.ChannelType = {
3157             /**
3158              * Unknown channel type.
3159              * @since 1.3.1
3160              * @constant
3161              */
3162             UNKNOWN             : 0,
3163             /**
3164              * RF A/V channel type.
3165              * @since 1.3.1
3166              * @constant
3167              */
3168             RF                  : 1,
3169             /**
3170              * IP A/V channel type.
3171              * @since 1.3.1
3172              * @constant
3173              */
3174             IP                  : 2,
3175             /**
3176              * RF Data channel type.
3177              * @since 1.3.1
3178              * @constant
3179              */
3180             RF_DATA             : 3,
3181             /**
3182              * IP Data channel type.
3183              * @since 1.3.1
3184              * @constant
3185              */
3186             IP_DATA             : 4,
3187             /**
3188              * LG channel type.
3189              * @since 1.24.8
3190              * @constant
3191              */
3192             LG             		: 5
3193         };
3194         /**
3195          * @namespace hcap.channel.Polarization
3196          */
3197         hcap.channel.Polarization = {
3198             /**
3199              * Unknown Polarization.
3200              * @since 1.12.0
3201              * @constant
3202              */
3203             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
3204             /**
3205              * Vertical mode.
3206              * @since 1.12.0
3207              * @constant
3208              */
3209             VERTICAL : 0x01,
3210             /**
3211              * Horizontal mode.
3212              * @since 1.12.0
3213              * @constant
3214              */
3215             HORIZONTAL : 0x02,
3216             /**
3217              * Left hand circular mode.
3218              * @since 1.12.0
3219              * @constant
3220              */
3221             LEFT_HAND_CIRCULAR : 0x03,
3222             /**
3223              * Right hand circular mode.
3224              * @since 1.12.0
3225              * @constant
3226              */
3227             RIGHT_HAND_CIRCULAR : 0x04
3228         };
3229         /**
3230          * @namespace hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType
3231          */
3232         hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType = {
3233             /**
3234              * Unknown RF broadcast type.
3235              * @since 1.3.1
3236              * @constant
3237              */
3238             UNKNOWN        : 0x00,
3239             /**
3240              * (North America) ATSC, (Europe) DVB-T , (Japan/South America) ISDB-T;
3241              * @since 1.3.1
3242              * @constant
3243              */
3244             TERRESTRIAL    : 0x10,
3245             /**
3246              * (Europe) DVB-T2;
3247              * @since 1.18.4
3248              * @constant
3249              */
3250             TERRESTRIAL_2  : 0x11,
3251             /**
3252              * (Europe) DVB-S , (Japan/South America) ISDB-S.
3253              * @since 1.3.1
3254              * @constant
3255              */
3256             SATELLITE      : 0x20,
3257             /**
3258              * (Europe) DVB-S2.
3259              * @since 1.12.0
3260              * @constant
3261              */
3262             SATELLITE_2      : 0x21,
3263             /**
3264              * (Japan) ISDB-CS1.
3265              * @since 1.23.2
3266              * @constant
3267              */
3268             SATELLITE_CS1      : 0x22,
3269             /**
3270              * (Japan) ISDB-CS2.
3271              * @since 1.23.2
3272              * @constant
3273              */
3274             SATELLITE_CS2      : 0x23,
3275             /**
3276              * (Japan) ISDB-S3 BS.
3277              * @since 1.23.2
3278              * @constant
3279              */
3280             SATELLITE_S3_BS      : 0x24,
3281             /**
3282              * (Japan) ISDB-S3 CS.
3283              * @since 1.23.2
3284              * @constant
3285              */
3286             SATELLITE_S3_CS      : 0x25,
3287             /**
3288              * (North America) ATSC, (Europe) DVB-C , (Japan/South America) ISDB-C.
3289              * @since 1.3.1
3290              * @constant
3291              */
3292             CABLE          : 0x30,
3293             /**
3294              * (North America) Cable - Standard.
3295              * @since 1.3.1
3296              * @constant
3297              */
3298             CABLE_STD      : 0x31,
3299             /**
3300              * (North America) Cable - Harmonic related carrier.
3301              * @since 1.3.1
3302              * @constant
3303              */
3304             CABLE_HRC      : 0x32,
3305             /**
3306              * (North America) Cable - Incremental related carrier.
3307              * @since 1.3.1
3308              * @constant
3309              */
3310             CABLE_IRC      : 0x33,
3311             /**
3312              * Analog - Phase Alternating Line BG.
3313              * @since 1.6.0
3314              * @constant
3315              */
3316             ANALOG_PAL_BG  : 0x40,
3317             /**
3318              * Analog - Phase Alternating Line DK.
3319              * @since 1.6.0
3320              * @constant
3321              */
3322             ANALOG_PAL_DK  : 0x41,
3323             /**
3324              * Analog - Phase Alternating Line I.
3325              * @since 1.6.0
3326              * @constant
3327              */
3328             ANALOG_PAL_I   : 0x42,
3329             /**
3330              * Analog - Phase Alternating Line M.
3331              * @since 1.6.0
3332              * @constant
3333              */
3334             ANALOG_PAL_M   : 0x43,
3335             /**
3336              * Analog - Phase Alternating Line N.
3337              * @since 1.6.0
3338              * @constant
3339              */
3340             ANALOG_PAL_N   : 0x44,
3341             /**
3342              * Analog - SECAM BG.
3343              * @since 1.6.0
3344              * @constant
3345              */
3346             ANALOG_SECAM_BG : 0x45,
3347             /**
3348              * Analog - SECAM DK.
3349              * @since 1.6.0
3350              * @constant
3351              */
3352             ANALOG_SECAM_DK : 0x46,
3353             /**
3354              * Analog - SECAM L.
3355              * @since 1.6.0
3356              * @constant
3357              */
3358             ANALOG_SECAM_L : 0x47,
3359             /**
3360              * (North America) Analog television system that is used in most of North America.
3361              * @since 1.6.0
3362              * @constant
3363              */
3364             ANALOG_NTSC    : 0x48,
3365             /**
3366              * AIR ATSC 3.0 channel
3367              * @since 1.21.0
3368              * @constant
3369              */
3370             TERRESTRIAL_ATSC3    : 0x50,
3371             /**
3372              * CABLE ATSC 3.0 channel
3373              * @since 1.21.0
3374              * @constant
3375              */
3376             CABLE_ATSC3    : 0x51     
3377         };
3378         /**
3379          * @namespace hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType
3380          */
3381         hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType = {
3382             /**
3383              * Unknown IP broadcast type.
3384              * @since 1.3.1
3385              * @constant
3386              */
3387             UNKNOWN        : 0x00,
3388             /**
3389              * UDP broadcast type in IP channel.
3390              * @since 1.3.1
3391              * @constant
3392              */
3393             UDP            : 0x10,
3394             /**
3395              * RTP broadcast type in IP channel.
3396              * @since 1.3.1
3397              * @constant
3398              */
3399             RTP            : 0x20
3400         };
3401         /**
3402          * @namespace hcap.channel.VideoStreamType
3403          */
3404         hcap.channel.VideoStreamType = {
3405             /**
3406              * ISO/IEC 11172-2 MPEG-1 Part2: VIDEO.
3407              * @since 1.3.1
3408              * @constant
3409              */
3410             MPEG1          : 0x01,
3411             /**
3412              * ISO/IEC 13818-2 MPEG-2 Part2: VIDEO.
3413              * @since 1.3.1
3414              * @constant
3415              */
3416             MPEG2          : 0x02,
3417             /**
3418              * ISO/IEC 14496-2 MPEG-4 Part2: VISUAL.
3419              * @since 1.3.1
3420              * @constant
3421              */
3422             MPEG4_VISUAL   : 0x10,
3423             /**
3424              * ISO/IEC 14496-10 MPEG-4 Part10: AVC/ITU-T H.264.
3425              * @since 1.3.1
3426              * @constant
3427              */
3428             MPEG4_AVC_H264 : 0x1B,
3429             /**
3430              * ISO/IEC 23008-2: ITU-T H.265.
3431              * @since 1.19.0
3432              * @constant
3433              */
3434             HEVC           : 0x24,
3435             /**
3436              * AVS Video.
3437              * @since 1.3.1
3438              * @constant
3439              */
3440             AVS            : 0x42
3441         };
3442         /**
3443          * @namespace hcap.channel.AudioStreamType
3444          */
3445         hcap.channel.AudioStreamType = {
3446             /**
3447              * ISO/IEC 11172-3 MPEG-1 Part3: AUDIO
3448              * @since 1.3.1
3449              * @constant
3450              */
3451             MPEG1          : 0x03,
3452             /**
3453              * ISO/IEC 13818-3 MPEG-2 Part3: AUDIO
3454              * @since 1.3.1
3455              * @constant
3456              */
3457             MPEG2          : 0x04,
3458             /**
3459              * ISO/IEC 13818-7 MPEG-2 Part7: AAC.
3460              * @since 1.3.1
3461              * @constant
3462              */
3463             MPEG2_AAC      : 0x0F,
3464             /**
3465              * ISO/IEC 14496-3 MPEG-4 Part3: AUDIO AAC/HEAAC.
3466              * @since 1.3.1
3467              * @constant
3468              */
3469             MPEG4_HEAAC    : 0x11,
3470             /**
3471              * DOLBY AC-3_AUDIO.
3472              * @since 1.3.1
3473              * @constant
3474              */
3475             AC3            : 0x81,
3476             /**
3477              * DOLBY AC-3+(E-AC3).
3478              * @since 1.3.1
3479              * @constant
3480              */
3481             EAC3           : 0x82,
3482             /**
3483              * deprecated since 1.6.0
3484              * @constant
3485              */
3486             ANALOG_BG      : 0x100,
3487             /**
3488              * deprecated since 1.6.0
3489              * @constant
3490              */
3491             ANALOG_I       : 0x101,
3492             /**
3493              * deprecated since 1.6.0
3494              * @constant
3495              */
3496             ANALOG_DK      : 0x102,
3497             /**
3498              * deprecated since 1.6.0
3499              * @constant
3500              */
3501             ANALOG_L       : 0x103,
3502             /**
3503              * deprecated since 1.6.0
3504              * @constant
3505              */
3506             ANALOG_MN      : 0x104,
3507             /**
3508              * deprecated since 1.6.0
3509              * @constant
3510              */
3511             ANALOG_LP      : 0x105,
3512             /**
3513              * deprecated since 1.6.0
3514              * @constant
3515              */
3516             ANALOG_END     : 0x106
3517         };
3518         /**
3519          * @namespace hcap.channel.InbandDataServiceType
3520          */
3521         hcap.channel.InbandDataServiceType = {
3522             /**
3523              * Unknown inband data service type.
3524              * @since 1.6.0
3525              * @constant
3526              */
3527             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
3528             /**
3529              * MHP.
3530              * @since 1.6.0
3531              * @constant
3532              */
3533             MHP : 0x01,
3534             /**
3535              * MHEG.
3536              * @since 1.6.0
3537              * @constant
3538              */
3539             MHEG : 0x02,
3540             /**
3541              * HBBTV.
3542              * @since 1.6.0
3543              * @constant
3544              */
3545             HBBTV : 0x03,
3546             /**
3547              * There is no data service.
3548              * @since 1.8.0
3549              * @constant
3550              */
3551             NONE : 0x04
3552         };
3553         /**
3554          * @namespace hcap.channel.ChannelStatus
3555          */
3556         hcap.channel.ChannelStatus = {
3557             /**
3558              * Unknown channel status.
3559              * @since 1.12.0
3560              * @constant
3561              */
3562             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
3563             /**
3564              * Audio and video are not blocked.
3565              * @since 1.14.0
3566              * @constant
3567              */
3568             AUDIO_VIDEO_NOT_BLOCKED : 0x10,
3569             AV_DISPLAYED : 0x10,
3570             /**
3571              * Audio and video are blocked.
3572              * @since 1.14.0
3573              * @constant
3574              */
3575             AUDIO_VIDEO_BLOCKED : 0x21,
3576             NO_SIGNAL : 0x21,
3577             /**
3578              * Only audio is blocked.
3579              * @since 1.14.0
3580              * @constant
3581              */
3582             AUDIO_ONLY_BLOCKED : 0x22,
3583             /**
3584              * Only video is blocked.
3585              * @since 1.14.0
3586              * @constant
3587              */
3588             VIDEO_ONLY_BLOCKED : 0x23
3589         };
3590         /**
3591          * Requests to change the current channel.<br>
3592          * The result for the channel change operation can be obtained by registering the 
3593          * <a href="_global_.html#event:channel_changed">{Event} channel_changed</a><br><br>
3594          * 
3595          * For channel parameters, TV will support only one channel class.<br><br>
3596          *
3597          * <div align=center>
3598          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=850>
3599          *   <thead>
3600          *     <tr><th colspan="3">Channel Class & Parameters</th></tr>
3601          *   </thead>
3602          *   <tbody>
3603          *     <tr class="odd"><th rowspan="8">AV Channel</th>
3604          *                     <th class="left">RF channel class 1 (supported in only US model)</th><td class="left">logicalNumber</td></tr>
3605          *     <tr            ><th class="left">RF channel class 2 (supported in only EU model)</th><td class="left">frequency + programNumber. <br>(* for analog channel, programNumber=0)</td></tr>
3606          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="left">RF channel class 3 (supported in both US model and ISDB model)</th><td class="left">majorNumber(physicalNumber) + minorNumber(SVCID) <br>(* for analog channel, minorNumber=0)</td></tr>
3607          *     <tr            ><th class="left">RF channel class 4 (supported in only EU model)</th><td class="left">frequency + programNumber + satelliteId + polarization</td></tr>
3608          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="left">RF channel class 5 (supported in only EU model)</th><td class="left">frequency + programNumber + plpId. (rfBroadcastType = hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_2)</td></tr>
3609          *     <tr            ><th class="left">RF channel class 6 (supported in only US model)</th><td class="left">majorNumber + minorNumber + plpId. (rfBroadcastType = hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_ATSC3, hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.CABLE_ATSC3)</td></tr>
3610          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="left">IP channel class 1 (supported in only US model)</th><td class="left">logicalNumber</td></tr>
3611          *     <tr            ><th class="left">IP channel class 2 (supported in both EU model and US model)</th><td class="left">ip + port</td></tr>
3612          *     
3613          *     <tr class="odd"><th rowspan="4">Data Channel</th>
3614          *                     <th class="left">RF channel class 1 (not supported)</th><td class="left"> </td></tr>
3615          *     <tr            ><th class="left">RF channel class 2 (supported in both EU model and US model)</th><td class="left">frequency + programNumber (required)</td></tr>
3616          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="left">IP channel class 1 (not supported)</th><td class="left"> </td></tr>
3617          *     <tr            ><th class="left">IP channel class 2 (supported in both EU model and US model)</th><td class="left">ip + port (required)</td></tr>
3618          *     
3619          *   </tbody>
3620          * </table>
3621          * </div>
3622          * <br>
3623          * 
3624          * If a channel with more than one Channel Class is requested to change, then next priority table will be applied.<br>
3625          * RF channel class 1 is 'X' when logicalNumber is 0.<br>
3626          * RF channel class 2 is 'X' when frequency is 0.<br>
3627          * RF channel class 3 is 'X' when majorNumber is 0.<br>
3628          * RF channel class 4 is 'X' when satelliteId is 0.<br>
3629          * IP channel class 1 is 'X' when logicalNumber is 0.<br>
3630          * IP channel class 2 is 'X' when ip is "0" and port is 0.<br>
3631          * RF channel class 5 is only when the channel type is hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_2 and only frequency + programNumber + plpId take affect.<br>
3632          * RF channel class 6 is only when the channel type is hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_ATSC3 or hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.CABLE_ATSC3 and only majorNumber + minorNumber + plpId take affect.<br>
3633          * Other cases than following table will be treated as invalid channel combinations.<br>
3634          *
3635          * <div align=center>
3636          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=850>
3637          *   <thead>
3638          *     <tr>
3639          *       <th>RF channel class 1<br> (logicalNumber)</th>
3640          *       <th>RF channel class 2<br> (frequency + programNumber)</th>
3641          *       <th>RF channel class 3<br> (majorNumber + minorNumber)</th>
3642          *       <th>RF channel class 4<br> (frequency + programNumber + satelliteId + polarization)</th>
3643          *       <th>Effective Channel Class</th>
3644          *     </tr>
3645          *   </thead>
3646          *   <tbody>
3647          *     <tr class="odd"><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 1</td></tr>
3648          *     <tr            ><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 1</td></tr>
3649          *     <tr class="odd"><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 2</td></tr>
3650          *     <tr            ><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 3</td></tr>
3651          *     <tr class="odd"><td>X</td><td>-</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>RF channel class 4</td></tr>
3652          *     <tr            ><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 2</td></tr>
3653          *     <tr class="odd"><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 3</td></tr>
3654          *     <tr            ><td>O</td><td>-</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>RF channel class 4</td></tr>
3655          *   </tbody>
3656          *   <tfoot>
3657          *     <tr><th colspan="5">RF Channel</th></tr>
3658          *   </tfoot>
3659          * </table>
3660          * </div>
3661          * <br>
3662          *    
3663          * <div align=center>
3664          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=850>
3665          *   <thead>
3666          *     <tr>
3667          *       <th>IP channel class 1<br> (logicalNumber)</th>
3668          *       <th>IP channel class 2<br> (ip + port)</th>
3669          *       <th>Effective Channel Class</th>
3670          *     </tr>
3671          *   </thead>
3672          *   <tbody>
3673          *     <tr class="odd"><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>IP channel class 1</td></tr>
3674          *     <tr            ><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>IP channel class 1</td></tr>
3675          *     <tr class="odd"><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>IP channel class 2</td></tr>
3676          *     <tr            ><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>IP channel class 2</td></tr>
3677          *   </tbody>
3678          *   <tfoot>
3679          *     <tr><th colspan="3">IP Channel</th></tr>
3680          *   </tfoot>
3681          * </table>
3682          * </div>
3683          * <br>
3684          * 
3685          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a> gets the AV (RF/IP) channel information which 
3686          * includes supported channel class information and optional parameters, 
3687          * but unsupported channel classes are filled with 0.<br>
3688          * <br>
3689          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a> gets the DATA (RF/IP) channel information which 
3690          * includes supported channel class information, but other channel classes 
3691          * and optional parameters are filled with 0.<br>
3692          * <br>
3693          * Result objects for <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a> and <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a> 
3694          * have following information.<br>
3695          * <br>
3696          * <div align=center id=".CHANNEL_TYPE">
3697          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=850>
3698          *   <thead>
3699          *     <tr><th>Channel Type</th><th>Description</th></tr>
3700          *   </thead>
3701          *   <tbody>
3702          *     <tr class="odd">
3703          *        <th class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#.RF">hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF</a></th>
3704          *        <td class="left">Defines AV channel via RF signal.</td>
3705          *     </tr>
3706          *     <tr>
3707          *        <th class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#.IP">hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP</a></th>
3708          *        <td class="left">Defines AV channel via IP network to support IPTV.</td>
3709          *     </tr>
3710          *     <tr class="odd">
3711          *        <th class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#.RF_DATA">hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF_DATA</a></th>
3712          *        <td class="left">Defines data channel via RF signal. Applications can download some carousel data.</td>
3713          *     </tr>
3714          *     <tr>
3715          *       <th class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#.IP_DATA">hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP_DATA</a></th>
3716          *       <td class="left">Defines data channel via IP network.
3717          *       <table class="hcap_spec">
3718          *         <thead>
3719          *           <tr><th colspan=2>Data channel operation in IP address range</th></tr>
3720          *         </thead>
3721          *         <tbody>
3722          *           <tr class="odd">
3723          *             <th class="left">Unicast IP Address</th>
3724          *             <td class="left">Applications can download some data from Pro:Centric server using HTTP protocol.</td>
3725          *           </tr>
3726          *           <tr>
3727          *             <th class="left">Multicast IP Address<br>(224.0.0.0 ~<br> 239.255.255.255)</th>
3728          *             <td class="left">RF broadcast data will be sent via IP multicast [TS(Transport Stream) over IP multicast].<br>
3729          *               In this mode, carousel download operation is same as <a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#.RF_DATA">hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF_DATA</a><br>
3730          *               In this case, HCAP URL can use the special frequency# '1' for this virtual RF channel.<br>
3731          *             </td>
3732          *           </tr>
3733          *         </tbody>
3734          *       </table>
3735          *       </td>
3736          *     </tr>
3737          *   </tbody>
3738          *   <tfoot>
3739          *     <tr><th colspan="2">Channel Type</td></tr>
3740          *   </tfoot>
3741          * </table>
3742          * </div>
3743          * 
3744          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel() for IP DATA channel returns false because it has no effect.<br>
3745          * <br>
3746          * If following option fields are filled correctly in the input object, 
3747          * AV channel change performance will be improved.
3748          * 
3749          * <ul>
3750          * <li>symbolRate</li>
3751          * <li>pcrPid, videoPid</li>
3752          * <li>videoStreamType</li>
3753          * <li>audioPid</li>
3754          * <li>audioStreamType</li>
3755          * <ul>
3756          * <br>
3757          * 
3758          * <div align=center id=".CHANNEL_PROPERTY">
3759          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=850>
3760          *   <thead>
3761          *     <tr>            <th>Property Name                </th><th>Type   </th><th>Req<br>uired</th><th>RF</th><th>IP</th><th>RF<br>DATA</th><th>IP<br>DATA</th><th>Value                                                                                    </th><th>Description</th></tr>
3762          *   </thead>
3763          *   <tbody>
3764          *     <tr class="odd"><td>channelType                  </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>O         </td><td>O         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html">hcap.channel.ChannelType</a><br>    </td><td class="left">Channel type indicator</td></tr>
3765          *     <tr            ><td>logicalNumber                </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Logical channel number</td></tr>
3766          *     <tr class="odd"><td>frequency                    </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^32 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Frequency <br>(Hz, and MHz for satellite)</td></tr>
3767          *     <tr            ><td>programNumber                </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Program number <br>(0 for analog channel)</td></tr>
3768          *     <tr class="odd"><td>programNumber                </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>X </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Specific program number in IP Stream</td></tr>
3769          *     <tr            ><td>majorNumber                  </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Major channel number<br>(physical Number)</td></tr>
3770          *     <tr class="odd"><td>minorNumber                  </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Minor channel number<br>(service ID, SVCID)</td></tr>
3771          *     <tr            ><td>satelliteId                  </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Satellite setting ID</td></tr>
3772          *     <tr class="odd"><td>polarization                 </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.Polarization.html">hcap.channel.Polarization</a>      </td><td class="left">Polarization mode</td></tr>
3773          *     <tr            ><td>plpId                        </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 0xFF                                                                    </td><td class="left">PLP (Physical Layer Pipe) ID</td></tr>
3774          *     <tr class="odd"><td>rfBroadcastType              </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.html">hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType</a></td><td class="left">RF broadcast type</td></tr>
3775          *     <tr            ><td>ip                           </td><td>String </td><td>O           </td><td>X </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>O         </td><td class="left">[0~255].[0~255].[0~255].[0~255]                                             </td><td class="left">IP address value</td></tr>
3776          *     <tr class="odd"><td>port                         </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>X </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>O         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Port number</td></tr>
3777          *     <tr            ><td>ipBroadcastType              </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>X </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType.html">hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType</a></td><td class="left">IP broadcast type <br>(default is UDP)</td></tr>
3778          *     <tr class="odd"><td>symbolRate                   </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^32 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Symbol rate (Bd)</td></tr>
3779          *     <tr            ><td>pcrPid                       </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^13 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">PCR(Program Clock Reference)Packet ID</td></tr>
3780          *     <tr class="odd"><td>videoPid                     </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^13 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Video packet ID (<a href="hcap.channel.html">hcap.channel.NO_STREAM_PID</a> for audio only channel)</td></tr>
3781          *     <tr            ><td>videoStreamType              </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.VideoStreamType.html">hcap.channel.VideoStreamType</a></td><td class="left">Video stream type</td></tr>
3782          *     <tr class="odd"><td>audioPid                     </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^13 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Audio packet ID</td></tr>
3783          *     <tr            ><td>audioStreamType              </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.AudioStreamType.html">hcap.channel.AudioStreamType</a></td><td class="left">Audio stream type</td></tr>
3784          *     <tr class="odd"><td>signalStrength<br>(read only)</td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 255                                                                     </td><td class="left">Channel signal strength</td></tr>
3785          *     <tr            ><td>sourceAddress                </td><td>String </td><td>X           </td><td>X </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">[0~255].[0~255].[0~255].[0~255]                                             </td><td class="left">Source IP address for IGMPv3</td></tr>
3786          *   </tbody>
3787          *   <tfoot>
3788          *     <tr><th colspan="9">Channel Property</td></tr>
3789          *   </tfoot>
3790          * </table>
3791          * </div>
3792          * 
3793          * Below are a few examples for channel change request for different channel classes
3794          * @example
3795          * // RF channel class 1 change request
3796          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3797          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF, 
3798          *      "logicalNumber" : 7, 
3799          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL, 
3800          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3801          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3802          *      }, 
3803          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3804          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3805          *      }
3806          * });
3807          *
3808          * @example
3809          * // RF channel class 2 change request
3810          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3811          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF, 
3812          *      "frequency" : 63000000, 
3813          *      "programNumber" : 1, 
3814          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL, 
3815          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3816          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3817          *      }, 
3818          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3819          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3820          *      }
3821          * });
3822          *
3823          * @example
3824          * // RF channel class 3 change request
3825          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3826          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF, 
3827          *      "majorNumber" : 9, 
3828          *      "minorNumber" : 1, 
3829          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL, 
3830          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3831          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3832          *      }, 
3833          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3834          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3835          *      }
3836          * });
3837          * 
3838          * @example
3839          * // RF channel class 4 change request
3840          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3841          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF,
3842          *      "frequency" : 63000, 
3843          *      "programNumber" : 1, 
3844          *      "symbolRate" : 23000,
3845          *      "satelliteId" : 1,
3846          *      "polarization" : hcap.channel.Polarization.VERTICAL,
3847          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.SATELLITE_2, 
3848          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3849          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3850          *      }, 
3851          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3852          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3853          *      }
3854          * });
3855          *
3856          * @example
3857          * // RF channel class 5 change request
3858          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3859          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF,
3860          *      "frequency" : 63000000, 
3861          *      "programNumber" : 1, 
3862          *      "plpId" : 3,
3863          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_2, 
3864          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3865          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3866          *      }, 
3867          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3868          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3869          *      }
3870          * });
3871          *
3872          * @example
3873          * // RF channel class 6 change request
3874          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3875          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF,
3876          *      "majorNumber" : 9, 
3877          *      "minorNumber" : 1, 
3878          *      "plpId" : 3,
3879          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_ATSC3, 
3880          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3881          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3882          *      }, 
3883          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3884          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3885          *      }
3886          * });
3887          *
3888          * @example
3889          * // IP channel class 1 change request
3890          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3891          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP, 
3892          *      "logicalNumber" : 9,
3893          *      "ipBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType.UDP, 
3894          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3895          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3896          *      }, 
3897          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3898          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3899          *      }
3900          * });
3901          * 
3902          * @example
3903          * // IP channel class 2 change request
3904          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3905          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP, 
3906          *      "ip" : "1.2.3.4",
3907          *      "port" : 3333,
3908          *      "ipBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType.UDP, 
3909          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3910          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3911          *      }, 
3912          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3913          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3914          *      }
3915          * });
3916          * 
3917          * @example
3918          * // IP channel class 2 change request with optional property
3919          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3920          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP, 
3921          *      "ip" : "1.2.3.4",
3922          *      "port" : 3333,
3923          *      "prcPid" : 100,
3924          *      "videoPid" : 200,
3925          *      "videoStreamType" : hcap.channel.VideoStreamType.MPEG2,
3926          *      "audioPid" : 400,
3927          *      "audioStreamType" : hcap.channel.AudioStreamType.MPEG2,
3928          *      "ipBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType.UDP, 
3929          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3930          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3931          *      }, 
3932          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3933          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3934          *      }
3935          * });
3936          * 
3937          * @param {Object} param
3938          * <ul>
3939          *   <li><a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.html#.CHANNEL_PROPERTY">{ Channel Properties } [Required] - Channel Information</a></li>
3940          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
3941          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3942          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
3943          *       // No Parameter.
3944          *   }</pre>
3945          *   </li>
3946          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
3947          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3948          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
3949          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
3950          *   }</pre>
3951          *   </li>
3952          * </ul>
3953          * 
3954          * @since 1.3.1
3955          * 
3956          * @see
3957          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3958          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3959          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.replayCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3960          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.stopCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3961          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a><br>
3962          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getChannelMap">hcap.channel.getChannelMap()</a><br>
3963          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getStartChannel">hcap.channel.getStartChannel()</a><br>
3964          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.setStartChannel">hcap.channel.setStartChannel()</a><br>
3965          * <a href="_global_.html#event:channel_changed">{Event} channel_changed</a><br>
3966          */
3967         hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel = function (param) {
3968             hcap_command("request_channel_change", param);
3969         };
3970         /**
3971          * Gets the current channel information.<br>
3972          * For detailed information, such as, example and related information, 
3973          * please refer to <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3974          * 
3975          * @example
3976          * hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel({
3977          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
3978          *          console.log("onSuccess :" + 
3979          *              "\n channel status    : " + s.channelStatus   +
3980          *              "\n channel type      : " + s.channelType     +
3981          *              "\n logical number    : " + s.logicalNumber   +
3982          *              "\n frequency         : " + s.frequency       +
3983          *              "\n program number    : " + s.programNumber   +
3984          *              "\n major number      : " + s.majorNumber     +
3985          *              "\n minor number      : " + s.minorNumber     +
3986          *              "\n satellite ID      : " + s.satelliteId     +
3987          *              "\n polarization      : " + s.polarization    +
3988          *              "\n rf broadcast type : " + s.rfBroadcastType +
3989          *              "\n ip                : " + s.ip              +
3990          *              "\n port              : " + s.port            +
3991          *              "\n ip broadcast type : " + s.ipBroadcastType +
3992          *              "\n symbol rate       : " + s.symbolRate      +
3993          *              "\n pcr pid           : " + s.pcrPid          +
3994          *              "\n video pid         : " + s.videoPid        +
3995          *              "\n video stream type : " + s.videoStreamType +
3996          *              "\n audio pid         : " + s.audioPid        +
3997          *              "\n audio stream type : " + s.audioStreamType +
3998          *              "\n signal strength   : " + s.signalStrength  +
3999          *              "\n source address    : " + s.sourceAddress);
4000          *      }, 
4001          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
4002          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
4003          *      }
4004          * });
4005          * 
4006          * @param {Object} param
4007          * <ul>
4008          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
4009          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
4010          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
4011          *       // {Number} [since 1.12.0] param.channelStatus - current channel status in <a href="hcap.channel.ChannelStatus.html">hcap.channel.ChannelStatus</a>.
4012          *       // see the <a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.html#.CHANNEL_PROPERTY">{ Channel Properties }</a> in <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a>.
4013          *   }</pre>
4014          *   </li>
4015          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
4016          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
4017          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
4018          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
4019          *   }</pre>
4020          *   </li>
4021          * </ul>
4022          * 
4023          * @since 1.3.1
4024          * 
4025          * @see
4026          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4027          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4028          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.replayCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4029          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.stopCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4030          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a><br>
4031          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getChannelMap">hcap.channel.getChannelMap()</a><br>
4032          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getStartChannel">hcap.channel.getStartChannel()</a><br>
4033          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.setStartChannel">hcap.channel.setStartChannel()</a><br>
4034          * <a href="_global_.html#event:channel_changed">{Event} channel_changed</a><br>
4035          */
4036         hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel = function (param) {
4037             hcap_command("get_current_channel", param);
4038         };
4039         /**
4040          * Replays the current stopped channel.
4041          * <ul>
4042          * <li>RF channel : restart channel tuning and replays AV.</li>
4043          * <li>IP channel : join IP multicast group and replays AV.</li>
4044          * </ul>
4045          * 
4046          * @param {Object} param
4047          * <ul>
4048          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
4049          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
4050          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
4051          *       // no parameter.
4052          *   }</pre>
4053          *   </li>
4054          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
4055          *            Replaying already playing channel, or for operation failure
4056          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
4057          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
4058          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
4059          *   }</pre>
4060          *   </li>
4061          * </ul>
4062          * 
4063          * @since 1.3.1
4064          * 
4065          * @see
4066          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4067          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4068          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.replayCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4069          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.stopCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4070          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a><br>
4071          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getChannelMap">hcap.channel.getChannelMap()</a><br>
4072          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getStartChannel">hcap.channel.getStartChannel()</a><br>
4073          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.setStartChannel">hcap.channel.setStartChannel()</a><br>
4074          * <a href="_global_.html#event:channel_changed">{Event} channel_changed</a><br>
4075          * 
4076          * @example
4077          * hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel({
4078          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
4079          *          console.log("onSuccess");
4080          *      }, 
4081          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
4082          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
4083          *      }
4084          * });
4085          */
4086         hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel = function (param) {
4087             hcap_command("replay_current_channel", param);
4088         };
4089         /**
4090          * Stops AV play of the current channel.
4091          * <ul>
4092          * <li>RF channel : Stops RF tuning and stops playing AV.</li>
4093          * <li>IP channel : Leaves IP multicast group and stops playing AV.</li>
4094          * </ul>
4095          * <br>
4096          * This API has only an effect on the current channel.<br>
4097          * When the channel is changed, new channel will be played.<br>
4098          * 
4099          * To replay the current channel, use <a href="hcap.channel.html#.replayCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel()</a>.
4100          * 
4101          * @param {Object} param
4102          * <ul>
4103          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
4104          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
4105          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
4106          *       // no parameter.
4107          *   }</pre>
4108          *   </li>
4109          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
4110          *            Stopping already stopped channel will invoke this callback function.
4111          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
4112          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
4113          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
4114          *   }</pre>
4115          *   </li>
4116          * </ul>
4117          * 
4118          * @since 1.3.1
4119          * 
4120          * @see
4121          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4122          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4123          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.replayCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4124          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.stopCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel()</a><br>
4125          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a><br>
4126          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getChannelMap">hcap.channel.getChannelMap()</a><br>
4127          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getStartChannel">hcap.channel.getStartChannel()</a><br>
4128          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.setStartChannel">hcap.channel.setStartChannel()</a><br>
4129          * <a href="_global_.html#event:channel_changed">{Event} channel_changed</a><br>
4130          * 
4131          * @example
4132          * hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel({
4133          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
4134          *          console.log("onSuccess");
4135          *      }, 
4136          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
4137          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
4138          *      }
4139          * });
4140          */
4141         hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel = function (param) {
4142             hcap_command("stop_current_channel", param);
4143         };
4144         /**
4145          * Gets information about the Pro:Centric data channel(RF Channel or IP Channel),
4146          * which is the channel used to download applications.
4147          * In case of RF Data Channel, only frequency and program number are valid in channel information.
4148          * 
4149          * @example
4150          * hcap.channel.getDataChannel({
4151          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
4152          *          if (s.channelType === hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF_DATA) {
4153          *              console.log("onSuccess :" + 
4154          *                  "\n frequency         " + s.frequency       +
4155          *                  "\n program number    " + s.programNumber);
4156          *          } else if (s.channelType === hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP_DATA) {
4157          *              console.log("onSuccess :" + 
4158          *                  "\n ip                " + s.ip              +
4159          *                  "\n port              " + s.port);
4160          *          } else {
4161          *              console.log("unknown channel type");
4162          *          }
4163          *      },
4164          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
4165          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
4166          *      }
4167          * });
4168          * 
4169          * @param {Object} param
4170          * <ul>
4171          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
4172          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
4173          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
4174          *       // see the <a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.html#.CHANNEL_PROPERTY">{ Channel Properties }</a> in <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a>.
4175          *   }</pre>
4176          *   </li>
4177          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
4178          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
4179          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
