5619          * @since 1.3.1
5620          * 
5621          * @see
5622          * <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a><br>
5623          * <a href="hcap.power.html#.isWarmUpdate">hcap.power.isWarmUpdate()</a><br>
5624          * <a href="hcap.power.PowerMode.html#.WARM">hcap.power.PowerMode.WARM</a><br>
5625          * <a href="hcap.power.PowerMode.html#.NORMAL">hcap.power.PowerMode.NORMAL</a>
5626          *
5627          * @example
5628          * hcap.power.getPowerMode({
5629          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
5630          *          console.log("onSuccess power mode " + s.mode);
5631          *      }, 
5632          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5633          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5634          *      }
5635          * });
5636          */
5637         hcap.power.getPowerMode = function (param) {
5638             hcap_command("get_power_mode", param);
5639         };
5640         /**
5641          * Sets the power mode of the TV.
5642          *
5643          * @param {Object} param
5644          * <ul>
5645          *   <li>{Number} param.mode [Required] - power mode to be set for TV. Possible values are followings.
5646          * <div align=center>
5647          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=600>
5648          *   <thead>
5649          *     <tr><th>mode</th><th>value</th><th>description</th></tr>
5650          *   </thead>
5651          *   <tbody>
5652          *     <tr class="odd"><th>Standby mode </th><td> - </td><td>TV is off</td></tr>
5653          *     <tr><th>Normal mode</th><td><a href="hcap.power.PowerMode.html#.NORMAL">hcap.power.PowerMode.NORMAL</td><td class="left">the board and the panel is on</td></tr>
5654          *     <tr><th>Warm mode</th><td><a href="hcap.power.PowerMode.html#.WARM">hcap.power.PowerMode.WARM</td><td class="left">the board is alive but the panel is off</td></tr>
5655          *   </tbody>
5656          *   <tfoot>
5657          *     <tr><th colspan="3">Power mode of TV</td></tr>
5658          *   </tfoot>
5659          * </table>
5660          * </div></li>
5661          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5662          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5663          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
5664          *       // No Parameter.
5665          *   }</pre>
5666          *   </li>
5667          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
5668          *        Setting to the same power mode as before will invoke this callback function. 
5669          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5670          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5671          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5672          *   }</pre>
5673          *   </li>
5674          * </ul>
5675          *  
5676          * @since 1.3.1
5677          * 
5678          * @see
5679          * <a href="hcap.power.html#.getPowerMode">hcap.power.getPowerMode()</a><br>
5680          * <a href="hcap.power.html#.isWarmUpdate">hcap.power.isWarmUpdate()</a><br>
5681          * <a href="hcap.power.PowerMode.html#.WARM">hcap.power.PowerMode.WARM</a><br>
5682          * <a href="hcap.power.PowerMode.html#.NORMAL">hcap.power.PowerMode.NORMAL</a>
5683          *
5684          * @example
5685          * hcap.power.setPowerMode({
5686          *      "mode" : hcap.power.PowerMode.WARM,
5687          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
5688          *          console.log("onSuccess");
5689          *      }, 
5690          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5691          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5692          *      }
5693          * });
5694          */
5695         hcap.power.setPowerMode = function (param) {
5696             hcap_command("set_power_mode", param);
5697         };
5698         /**
5699          * Gets whether TV power is in warm update or not.<br>
5700          * "warm update" means the duration from starting HCAP application upgrade and EZ-I upgrade in the power WARM state to the power STANDBY.
5701          *
5702          * @param {Object} param
5703          * <ul>
5704          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5705          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5706          *   param.onSuccess = function(param) {
5707          *       // {Boolean} param.isWarmUpdate - true : TV power is in warm update, otherwise false.
5708          *   }</pre>
5709          *   </li>
5710          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5711          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5712          *   param.onFailure = function(param) {
5713          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5714          *   }</pre>
5715          *   </li>
5716          * </ul>
5717          *  
5718          * @since 1.19.0
5719          * 
5720          * @see
5721          * <a href="hcap.power.html#.getPowerMode">hcap.power.getPowerMode()</a><br>
5722          * <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a><br>
5723          * <a href="hcap.power.PowerMode.html#.WARM">hcap.power.PowerMode.WARM</a><br>
5724          * <a href="hcap.power.PowerMode.html#.NORMAL">hcap.power.PowerMode.NORMAL</a>
5725          *
5726          * @example
5727          * hcap.power.isWarmUpdate({
5728          *      "onSuccess":function(s) {
5729          *          console.log("onSuccess : is warm update = " + s.isWarmUpdate);
5730          *      }, 
5731          *      "onFailure":function(f) {
5732          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5733          *      }
5734          * });
5735          */
5736         hcap.power.isWarmUpdate = function (param) {
5737             hcap_command("is_power_warm_update", param);
5738         };
5739         /**
5740          * Turns off the TV.
5741          *
5742          * @param {Object} param
5743          * <ul>
5744          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5745          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5746          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
5747          *       // No Parameter.
5748          *   }</pre>
5749          *   </li>
5750          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5751          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5752          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5753          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5754          *   }</pre>
5755          *   </li>
5756          * </ul>
5757          *  
5758          * @since 1.3.1
5759          * 
5760          * @see
5761          * <a href="hcap.power.html#.reboot">hcap.power.reboot()</a>
5762          *
5763          * @example
5764          * hcap.power.powerOff({
5765          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
5766          *          console.log("onSuccess");
5767          *      }, 
5768          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5769          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5770          *      }
5771          * });
5772          */
5773         hcap.power.powerOff = function (param) {
5774             hcap_command("power_off", param);
5775         };
5776         /**
5777          * power.reboots the TV.
5778          *
5779          * @param {Object} param
5780          * <ul>
5781          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5782          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5783          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
5784          *       // No Parameter.
5785          *   }</pre>
5786          *   </li>
5787          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5788          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5789          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5790          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5791          *   }</pre>
5792          *   </li>
5793          * </ul>
5794          *  
5795          * @since 1.3.1
5796          * 
5797          * @see
5798          * <a href="hcap.power.html#.powerOff">power.powerOff()</a>
5799          *
5800          * @example
5801          * hcap.power.reboot({
5802          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
5803          *          console.log("onSuccess");
5804          *      }, 
5805          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5806          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5807          *      }
5808          * });
5809          */
5810         hcap.power.reboot = function (param) {
5811             hcap_command("reboot", param);
5812         };
5813         /**
5814          * @namespace hcap.time
5815          */
5816         hcap.time = {};
5817         /**
5818          * Sets the TV time.<br>
5819          * Input time is the local time which is the time after applying GMT offset for time zone and daylight saving time.<br>
5820          * GMT offset for time zone and daylight saving time are required to set the TV localtime.<br>
5821          * Current GMT offset and daylight saving time can be got from <a href="hcap.time.html#.getLocalTime">hcap.time.getLocalTime()</a>.
5822          * GMT offset must be standard GMT offset of the city.<br>
5823          * Some of the standard GMT offset values and illegal GMT offset like -110 could not be set to TV.<br>
5824          * In this error case, failure callback function will be invoked.
5825          *
5826          * @param {Object} param
5827          * <ul>
5828          *   <li>{Number} param.year [REQUIRED] - year (2000 ~ 2029).</li>
5829          *   <li>{Number} param.month [REQUIRED] - month (1 ~ 12).</li>
5830          *   <li>{Number} param.day [REQUIRED] - day (1 ~ 31).</li>
5831          *   <li>{Number} param.hour [REQUIRED] - hour (0 ~ 23).</li>
5832          *   <li>{Number} param.minute [REQUIRED] - minute (0 ~ 59).</li>
5833          *   <li>{Number} param.second [REQUIRED] - second (0 ~ 59).</li>
5834          *   <li>{Number} param.gmtOffsetInMinute [REQUIRED] - GMT offset in minute for time zone (-660 ~ 720).</li>
5835          *   <li>{Boolean} param.isDaylightSaving [REQUIRED] - false : not applying daylight saving time to local time, true : applying daylight saving time to local time.</li>
5836          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
5837          *           Setting to the same year/month/day/hour/minute/second/gmt_offset_in_minute/daylight_saving as before will invoke this callback function.
5838          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5839          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
5840          *       // No Parameter.
5841          *   }</pre>
5842          *   </li>
5843          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5844          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5845          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5846          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5847          *   }</pre>
5848          *   </li>
5849          * </ul>
5850          * 
5851          * @since 1.3.1
5852          * 
5853          * @see
5854          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.getLocalTime">hcap.time.getLocalTime()</a><br>
5855          *
5856          * @example
5857          * hcap.time.setLocalTime({
5858          *      "year" : 2010, 
5859          *      "month" : 8,
5860          *      "day" : 31,
5861          *      "hour" : 1,
5862          *      "minute" : 0,
5863          *      "second" : 0,
5864          *      "gmtOffsetInMinute" : 180,
5865          *      "isDaylightSaving" : false, 
5866          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
5867          *          console.log("onSuccess");
5868          *      }, 
5869          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5870          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5871          *      }
5872          * });
5873          */
5874         hcap.time.setLocalTime = function (param) {
5875             hcap_command("set_tv_localtime", param);
5876         };
5877         /**
5878          * Gets the TV time.<br>
5879          * TV time is the local time which is the time after applying GMT offset for time zone and daylight saving time.<br>
5880          * In this error case, failure callback function will be invoked.
5881          *
5882          * @param {Object} param
5883          * <ul>
5884          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5885          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5886          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
5887          *       // {Number} param.year - year (2000 ~ 2029).
5888          *       // {Number} param.month - month (1 ~ 12).
5889          *       // {Number} param.day - day (1 ~ 31).
5890          *       // {Number} param.hour - hour (0 ~ 23).
5891          *       // {Number} param.minute - minute (0 ~ 59).
5892          *       // {Number} param.second - second (0 ~ 59).
5893          *       // {Number} param.gmtOffsetInMinute - GMT offset in minute for time zone (-660 ~ 720).
5894          *       // {Number} param.isDaylightSaving - false : not applying daylight saving time to local time, true : applying daylight saving time to local time.
5895          *   }</pre>
5896          *   </li>
5897          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5898          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5899          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5900          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5901          *   }</pre>
5902          *   </li>
5903          * </ul>
5904          * 
5905          * @since 1.6.0
5906          * 
5907          * @see
5908          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.setLocalTime">hcap.time.setLocalTime()</a><br>
5909          *
5910          * @example
5911          * hcap.time.getLocalTime({
5912          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
5913          *          console.log("onSuccess : \n" +
5914          *              "TV localtime = " + s.year + "-" + s.month + "-" + s.day + " " + s.hour + " : " + s.minute + " : " + s.second + "\n" +
5915          *              "GMT offset = " + s.gmtOffsetInMinute + "\n" +
5916          *              "daylight saving = " + s.isDaylightSaving);
5917          *      }, 
5918          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5919          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5920          *      }
5921          * });
5922          */
5923         hcap.time.getLocalTime = function (param) {
5924             hcap_command("get_tv_localtime", param);
5925         };
5926         /**
5927          * Gets the sleep time to power off.
5928          *
5929          * @param {Object} param
5930          * <ul>
5931          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5932          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5933          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
5934          *       // {Number} param.minute - remaining time(minutes: 0 ~ 240, -1:off) of the sleep timer.
5935          *   }</pre>
5936          *   </li>
5937          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5938          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5939          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5940          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5941          *   }</pre>
5942          *   </li>
5943          * </ul>
5944          *  
5945          * @since 1.3.1
5946          * 
5947          * @see
5948          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.setPowerOffTimer">hcap.time.setPowerOffTimer()</a>
5949          *
5950          * @example
5951          * hcap.time.getPowerOffTimer({
5952          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
5953          *          console.log("onSuccess : remaining time (min) = " + s.minute);
5954          *      }, 
5955          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5956          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5957          *      }
5958          * });
5959          */
5960         hcap.time.getPowerOffTimer = function (param) {
5961             hcap_command("get_power_off_timer_in_min", param);
5962         };
5963         /**
5964          * Sets the power-off timer of TV. 
5965          *
5966          * @param {Object} param
5967          * <ul>
5968          *   <li>{Number} param.minute [Required] - preset time(in minutes) of power-off timer. The range is 0~240 minutes(4 hours) or -1(off).</li>
5969          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
5970          *         Setting to the same minutes of sleep timer as before will invoke this callback function.
5971          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5972          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
5973          *       // No parameter.
5974          *   }</pre>
5975          *   </li>
5976          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5977          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5978          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5979          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5980          *   }</pre>
5981          *   </li>
5982          * </ul>
5983          *  
5984          * @since 1.3.1
5985          * 
5986          * @see
5987          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.getPowerOffTimer">hcap.time.getPowerOffTimer()</a>
5988          *
5989          * @example
5990          * hcap.time.setPowerOffTimer({
5991          *      "minute" : 60,
5992          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
5993          *          console.log("onSuccess");
5994          *      }, 
5995          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5996          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5997          *      }
5998          * });
5999          */
6000         hcap.time.setPowerOffTimer = function (param) {
6001             hcap_command("set_power_off_timer_in_min", param);
6002         };
6003         /**
6004          * Gets the wake-up time of TV.  This setting is applied only once at the wake-up time and will be disabled.<br>
6005          * If the setting is disabled, returns -1 for hour and -1 for minute.
6006          *
6007          * @param {Object} param
6008          * <ul>
6009          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6010          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6011          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6012          *       // {Number} param.hour - hour of wake-up time (0~23), -1 if the setting is disabled.
6013          *       // {Number} param.minute - minute of wake-up time (0~59), -1 if the setting is disabled.
6014          *   }</pre>
6015          *   </li>
6016          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6017          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6018          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6019          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6020          *   }</pre>
6021          *   </li>
6022          * </ul>
6023          *  
6024          * @since 1.3.1
6025          * 
6026          * @see
6027          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.setPowerOnTime">hcap.time.setPowerOnTime()</a>
6028          *
6029          * @example
6030          * hcap.time.getPowerOnTime({
6031          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6032          *          console.log("onSuccess : wake-up time = " + s.hour + " : " + s.minute);
6033          *      }, 
6034          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6035          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6036          *      }
6037          * });
6038          */
6039         hcap.time.getPowerOnTime = function (param) {
6040             hcap_command("get_power_on_time", param);
6041         };
6042         /**
6043          * Sets the wake-up time of TV. This setting is applied only once at the wake-up time and will be disabled.<br>
6044          * Set parm.hour -1 and param.minute -1 to disable the wake-up time.
6045          *
6046          * @param {Object} param
6047          * <ul>
6048          *   <li>{Number} param.hour [Required] - hour of wake-up time. The range is 0~23 or -1 if the setting is disabled.</li>
6049          *   <li>{Number} param.minute [Required] - minute of wake-up time. The range is 0~59 or -1 if the setting is disabled.</li>
6050          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
6051          *        Setting to the same hour/minute as before will invoke this callback function.
6052          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6053          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
6054          *       // No parameter.
6055          *   }</pre>
6056          *   </li>
6057          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6058          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6059          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6060          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6061          *   }</pre>
6062          *   </li>
6063          * </ul>
6064          *  
6065          * @since 1.3.1
6066          * 
6067          * @see
6068          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.getPowerOnTime">hcap.time.getPowerOnTime()</a>
6069          *
6070          * @example
6071          * hcap.time.setPowerOnTime({
6072          *      "hour" : 9,
6073          *      "minute" : 30,
6074          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
6075          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6076          *      }, 
6077          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6078          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6079          *      }
6080          * });
6081          */
6082         hcap.time.setPowerOnTime = function (param) {
6083             hcap_command("set_power_on_time", param);
6084         };
6085         /**
6086          * Gets the alarm time, alarm channel and alarm volume level of TV. These settings are applied only once at the alarm time and will be disabled.<br>
6087          * At the alarm time, if TV is off, TV will be turned on automatically with the alarm volume level and tune to the alarm channel.
6088          * And if TV is on at the alarm time, nothing will happen.
6089          * If the alarm time is disabled, param.hour = -1 and param.minute = -1 will be returned.
6090          * And if the alarm channel is disabled, param.channelType = <a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#constructor">hcap.channel.ChannelType.UNKNOWN</a> will be returned.
6091          * If the alarm volume is disabled, param.volumeLevel = -1 will be returned.
6092          *
6093          * @param {Object} param
6094          * <ul>
6095          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6096          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6097          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6098          *       // {Number} param.hour - hour of alarm time (-1 ~ 23), -1 if the setting is disabled.
6099          *       // {Number} param.minute - minute of alarm time (-1 ~ 59), -1 if the setting is disabled.
6100          *       // {Number} param.volumeLevel - alarm volume level (-1 ~ 100) which is applied only once for the first alarm booting. -1 if setting is disabled.
6101          *       // For the alarm channel, see the <a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.html#.CHANNEL_PROPERTY">{ Channel Properties }</a> in <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a>. The alarm channel is applied only once for the first alarm booting.
6102          *   }</pre>
6103          *   </li>
6104          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6105          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6106          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6107          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6108          *   }</pre>
6109          *   </li>
6110          * </ul>
6111          *  
6112          * @since 1.5.0
6113          * 
6114          * @see
6115          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.setAlarmInformation">hcap.time.setAlarmInformation()</a>
6116          *
6117          * @example
6118          * hcap.time.getAlarmInformation({
6119          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6120          *          console.log("onSuccess :" + 
6121          *              "\n alarm time = " + s.hour = " : " + s.minute +
6122          *              "\n alarm volume level = " + s.volumeLevel +
6123          *              "\n ========= alarm channel information =========" + 
6124          *              "\n channel type      : " + s.channelType     +
6125          *              "\n logical number    : " + s.logicalNumber   +
6126          *              "\n frequency         : " + s.frequency       +
6127          *              "\n program number    : " + s.programNumber   +
6128          *              "\n major number      : " + s.majorNumber     +
6129          *              "\n minor number      : " + s.minorNumber     +
6130          *              "\n satellite ID      : " + s.satelliteId     +
6131          *              "\n polarization      : " + s.polarization    +
6132          *              "\n rf broadcast type : " + s.rfBroadcastType +
6133          *              "\n ip                : " + s.ip              +
6134          *              "\n port              : " + s.port            +
6135          *              "\n ip broadcast type : " + s.ipBroadcastType +
6136          *              "\n symbol rate       : " + s.symbolRate      +
6137          *              "\n pcr pid           : " + s.pcrPid          +
6138          *              "\n video pid         : " + s.videoPid        +
6139          *              "\n video stream type : " + s.videoStreamType +
6140          *              "\n audio pid         : " + s.audioPid        +
6141          *              "\n audio stream type : " + s.audioStreamType +
6142          *              "\n signal strength   : " + s.signalStrength  +
6143          *              "\n source address    : " + s.sourceAddress);
6144          *      }, 
6145          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6146          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6147          *      }
6148          * });
6149          */
6150         hcap.time.getAlarmInformation = function (param) {
6151             hcap_command("get_alarm_information", param);
6152         };
6153         /**
6154          * Sets the alarm time, alarm channel and alarm volume level of TV. These settings are applied only once at the alarm time and will be disabled.<br>
6155          * At the alarm time, if TV is off, TV will be turned on automatically with the alarm volume level and tune to the alarm channel.
6156          * And if TV is on at the alarm time, nothing will happen.
6157          * To disable the alarm time, param.hour = -1 and param.minute = -1 should be set.
6158          * When the alarm time is disabled, the alarm channel and the alarm volume level will be disabled together.
6159          *
6160          * @param {Object} param
6161          * <ul>
6162          *   <li>{Number} param.hour [Required] - hour of alarm time. The range is -1 ~ 23.</li>
6163          *   <li>{Number} param.minute [Required] - minute of alarm time. The range is -1 ~ 59.</li>
6164          *   <li>{Number} param.volumeLevel [Required] - alarm volume level (-1 ~ 100). -1 to disable the alarm volume.</li>
6165          *   <li><a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.html#.CHANNEL_PROPERTY">{ Channel Properties } [Required] - Alarm Channel Information.</a></li>
6166          *   <br>The alarm channel is taken affect prior to the start channel. If you want to disable the alarm channel, set param.channelType to <a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#constructor">hcap.channel.ChannelType.UNKNOWN</a>.
6167          *   </li>
6168          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
6169          *        Setting to the same hour/minute/alarm channel/alarm volume level as before will invoke this callback function.
6170          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6171          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
6172          *       // No parameter.
6173          *   }</pre>
6174          *   </li>
6175          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6176          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6177          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6178          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6179          *   }</pre>
6180          *   </li>
6181          * </ul>
6182          *  
6183          * @since 1.5.0
6184          * 
6185          * @see
6186          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.getAlarmInformation">hcap.time.getAlarmInformation()</a>
6187          *
6188          * @example
6189          * hcap.time.setAlarmInformation({
6190          *      "hour" : 9,
6191          *      "minute" : 30,
6192          *      "volumeLevel" : 30,
6193          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF, 
6194          *      "frequency" : 63000000, 
6195          *      "programNumber" : 1, 
6196          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL, 
6197          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
6198          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6199          *      }, 
6200          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6201          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6202          *      }
6203          * });
6204          */
6205         hcap.time.setAlarmInformation = function (param) {
6206             hcap_command("set_alarm_information", param);
6207         };
6208         /**
6209          * Gets the CPU time.
6210          * It means that the monotonic time after TV is turned on.<br>
6211          * 
6212          * @param {Object} param
6213          * <ul>
6214          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6215          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6216          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6217          *       // {Number} param.cpuTime - cpu time(milliseconds) of the platform.
6218          *   }</pre>
6219          *   </li>
6220          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6221          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6222          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6223          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6224          *   }</pre>
6225          *   </li>
6226          * </ul>
6227          *  
6228          * @since 1.21.0
6229          * 
6230          * @example
6231          * hcap.time.getCpuTime({
6232          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
6233          *          console.log("onSuccess : cpu time(milliseconds) = " + param.cpuTime);
6234          *      }, 
6235          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6236          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6237          *      }
6238          * });
6239          */
6240         hcap.time.getCpuTime = function (param) {
6241             hcap_command("get_cpu_time", param);
6242         };
6243         /**
6244          * @namespace hcap.network
6245          */
6246         hcap.network = {};
6247         /**
6248          * Gets the number of network devices. 
6249          *
6250          * @param {Object} param
6251          * <ul>
6252          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6253          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6254          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6255          *       // {Number} param.count - number of network devices connected to TV.
6256          *   }</pre>
6257          *   </li>
6258          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6259          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6260          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6261          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6262          *   }</pre>
6263          *   </li>
6264          * </ul>
6265          *  
6266          * @since 1.3.1
6267          * 
6268          * @see
6269          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getNetworkDevice">hcap.network.getNetworkDevice()</a><br>
6270          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setNetworkDevice">hcap.network.setNetworkDevice()</a><br>
6271          *
6272          * @example
6273          * hcap.network.getNumberOfNetworkDevices({
6274          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6275          *          console.log("onSuccess : the number of network devices = " + s.count);
6276          *      }, 
6277          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6278          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6279          *      }
6280          * });
6281          */
6282         hcap.network.getNumberOfNetworkDevices = function (param) {
6283             hcap_command("get_number_of_network_devices", param);
6284         };
6285         /**
6286          * Gets the details of network device connected to TV.
6287          *
6288          * @param {Object} param
6289          * <ul>
6290          *   <li>{Number} param.index [Required] - index of device connected. Starts from 0.</li>
6291          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6292          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6293          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6294          *       // {Number} param.networkMode - network mode (wire or wireless) of the network device. (<a href="hcap.network.NetworkMode.html">hcap.network.NetworkMode</a>)
6295          *       // {String} param.name - name of network device. ex) "eth0" 
6296          *       // {String} param.mac - MAC address of network device. ex) "ff:ee:dd:cc:bb:aa"
6297          *       // {Boolean} param.dhcp - DHCP (true : DHCP, false : not DHCP)
6298          *       // {String} param.ip - IP of network device. ex) "192.168.100.2"
6299          *       // {String} param.gateway - gateway of network device. ex) "192.168.100.1" 
6300          *       // {String} param.netmask - netmask address of network device. ex) "255.255.255.0"
6301          *       // {String} param.primaryDns - DNS (Domain Name Server) address. ex) "8.8.8.8"
6302          *       // {String} param.secondaryDns - secondary DNS address. ex) "8.8.8.8"
6303          *   }</pre>
6304          *   </li>
6305          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
6306          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6307          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6308          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6309          *   }</pre>
6310          *   </li>
6311          * </ul>
6312          *  
6313          * @since 1.3.1
6314          * 
6315          * @see
6316          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getNumberOfNetworkDevices">hcap.network.getNumberOfNetworkDevices()</a><br>
6317          * <a href="hcap.network.NetworkMode.html#.WIRE">hcap.network.NetworkMode.WIRE</a><br>
6318          * <a href="hcap.network.NetworkMode.html#.WIRELESS">hcap.network.NetworkMode.WIRELESS</a><br>
6319          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setNetworkDevice">hcap.network.setNetworkDevice()</a><br>
6320          *
6321          * @example
6322          * function print_current_mac(ip) {
6323          *     hcap.network.getNumberOfNetworkDevices({
6324          *          "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6325          *              console.log("onSuccess : the number of network devices = " + s.count);
6326          *              for (var i = 0; i < s.count; i++) {
6327          *                  (function(k) {
6328          *                      hcap.network.getNetworkDevice({
6329          *                          "index" : k,
6330          *                          "onSuccess" : function(r) {
6331          *                              console.log("onSuccess : networkMode = " + r.networkMode + 
6332          *                                  "\n name = " + r.name +
6333          *                                  "\n mac = " + r.mac +
6334          *                                  "\n dhcp = " + r.dhcp +
6335          *                                  "\n ip = " + r.ip +
6336          *                                  "\n gateway = " + r.gateway +
6337          *                                  "\n netmask = " + r.netmask +
6338          *                                  "\n primary dns = " + r.primaryDns +
6339          *                                  "\n secondary dns = " + r.secondaryDns);
6340          *                              if (ip === r.ip) {
6341          *                                  console.log("CURRENT MAC : " + r.mac);
6342          *                              }
6343          *                          }, 
6344          *                          "onFailure" : function(r) {
6345          *                              console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + r.errorMessage);
6346          *                          }
6347          *                      });
6348          *                  })(i);
6349          *              }
6350          *          }, 
6351          *          "onFailure" : function(f) {
6352          *              console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6353          *          }
6354          *     });
6355          * }
6356          * 
6357          * hcap.network.getNetworkInformation({
6358          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6359          *          console.log("onSuccess : network_mode = " + s.network_mode + 
6360          *              "\n ssid = " + s.ssid +
6361          *              "\n eth_speed = " + s.eth_speed +
6362          *              "\n eth_duplex = " + s.eth_duplex +
6363          *              "\n local_network_available = " + s.local_network_available +
6364          *              "\n internet_available = " + s.internet_available +
6365          *              "\n wifi_mode = " + s.wifi_mode +
6366          *              "\n wireless_security_type = " + s.wireless_security_type +
6367          *              "\n wifi_pass_key = " + s.wifi_pass_key +
6368          *              "\n using_dhcp = " + s.using_dhcp +
6369          *              "\n ip_address = " + s.ip_address +
6370          *              "\n subnet_mask = " + s.subnet_mask +
6371          *              "\n gateway = " + s.gateway +
6372          *              "\n dns1_address = " + s.dns1_address +
6373          *              "\n dns2_address = " + s.dns2_address +
6374          *              "\n dns_dhcp = " + s.dns_dhcp +
6375          *              "\n ethernet_plugged = " + s.ethernet_plugged +
6376          *              "\n wifi_plugged = " + s.wifi_plugged +
6377          *              "\n dhcp_state = " + s.dhcp_state);
6378          *          print_current_mac(s.ip_address);
6379          *      }, 
6380          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6381          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6382          *      }
6383          * });
6384          */
6385         hcap.network.getNetworkDevice = function (param) {
6386             hcap_command("get_network_device", param);
6387         };
6388         /**
6389          * Sets the network configuration of the index-th (starting with 0) network device<br>
6390          *
6391          * @param {Object} param
6392          * <ul>
6393          *   <li>{Number} param.index [Required] - the index of the network device (starting with 0)</li>
6394          *   <li>{Boolean} param.dhcp [Required] - DHCP (true : DHCP, false : not DHCP)</li>
6395          *   <li>{String} param.ip [Optional] - IP of network device. When param.dhcp is false, it is required. ex) "192.168.100.2"</li>
6396          *   <li>{String} param.gateway [Optional] - gateway of network device. When param.dhcp is false, it is required. ex) "192.168.100.1"</li> 
6397          *   <li>{String} param.netmask [Optional] - netmask address of network device. When param.dhcp is false, it is required. ex) "255.255.255.0"</li>
6398          *   <li>{String} param.primaryDns [Optional] - primary DNS (Domain Name Server) address. When param.dhcp is false, it is required. ex) "8.8.8.8"</li>
6399          *   <li>{String} param.secondaryDns [Optional] - secondary DNS (Domain Name Server) address. When param.dhcp is false, it is required. ex) "8.8.8.8"</li>
6400          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6401          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6402          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
6403          *       // No parameter.
6404          *   }</pre>
6405          *   </li>
6406          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6407          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6408          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6409          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6410          *   }</pre>
6411          *   </li>
6412          * </ul>
6413          *  
6414          * @since 1.19.0
6415          * 
6416          * @see
6417          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getNumberOfNetworkDevices">hcap.network.getNumberOfNetworkDevices()</a><br>
6418          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getNetworkDevice">hcap.network.getNetworkDevice()</a><br>
6419          *
6420          * @example
6421          * hcap.network.setNetworkDevice({
6422          *      "index" : 0,
6423          *      "dhcp" : true,
6424          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
6425          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6426          *      }, 
6427          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6428          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6429          *      }
6430          * });
6431          * hcap.network.setNetworkDevice({
6432          *      "index" : 0,
6433          *      "dhcp" : false,
6434          *      "ip" : "192.168.100.2",
6435          *      "gateway" : "192.168.100.1",
6436          *      "netmask" : "255.255.255.0",
6437          *      "primaryDns" : "192.168.100.1",
6438          *      "secondaryDns" : "8.8.8.8",
6439          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
6440          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6441          *      }, 
6442          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6443          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6444          *      }
6445          * });
6446          */
6447         hcap.network.setNetworkDevice = function (param) {
6448             hcap_command("set_network_device", param);
6449         };
6450         /**
6451          * Sends a ping command to the specified IP.
6452          *
6453          * @param {Object} param
6454          * <ul>
6455          *   <li>{String} param.ip [Required] - IP address of the ping target.</li>
6456          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6457          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6458          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6459          *       // {Number} param.roundTripTimeInMs - round trip time to the target in milliseconds.
6460          *   }</pre>
6461          *   </li>
6462          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
6463          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6464          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6465          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6466          *   }</pre>
6467          *   </li>
6468          * </ul>
6469          *  
6470          * @since 1.3.1
6471          * 
6472          * @example
6473          * hcap.network.ping({
6474          *      "ip" : "192.168.100.1",
6475          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6476          *          console.log("onSuccess : round trip time = " + s.roundTripTimeInMs);
6477          *      }, 
6478          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6479          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6480          *      }
6481          * });
6482          */
6483         hcap.network.ping = function (param) {
6484             hcap_command("ping", param);
6485         };
6486         /**
6487          * @namespace hcap.network.NetworkEventType
6488          */
6489         hcap.network.NetworkEventType = {
6490             /**
6491              * Unknown network event type.
6492              * @since 1.6.0
6493              * @constant
6494              */
6495             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
6496             /**
6497              * Ethernet is plugged.
6498              * @since 1.6.0
6499              * @constant
6500              */
6501             ETHERNET_PLUGGED : 0x01,
6502             /**
6503              * Ethernet is unplugged.
6504              * @since 1.6.0
6505              * @constant
6506              */
6507             ETHERNET_UNPLUGGED : 0x02,
6508             /**
6509              * Wi-Fi dongle is plugged.
6510              * @since 1.6.0
6511              * @constant
6512              */
6513             WIFI_DONGLE_PLUGGED : 0x03,
6514             /**
6515              * Wi-Fi dongle is unplugged.
6516              * @since 1.6.0
6517              * @constant
6518              */
6519             WIFI_DONGLE_UNPLUGGED : 0x04,
6520             /**
6521              * IP address conflicts.
6522              * @since 1.6.0
6523              * @constant
6524              */
6525             IP_CONFLICT : 0x05,
6526             /**
6527              * IP address does not conflict.
6528              * @since 1.6.0
6529              * @constant
6530              */
6531             IP_NOT_CONFLICT : 0x06,
6532             /**
6533              * DHCP is succeeded.
6534              * @since 1.6.0
6535              * @constant
6536              */
6537             DHCP_SUCCESS : 0x07,
6538             /**
6539              * DHCP fails.
6540              * @since 1.6.0
6541              * @constant
6542              */
6543             DHCP_FAIL : 0x08,
6544             /**
6545              * Unable to reach gateway.
6546              * @since 1.6.0
6547              * @constant
6548              */
6549             UNABLE_REACH_GATEWAY : 0x09,
6550             /**
6551              * Able to reach gateway.
6552              * @since 1.6.0
6553              * @constant
6554              */
6555             ABLE_REACH_GATEWAY : 0x0A,
6556             /**
6557              * Unable to reach DNS.
6558              * @since 1.6.0
6559              * @constant
6560              */
6561             UNABLE_REACH_DNS : 0x0B,
6562             /**
6563              * Able to reach DNS.
6564              * @since 1.6.0
6565              * @constant
6566              */
6567             ABLE_REACH_DNS : 0x0C,
6568             /**
6569              * Unable to reach internet.
6570              * @since 1.6.0
6571              * @constant
6572              */
6573             UNABLE_REACH_INTERNET : 0x0D,
6574             /**
6575              * Able to reach internet.
6576              * @since 1.6.0
6577              * @constant
6578              */
6579             ABLE_REACH_INTERNET : 0x0E,
6580             /**
6581              * Searching Wi-Fi access point is completed.
6582              * @since 1.6.0
6583              * @constant
6584              */
6585             WIFI_AP_SEARCH_COMPLETE : 0x0F,
6586             /**
6587              * Wi-Fi is connected.
6588              * @since 1.6.0
6589              * @constant
6590              */
6591             WIFI_CONNECTED : 0x10,
6592             /**
6593              * fail to connect Wi-Fi.
6594              * @since 1.6.0
6595              * @constant
6596              */
6597             WIFI_CONNECT_FAIL : 0x11,
6598             /**
6599              * Wi-Fi link is dropped.
6600              * @since 1.6.0
6601              * @constant
6602              */
6603             WIFI_LINK_DROPPED : 0x12
6604         };
6605         /**
6606          * @namespace hcap.network.NetworkMode
6607          */
6608         hcap.network.NetworkMode = {
6609             /**
6610              * Unknown network mode.
6611              * @since 1.6.0
6612              * @constant
6613              */
6614             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
6615             /**
6616              * Wired network mode.
6617              * @since 1.6.0
6618              * @constant
6619              */
6620             WIRE : 0x01,
6621             /**
6622              * Wireless network mode.
6623              * @since 1.6.0
6624              * @constant
6625              */
6626             WIRELESS : 0x02,
6627             /**
6628              * Network is not reachable.
6629              * @since 1.6.0
6630              * @constant
6631              */
6632             NOT_REACHABLE : 0x03
6633         };
6634         /**
6635          * @namespace hcap.network.WirelessMode
6636          */
6637         hcap.network.WirelessMode = {
6638             /**
6639              * Unknown wireless mode.
6640              * @since 1.6.0
6641              * @constant
6642              */
6643             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
6644             /**
6645              * Infra wireless mode.
6646              * @since 1.6.0
6647              * @constant
6648              */
6649             INFRA : 0x01,
6650             /**
6651              * Ad-hoc wireless mode.
6652              * @since 1.6.0
6653              * @constant
6654              */
6655             ADHOC : 0x02
6656         };
6657         /**
6658          * @namespace hcap.network.WifiSecurityType
6659          */
6660         hcap.network.WifiSecurityType = {
6661             /**
6662              * Unknown security type.
6663              * @since 1.6.0
6664              * @constant
6665              */
6666             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
6667             /**
6668              * Open.
6669              * @since 1.6.0
6670              * @constant
6671              */
6672             OPEN : 0x01,
6673             /**
6674              * WEP.
6675              * @since 1.6.0
6676              * @constant
6677              */
6678             WEP : 0x02,
6679             /**
6680              * WPA_PSK_TKIP.
6681              * @since 1.6.0
6682              * @constant
6683              */
6684             WPA_PSK_TKIP : 0x03,
6685             /**
6686              * WPA_PSK_AES.
6687              * @since 1.6.0
6688              * @constant
6689              */
6690             WPA_PSK_AES : 0x04,
6691             /**
6692              * WPA2_PSK_TKIP.
6693              * @since 1.6.0
6694              * @constant
6695              */
6696             WPA2_PSK_TKIP : 0x05,
6697             /**
6698              * WPA2_PSK_AES.
6699              * @since 1.6.0
6700              * @constant
6701              */
6702             WPA2_PSK_AES : 0x06,
6703             /**
6704              * WPA12_PSK_AES_TKIPAES.
6705              * @since 1.6.0
6706              * @constant
6707              */
6708             WPA12_PSK_AES_TKIPAES : 0x07
6709         };
6710         /**
6711          * @namespace hcap.network.DhcpState
6712          */
6713         hcap.network.DhcpState = {
6714             /**
6715              * Unknown DHCP state.
6716              * @since 1.6.0
6717              * @constant
6718              */
6719             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
6720             /**
6721              * Init.
6722              * @since 1.6.0
6723              * @constant
6724              */
6725             INIT : 0x01,
6726             /**
6727              * Selecting.
6728              * @since 1.6.0
6729              * @constant
6730              */
6731             SELECTING : 0x02,
6732             /**
6733              * Requesting.
6734              * @since 1.6.0
6735              * @constant
6736              */
6737             REQUESTING : 0x03,
6738             /**
6739              * Bound.
6740              * @since 1.6.0
6741              * @constant
6742              */
6743             BOUND : 0x04,
6744             /**
6745              * Renewing.
6746              * @since 1.6.0
6747              * @constant
6748              */
6749             RENEWING : 0x05,
6750             /**
6751              * Rebinding.
6752              * @since 1.6.0
6753              * @constant
6754              */
6755             REBINDING : 0x06,
6756             /**
6757              * Init Reboot.
6758              * @since 1.6.0
6759              * @constant
6760              */
6761             INIT_REBOOT : 0x07,
6762             /**
6763              * Rebooting.
6764              * @since 1.6.0
6765              * @constant
6766              */
6767             REBOOTING : 0x08
6768         };
6769         /**
6770          * Gets the network information.
6771          *
6772          * @param {Object} param
6773          * <ul>
6774          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6775          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6776          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6777          *       // {Number} param.network_mode - wire or wireless (<a href="hcap.network.NetworkMode.html">hcap.network.NetworkMode</a>)
6778          *       // {String} param.ssid - ssid for wireless AP
6779          *       // {Number} param.eth_speed - network speed (Mbps), auto-negotiation data
6780          *       // {Number} param.eth_duplex - network duplex(half : 0, full : 1, fail : -1), auto-negotiation data
6781          *       // {Boolean} param.local_network_available - if connected to gateway of AP
6782          *       // {Boolean} param.internet_available - if connected to Internet
6783          *       // {Number} param.wifi_mode - INFRA or Ad-hoc (<a href="hcap.network.WirelessMode.html">hcap.network.WirelessMode</a>)
6784          *       // {Number} param.wireless_security_type - security types (<a href="hcap.network.WifiSecurityType.html">hcap.network.WifiSecurityType</a>)  
6785          *       // {String} param.wifi_pass_key - security key string. This value is not delivered to HCAP application by LG security policy since 1.18.4.
6786          *       // {Boolean} param.using_dhcp - if using dhcp
6787          *       // {String} param.ip_address - ip address
6788          *       // {String} param.subnet_mask - subnet mask
6789          *       // {String} param.gateway - gateway adress
6790          *       // {String} param.dns1_address - main DNS address
6791          *       // {String} param.dns2_address - secondary DNS address
6792          *       // {Boolean} param.dns_dhcp - DNS dhcp flag
6793          *       // {Boolean} param.ethernet_plugged - if ethernet cable is plugged
6794          *       // {Boolean} param.wifi_plugged - if Wi-Fi dongle is plugged
6795          *       // {Number} param.dhcp_state - dhcp status (<a href="hcap.network.DhcpState.html">hcap.network.DhcpState</a>) 
6796          *   }</pre>
6797          *   </li>
6798          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
6799          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6800          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6801          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6802          *   }</pre>
6803          *   </li>
6804          * </ul>
6805          *  
6806          * @since 1.6.0
6807          * 
6808          * @see
6809          * <a href="_global_.html#event:network_event_received">{Event} network_event_received</a><br>
6810          *
6811          * @example
6812          * hcap.network.getNetworkInformation({
6813          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6814          *          console.log("onSuccess : network_mode = " + s.network_mode + 
6815          *              "\n ssid = " + s.ssid +
6816          *              "\n eth_speed = " + s.eth_speed +
6817          *              "\n eth_duplex = " + s.eth_duplex +
6818          *              "\n local_network_available = " + s.local_network_available +
6819          *              "\n internet_available = " + s.internet_available +
6820          *              "\n wifi_mode = " + s.wifi_mode +
6821          *              "\n wireless_security_type = " + s.wireless_security_type +
6822          *              "\n wifi_pass_key = " + s.wifi_pass_key +
6823          *              "\n using_dhcp = " + s.using_dhcp +
6824          *              "\n ip_address = " + s.ip_address +
6825          *              "\n subnet_mask = " + s.subnet_mask +
6826          *              "\n gateway = " + s.gateway +
6827          *              "\n dns1_address = " + s.dns1_address +
6828          *              "\n dns2_address = " + s.dns2_address +
6829          *              "\n dns_dhcp = " + s.dns_dhcp +
6830          *              "\n ethernet_plugged = " + s.ethernet_plugged +
6831          *              "\n wifi_plugged = " + s.wifi_plugged +
6832          *              "\n dhcp_state = " + s.dhcp_state);
6833          *      }, 
6834          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6835          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6836          *      }
6837          * });
6838          */
6839         hcap.network.getNetworkInformation = function (param) {
6840             hcap_command("get_network_information", param);
6841         };
6842         /**
6843          * Gets the configuration of soft AP (Access Point).<br>
6844          *
6845          * @param {Object} param
6846          * <ul>
6847          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6848          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6849          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6850          *       // {String} param.ip - IP address of soft AP ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx"). available only when property "soft_ap" is "1".
6851          *       // {String} param.mac - MAC address of soft AP ("XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX"). available only when property "soft_ap" is "1".
6852          *       // {Number} param.connectedDeviceNumber - the number of connected devices to soft AP. available only when property "soft_ap" is "1".
6853          *       // {Number} param.channel - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)
6854          *       // {Number} param.signalStrength - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.
6855          *       // {Number} param.vlanId - 1 ~ 4094. 0 : vlan off.
6856          *       // {String} param.vlanIp - VLAN IP address ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")
6857          *       // {String} param.vlanSubnet - VLAN subnet mask ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")
6858          *       // {String} param.vlanGateway - VLAN gateway ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")
6859          *       // {String} param.mode - mode ("xxxx")
6860          *       // {String} param.securityType - security type ("xxxxx")
6861          *       // {String} param.radiusServerIp - radius server IP address ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")
6862          *       // {String} param.radiusServerPort - radius server port ("xxxx")
6863          *       // {String} param.radiusServerKey - radius server key ("xxxxxxx")
6864          *   }</pre>
6865          *   </li>
6866          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
6867          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6868          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6869          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6870          *   }</pre>
6871          *   </li>
6872          * </ul>
6873          *  
6874          * @since 1.19.0
6875          * 
6876          * @see
6877          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setSoftAP">hcap.network.setSoftAP()</a><br>
6878          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a><br>
6879          *
6880          * @example
6881          * hcap.network.getSoftAP({
6882          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6883          *          console.log("onSuccess : ip = " + s.ip + ", mac = " + s.mac + ", connected device = " + s.connectedDeviceNumber + ", channel = " + s.channel + ", signal strength = " + s.signalStrength + ", vland id = " + s.vlanId + ", vlan subnet = " + s.vlanSubnet + ", vlan gateway = " + s.vlanGateway);
6884          *      }, 
6885          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6886          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6887          *      }
6888          * });
6889          */
6890         hcap.network.getSoftAP = function (param) {
6891             hcap_command("get_soft_ap", param);
6892         };
6893         /**
6894          * Sets the configuration of soft AP (Access Point).<br>
6895          * Setting is possible only when the property "soft_ap" is "0".<br>
6896          * New configuration will be activated in the next change of the property "soft_ap" from "0" to "1" or reboot.<br>
6897          *
6898          * @param {Object} param
6899          * <ul>
6900          *   // default
6901          *   <li>{Number} param.channel [Required] - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)</li>
6902          *   <li>{Number} param.signalStrength [Required] - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.</li>
6903          *   <li>{Number} param.vlanId [Required] - 1 ~ 4094. 0 : vlan off.</li>
6904          *   <li>{String} param.vlanIp [Required] - VLAN IP address ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6905          *   <li>{String} param.vlanSubnet [Required] - VLAN subnet mask ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6906          *   <li>{String} param.vlanGateway [Required] - VLAN gateway ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6907          *   
6908          *   // mode : nat, securityType : psk
6909          *   <li>{Number} param.channel [Required] - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)</li>
6910          *   <li>{Number} param.signalStrength [Required] - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.</li>
6911          *   <li>{Number} param.vlanId [Required] - 1 ~ 4094. 0 : vlan off.</li>
6912          *   <li>{String} param.vlanIp [Required] - VLAN IP address ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6913          *   <li>{String} param.vlanSubnet [Required] - VLAN subnet mask ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6914          *   <li>{String} param.vlanGateway [Required] - VLAN gateway ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6915          *   <li>{String} param.mode [Required] - mode ("xxxx")</li>
6916          *   <li>{String} param.securityType [Required] - security type ("xxxxx")</li>
6917          *   
6918          *   // mode : bridge, securityType : psk
6919          *   <li>{Number} param.channel [Required] - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)</li>
6920          *   <li>{Number} param.signalStrength [Required] - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.</li>
6921          *   <li>{String} param.mode [Required] - mode ("xxxx")</li>
6922          *   <li>{String} param.securityType [Required] - security type ("xxxxx")</li>
6923          *   
6924          *   // mode : bridge, securityType : open
6925          *   <li>{Number} param.channel [Required] - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)</li>
6926          *   <li>{Number} param.signalStrength [Required] - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.</li>
6927          *   <li>{String} param.mode [Required] - mode ("xxxx")</li>
6928          *   <li>{String} param.securityType [Required] - security type ("xxxxx")</li>
6929          * 
6930          *    // mode : bridge, securityType : eap
6931          *   <li>{Number} param.channel [Required] - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)</li>
6932          *   <li>{Number} param.signalStrength [Required] - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.</li>
6933          *   <li>{String} param.mode [Required] - mode ("xxxx")</li>
6934          *   <li>{String} param.securityType [Required] - security type ("xxxxx")</li>
6935          *   <li>{String} param.radiusServerIp [Required] - radius server IP address ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6936          *   <li>{String} param.radiusServerPort [Required] - radius server port ("xxxx")</li>
6937          *   <li>{String} param.radiusServerKey [Required] - radius server key ("xxxxxxx")</li>
6938          *   
6939          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6940          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6941          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
6942          *       // No Parameter.
6943          *   }</pre>
6944          *   </li>
6945          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function. If the property "soft_ap" is "1", failure callback will be called. 
6946          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6947          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6948          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6949          *   }</pre>
6950          *   </li>
6951          * </ul>
6952          *  
6953          * @since 1.19.0
6954          * 
6955          * @see
6956          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getSoftAP">hcap.network.getSoftAP()</a><br>
6957          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a><br>
6958          *
6959          * @example
6960          * // default
6961          * hcap.network.setSoftAP({
6962          *      "channel" : 0,
6963          *      "signalStrength" : 1,
6964          *      "vlanId" : 0,
6965          *      "vlanIp" : "192.168.11.3",
6966          *      "vlanSubnet" : "255.255.255.0",
6967          *      "vlanGateway" : "192.168.11.1",
6968          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6969          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6970          *      }, 
6971          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6972          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6973          *      }
6974          * });
6975          * 
6976          * @example
6977          * // mode : nat, securityType : psk
6978          * hcap.network.setSoftAP({
6979          *      "channel" : 3,
6980          *      "signalStrength" : 4,
6981          *      "vlanId" : 0,
6982          *      "vlanIp" : "192.168.11.3",
6983          *      "vlanSubnet" : "255.255.255.0",
6984          *      "vlanGateway" : "192.168.11.1",
6985          *      "mode" : "nat",
6986          *      "securityType" : "psk",
6987          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6988          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6989          *      }, 
6990          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6991          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6992          *      }
6993          * });
6994          * 
6995          * @example
6996          * // mode : bridge, securityType : psk
6997          * hcap.network.setSoftAP({
6998          *      "channel" : 2,
6999          *      "signalStrength" : 0,
7000          *      "mode" : "bridge",
7001          *      "securityType" : "psk",
7002          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
7003          *          console.log("onSuccess");
7004          *      }, 
7005          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7006          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7007          *      }
7008          * });
7009          * 
7010          * @example
7011          * // mode : bridge, securityType : open
7012          * hcap.network.setSoftAP({
7013          *      "channel" : 2,
7014          *      "signalStrength" : 0,
7015          *      "mode" : "bridge",
7016          *      "securityType" : "open",
7017          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
7018          *          console.log("onSuccess");
7019          *      }, 
7020          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7021          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7022          *      }
7023          * });
7024          * 
7025          * @example
7026          * // mode : bridge, securityType : eap
7027          * hcap.network.setSoftAP({
7028          *      "channel" : 2,
7029          *      "signalStrength" : 0,
7030          *      "radiusServerIp" : "192.168.0.50",
7031          *      "radiusServerPort" : "1010",
7032          *      "radiusServerPort" : "abcdefg",
7033          *      "mode" : "bridge",
7034          *      "securityType" : "eap",
7035          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
7036          *          console.log("onSuccess");
7037          *      }, 
7038          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7039          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7040          *      }
7041          * });
7042          */
7043         hcap.network.setSoftAP = function (param) {
7044             hcap_command("set_soft_ap", param);
7045         };
7046         /**
7047          * Gets the wifi diagnostic information.
7048          * 
7049          * @example
7050          * hcap.network.getWifiDiagnostics({
7051          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
7052          *          console.log("onSuccess  :" + 
7053          *              "\n version                 : " + s.version +
7054          *              "\n country code revision   : " + s.countryCodeRevision +
7055          *              "\n country code            : " + s.countryCode +
7056          *              "\n channel                 : " + s.channel +
7057          *              "\n mcs                     : " + s.mcs +
7058          *              "\n mimo                    : " + s.mimo +
7059          *              "\n rate                    : " + s.rate +
7060          *              "\n rssi                    : " + s.rssi +
7061          *              "\n noise                   : " + s.noise +
7062          *              "\n transimission power     : " + s.transimissionPower +
7063          *              "\n band width              : " + s.bandWidth);
7064          *      }, 
7065          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7066          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7067          *      }
7068          * });
7069          * @param {Object} param
7070          * <ul>
7071          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7072          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7073          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
7074          *       // {String} param.version - version.
7075          *       // {Number} param.countryCodeRevision - country code revision.
7076          *       // {String} param.countryCode - country code.
7077          *       // {Number} param.channel - channel.
7078          *       // {Number} param.mcs - mcs.
7079          *       // {String} param.mimo - mimo.
7080          *       // {String} param.rate - rate.
7081          *       // {String} param.rssi - rssi.
7082          *       // {String} param.noise - noise.
7083          *       // {String} param.transimissionPower - transimission power.
7084          *       // {String} param.bandWidth - band width.
7085          *   }</pre>
7086          *   </li>
7087          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
7088          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7089          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7090          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7091          *   }</pre>
7092          *   </li>
7093          * </ul>
7094          * 
7095          * @since 1.19.2
7096          */
7097         hcap.network.getWifiDiagnostics = function (param) {
7098             hcap_command("get_wifi_diagnostics", param);
7099         };
7100         /**
7101          * Sends a asynchronous ping command to the specified IP.
7102          *
7103          * @param {Object} param
7104          * <ul>
7105          *   <li>{String} param.ip [Required] - IP address of the ping target.</li>
7106          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7107          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7108          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
7109          *       // No Parameter
7110          *   }</pre>
7111          *   </li>
7112          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
7113          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7114          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7115          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7116          *   }</pre>
7117          *   </li>
7118          * </ul>
7119          *  
7120          * @since 1.22.0
7121          *
7122          * @see
7123          * <a href="_global_.html#event:ping_result_received">{Event} ping_result_received</a><br>
7124          *  
7125          * @example
7126          * hcap.network.asyncPing({
7127          *      "ip" : "192.168.100.1",
7128          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
7129          *          console.log("onSuccess");
7130          *      }, 
7131          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7132          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7133          *      }
7134          * });
7135          */
7136         hcap.network.asyncPing = function (param) {
7137             hcap_command("async_ping", param);
7138         };
7139         /**
7140          * Sets the vlan id mode is enabled or disabled.<br>
7141          * 
7142          * @param {Object} param
7143          * <ul>
7144          *   <li>{Boolean} param.enable [Required] - true : enable to vlan id mode, false : disable.</li>
7145          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7146          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7147          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
7148          *       // No Parameter. 
7149          *   }</pre>
7150          *   </li>
7151          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
7152          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7153          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7154          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7155          *   }</pre>
7156          *   </li>
7157          * </ul>
7158          *  
7159          * @since 1.22.0
7160          * 
7161          * @see
7162          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getVlanIdMode">hcap.network.getVlanIdMode()</a><br>
7163          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setLanId">hcap.network.setLanId()</a><br>
7164          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getLanId">hcap.network.getLanId()</a><br>
7165          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setAuxLanId">hcap.network.setAuxLanId()</a><br>
7166          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getAuxLanId">hcap.network.getAuxLanId()</a><br>
7167          * <a href="_global_.html#event:ui_value_changed">{Event} ui_value_changed</a><br>
7168          *
7169          * @example
7170          * hcap.network.setVlanIdMode({
7171          *      "enable" : true,
7172          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
7173          *          console.log("onSuccess");
7174          *      }, 
7175          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7176          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7177          *      }
7178          * });
7179          */
7180         hcap.network.setVlanIdMode = function (param) {
7181             hcap_command("set_vlan_id_mode", param);
7182         };
7183         /**
7184          * Gets whether vlan id mode is enabled or disabled.<br>
7185          * 
7186          * @param {Object} param
7187          * <ul>
7188          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7189          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7190          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
7191          *       // {Boolean} param.enable - true if the vlan id mode is enabled. false if the vlan id mode is disabled.
7192          *   }</pre>
7193          *   </li>
7194          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
7195          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7196          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7197          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7198          *   }</pre>
7199          *   </li>
7200          * </ul>
7201          *  
7202          * @since 1.22.0
7203          * 
7204          * @see
7205          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setVlanIdMode">hcap.network.setVlanIdMode()</a><br>
7206          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setLanId">hcap.network.setLanId()</a><br>
7207          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getLanId">hcap.network.getLanId()</a><br>
7208          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setAuxLanId">hcap.network.setAuxLanId()</a><br>
7209          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getAuxLanId">hcap.network.getAuxLanId()</a><br> 
7210          *
7211          * @example
7212          * hcap.network.getVlanIdMode({
7213          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
7214          *          console.log("onSuccess : vlan id mode= " + param.enable);
7215          *      }, 
7216          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7217          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7218          *      }
7219          * });
7220          */
7221         hcap.network.getVlanIdMode = function (param) {
7222             hcap_command("get_vlan_id_mode", param);
7223         };
7224         /**
7225          * Gets the current value of the lan id.<br>
7226          * 
7227          * @param {Object} param
7228          * <ul>
7229          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7230          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7231          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
7232          *       // {Number} param.lanId - current value of the lan id (1~4094).
7233          *   }</pre>
7234          *   </li>
7235          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
7236          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7237          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7238          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7239          *   }</pre>
7240          *   </li>
7241          * </ul>
7242          * 
7243          * @since 1.22.0
7244          * 
7245          * @see
