7246          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setVlanIdMode">hcap.network.setVlanIdMode()</a><br>
7247          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getVlanIdMode">hcap.network.getVlanIdMode()</a><br>
7248          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setLanId">hcap.network.setLanId()</a><br>
7249          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setAuxLanId">hcap.network.setAuxLanId()</a><br>
7250          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getAuxLanId">hcap.network.getAuxLanId()</a><br> 
7251          *
7252          * @example
7253          * hcap.network.getLanId({
7254          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
7255          *          console.log("onSuccess : lan id = " + s.lanId);
7256          *      }, 
7257          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7258          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7259          *      }
7260          * });
7261          */
7262         hcap.network.getLanId = function (param) {
7263             hcap_command("get_lan_id", param);
7264         };
7265         /**
7266          * Sets the lan id.<br>
7267          * This is worked only when the vlan id mode is enabled.<br>
7268          *
7269          * @param {Object} param
7270          * <ul>
7271          *   <li>{Number} param.lanId [Required] - range is 1~4094.</li>
7272          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7273          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7274          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
7275          *       // No Parameter.
7276          *   }</pre>
7277          *   </li>
7278          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
7279          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7280          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7281          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7282          *   }</pre>
7283          *   </li>
7284          * </ul>
7285          * 
7286          * @since 1.22.0
7287          * 
7288          * @see
7289          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setVlanIdMode">hcap.network.setVlanIdMode()</a><br>
7290          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getVlanIdMode">hcap.network.getVlanIdMode()</a><br>
7291          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getLanId">hcap.network.getLanId()</a><br>
7292          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setAuxLanId">hcap.network.setAuxLanId()</a><br>
7293          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getAuxLanId">hcap.network.getAuxLanId()</a><br> 
7294          *
7295          * @example
7296          * hcap.network.setLanId({
7297          *      "lanId" : 50, 
7298          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
7299          *          console.log("onSuccess");
7300          *      }, 
7301          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7302          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7303          *      }
7304          * });
7305          */        
7306         hcap.network.setLanId = function (param) {
7307             hcap_command("set_lan_id", param);
7308         };
7309         /**
7310          * Gets the current value of the aux lan id.<br>
7311          * 
7312          * @param {Object} param
7313          * <ul>
7314          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7315          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7316          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
7317          *       // {Number} param.auxLanId - current value of the aux lan id (1~4094).
7318          *   }</pre>
7319          *   </li>
7320          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
7321          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7322          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7323          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7324          *   }</pre>
7325          *   </li>
7326          * </ul>
7327          * 
7328          * @since 1.22.0
7329          * 
7330          * @see
7331          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setVlanIdMode">hcap.network.setVlanIdMode()</a><br>
7332          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getVlanIdMode">hcap.network.getVlanIdMode()</a><br>
7333          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setLanId">hcap.network.setLanId()</a><br>
7334          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getLanId">hcap.network.getLanId()</a><br>
7335          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setAuxLanId">hcap.network.setAuxLanId()</a><br>
7336          *
7337          * @example
7338          * hcap.network.getAuxLanId({
7339          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
7340          *          console.log("onSuccess : aux lan id = " + s.auxLanId);
7341          *      }, 
7342          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7343          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7344          *      }
7345          * });
7346          */
7347         hcap.network.getAuxLanId = function (param) {
7348             hcap_command("get_aux_lan_id", param);
7349         };
7350         /**
7351          * Sets the aux lan id.<br>
7352          * This is worked only when the vlan id mode is enabled.<br>
7353          *
7354          * @param {Object} param
7355          * <ul>
7356          *   <li>{Number} param.auxLanId [Required] - range is 1~4094.</li>
7357          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7358          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7359          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
7360          *       // No Parameter.
7361          *   }</pre>
7362          *   </li>
7363          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
7364          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7365          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7366          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7367          *   }</pre>
7368          *   </li>
7369          * </ul>
7370          * 
7371          * @since 1.22.0
7372          * 
7373          * @see
7374          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setVlanIdMode">hcap.network.setVlanIdMode()</a><br>
7375          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getVlanIdMode">hcap.network.getVlanIdMode()</a><br>
7376          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setLanId">hcap.network.setLanId()</a><br>
7377          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getLanId">hcap.network.getLanId()</a><br>
7378          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getAuxLanId">hcap.network.getAuxLanId()</a><br>
7379          *
7380          * @example
7381          * hcap.network.setAuxLanId({
7382          *      "auxLanId" : 50, 
7383          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
7384          *          console.log("onSuccess");
7385          *      }, 
7386          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7387          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7388          *      }
7389          * });
7390          */
7391         hcap.network.setAuxLanId = function (param) {
7392             hcap_command("set_aux_lan_id", param);
7393         };
7394         /**
7395 		 * Gets the blocked port list.<br>
7396 		 * 
7397 		 * @param {Object} param
7398 		 * <ul>
7399 		 *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7400 		 *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7401 		 *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
7402 		 *       // {Array} param.blockedPortList - list of blocked port.
7403 		 *       // {String} param.blockedPortList[].blockedPort - blocked port number
7404 		 *       // {String} param.blockedPortList[].protocol - protocol
7405 		 *       // {String} param.blockedPortList[].direction - blocking direction
7406 		 *   }</pre>
7407 		 *   </li>
7408 		 *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
7409 		 *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7410 		 *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7411 		 *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7412 		 *   }</pre>
7413 		 *   </li>
7414 		 * </ul>
7415 		 * 
7416 		 * @since 1.24.0
7417 		 * 
7418 		 * @see
7419 		 * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setBlockedPortList">hcap.network.setBlockedPortList()</a><br>
7420 		 *
7421 		 * @example
7422 		 * hcap.network.getBlockedPortList({
7423          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
7424          *          console.log("onSuccess : blockedPortList length = " + s.blockedPortList.length);
7425          *          for (var i = 0; i < s.blockedPortList.length; i++) {
7426          *              console.log(
7427          *                  "list[" + i + "].blockedPort = " + s.list[i].blockedPort +
7428          *                  "list[" + i + "].protocol = " + s.list[i].protocol +
7429          *                  "list[" + i + "].direction = " + s.list[i].direction
7430          *              );
7431          *          }
7432          *      },
7433 		 *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7434 		 *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7435 		 *      }
7436 		 * });
7437 		 */
7438 		hcap.network.getBlockedPortList = function (param) {
7439 			hcap_command("get_blocked_port_list", param);
7440 		};
7441 		/**
7442 		 * Sets the blocked port list.<br>
7443 		 *
7444 		 * @param {Object} param
7445 		 * <ul>
7446 		 *   <li>{Array} param.blockedPortList [Required] - blocked port list</li>
7447 		 *   <li>{String} param.blockedPortList[].blockedPort [Required] - blocked port number( 0~65535 )</li>
7448 		 *   <li>{String} param.blockedPortList[].protocol [Required] - protocol ( tcp/udp )</li>
7449 		 *   <li>{String} param.blockedPortList[].direction [Required] - blocking direction( all/in/out )</li>
7450 		 *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7451 		 *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7452 		 *   param.onSuccess = function() {
7453 		 *       // No Parameter.
7454 		 *   }</pre>
7455 		 *   </li>
7456 		 *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
7457 		 *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7458 		 *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7459 		 *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7460 		 *   }</pre>
7461 		 *   </li>
7462 		 * </ul>
7463 		 * 
7464 		 * @since 1.24.0
7465 		 * 
7466 		 * @see
7467 		 * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getBlockedPortList">hcap.network.getBlockedPortList()</a><br>
7468 		 *
7469 		 * @example
7470 		 * hcap.network.setBlockedPortList({
7471 		 *      "blockedPortList" : [{"blockedPort":"33252", "protocol":"tcp", "direction":"all"},{"blockedPort":"33322", "protocol":"tcp", "direction":"in"},{"blockedPort":"53422", "protocol":"udp", "direction":"out"}], 
7472 		 *      "onSuccess" : function() {
7473 		 *          console.log("onSuccess");
7474 		 *      }, 
7475 		 *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7476 		 *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7477 		 *      }
7478 		 * });
7479 		 */
7480 		hcap.network.setBlockedPortList = function (param) {
7481 			hcap_command("set_blocked_port_list", param);
7482 		};
7483         /**
7484          * @namespace hcap.mode
7485          */
7486         hcap.mode = {};
7487         /**
7488              * HCAP mode 0
7489              * @since 1.3.1
7490              * @constant
7491              */
7492         hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_0                      = 0x101;
7493             /**
7494              * HCAP mode 1
7495              * @since 1.3.1
7496              * @constant
7497              */
7498         hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_1                      = 0x102;
7499             /**
7500              * HCAP mode 2
7501              * @since 1.3.1
7502              * @constant
7503              */
7504         hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_2                      = 0x103;
7505             /**
7506              * HCAP mode 3
7507              * @since 1.3.1
7508              * @constant
7509              */
7510         hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_3                      = 0x104;
7511             /**
7512              * HCAP mode 4
7513              * @since 1.3.1
7514              * @constant
7515              */
7516         hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_4                      = 0x105;
7517         /**
7518          * Gets the current HCAP mode.<br><br>
7519          * Hcap mode is related to the application visibility and the key control.<br><br>
7520          * Following table specifies application visibility for each HCAP mode.<br>
7521          * 
7522          * <div align=center>
7523          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=600>
7524          *   <thead>
7525          *     <tr>
7526          *     <th></th>
7527          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_0">HCAP_MODE_0</a></th>
7528          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_1">HCAP_MODE_1</a></th>
7529          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_2">HCAP_MODE_2</a></th>
7530          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_3">HCAP_MODE_3</a></th>
7531          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_4">HCAP_MODE_4</a></th>
7532          *     </tr>
7533          *   </thead>
7534          *   <tbody>
7535          *     <tr class="odd">
7536          *       <td>Application Visibility</td>
7537          *       <td>X</td>
7538          *       <td>O</td>
7539          *       <td>O</td>
7540          *       <td>O</td>
7541          *       <td>O</td>
7542          *     </tr>
7543          *   </tbody>
7544          *   <tfoot>
7545          *     <tr><th colspan="6">HCAP Mode & Application Visibility (O : visible, X : invisible)</td></tr>
7546          *   </tfoot>
7547          * </table>
7548          * </div>
7549          * <br>
7550          * Following table specifies whether key is delivered to application or not for each HCAP mode.<br>
7551          * (O : key is delivered to application, X : key is not delivered to application)
7552          * <div align=center>
7553          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=600>
7554          *   <thead>
7555          *     <tr>
7556          *     <th>Key</th>
7557          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_0">HCAP_MODE_0</a></th>
7558          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_1">HCAP_MODE_1</a></th>
7559          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_2">HCAP_MODE_2</a></th>
7560          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_3">HCAP_MODE_3</a></th>
7561          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_4">HCAP_MODE_4</a></th>
7562          *     </tr>
7563          *   </thead>
7564          *   <tbody>
7565          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.NUM_0">       NUM_0~NUM_9     </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td></tr>
7566          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.MINUS">       MINUS           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td></tr>
7567          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.CH_UP">       CH_UP           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>O</td></tr>
7568          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.CH_DOWN">     CH_DOWN         </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>O</td></tr>
7569          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.GUIDE">       GUIDE           </a></td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7570          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.INFO">        INFO            </a></td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7571          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.LEFT">        LEFT            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7572          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.UP">          UP              </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7573          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.RIGHT">       RIGHT           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7574          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.DOWN">        DOWN            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7575          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.ENTER">       ENTER           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7576          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.BACK">        BACK            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7577          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.EXIT">        EXIT            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7578          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.RED">         RED             </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7579          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.GREEN">       GREEN           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7580          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.YELLOW">      YELLOW          </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7581          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.BLUE">        BLUE            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7582          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.STOP">        STOP            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7583          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.PLAY">        PLAY            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7584          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.PAUSE">       PAUSE           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7585          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.REWIND">      REWIND          </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7586          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.FAST_FORWARD">FAST_FORWARD    </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7587          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.LAST_CH">     LAST_CH         </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>O</td></tr>
7588          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.PORTAL">      PORTAL          </a></td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7589          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.ORDER">       ORDER           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7590          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.NETFLIX">     NETFLIX         </a></td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7591          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html">              Keys not in list</a></td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td></tr>
7592          *   </tbody>
7593          *   <tfoot>
7594          *     <tr><th colspan="6">HCAP Mode & Key Delivery</td></tr>
7595          *   </tfoot>
7596          * </table>
7597          * </div>
7598          *
7599          * @param {Object} param
7600          * <ul>
7601          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7602          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7603          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
7604          *       // {Number} param.mode - HCAP mode.
7605          *   }</pre>
7606          *   </li>
7607          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
7608          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7609          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7610          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7611          *   }</pre>
7612          *   </li>
7613          * </ul>
7614          * 
7615          * @see
7616          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.setHcapMode">hcap.mode.setHcapMode()</a><br>
7617          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_0">HCAP_MODE_0</a><br>
7618          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_1">HCAP_MODE_1</a><br>
7619          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_2">HCAP_MODE_2</a><br>
7620          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_3">HCAP_MODE_3</a><br>
7621          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_4">HCAP_MODE_4</a>
7622          * 
7623          * @since 1.3.1
7624          * 
7625          * @example
7626          * hcap.mode.getHcapMode({
7627          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
7628          *          console.log("onSuccess : current hcap mode = " + s.mode);
7629          *      }, 
7630          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7631          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7632          *      }
7633          * });
7634          */
7635         hcap.mode.getHcapMode = function (param) {
7636             hcap_command("get_mw_mode", param);
7637         };
7638         /**
7639          * Sets the HCAP mode.<br>
7640          * Please refer to <a href="hcap.mode.html#.getHcapMode">hcap.mode.getHcapMode()</a> for the detailed information regarding the HCAP mode.
7641          *
7642          * @param {Object} param
7643          * <ul>
7644          *   <li>{Number} param.mode [Required] - HCAP mode.</li>
7645          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
7646          *         Setting to the same HCAP mode as before will invoke this callback function.
7647          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7648          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
7649          *       // No parameter.
7650          *   }</pre>
7651          *   </li>
7652          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
7653          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7654          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7655          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7656          *   }</pre>
7657          *   </li>
7658          * </ul>
7659          *  
7660          * @since 1.3.1
7661          * 
7662          * @see
7663          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.getHcapMode">hcap.mode.getHcapMode()</a><br>
7664          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_0">HCAP_MODE_0</a><br>
7665          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_1">HCAP_MODE_1</a><br>
7666          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_2">HCAP_MODE_2</a><br>
7667          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_3">HCAP_MODE_3</a><br>
7668          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_4">HCAP_MODE_4</a>
7669          *
7670          * @example
7671          * hcap.mode.setHcapMode({
7672          *      "mode" : hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_2,
7673          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
7674          *          console.log("onSuccess");
7675          *      }, 
7676          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7677          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7678          *      }
7679          * });
7680          */
7681         hcap.mode.setHcapMode = function (param) {
7682             hcap_command("set_mw_mode", param);
7683         };
7684         /**
7685          * @namespace hcap.key
7686          */
7687         hcap.key = {};
7688         /**
7689          * @namespace hcap.key.Code
7690          */
7691         hcap.key.Code = {
7692             /**
7693              * Number 0 key.
7694              * @since 1.3.1
7695              * @constant
7696              */
7697             NUM_0 : 0x0030,
7698             /**
7699              * Number 1 key.
7700              * @since 1.3.1
7701              * @constant
7702              */
7703             NUM_1 : 0x0031,
7704             /**
7705              * Number 2 key.
7706              * @since 1.3.1
7707              * @constant
7708              */
7709             NUM_2 : 0x0032,
7710             /**
7711              * Number 3 key.
7712              * @since 1.3.1
7713              * @constant
7714              */
7715             NUM_3 : 0x0033,
7716             /**
7717              * Number 4 key.
7718              * @since 1.3.1
7719              * @constant
7720              */
7721             NUM_4 : 0x0034,
7722             /**
7723              * Number 5 key.
7724              * @since 1.3.1
7725              * @constant
7726              */
7727             NUM_5 : 0x0035,
7728             /**
7729              * Number 6 key.
7730              * @since 1.3.1
7731              * @constant
7732              */
7733             NUM_6 : 0x0036,
7734             /**
7735              * Number 7 key.
7736              * @since 1.3.1
7737              * @constant
7738              */
7739             NUM_7 : 0x0037,
7740             /**
7741              * Number 8 key.
7742              * @since 1.3.1
7743              * @constant
7744              */
7745             NUM_8 : 0x0038,
7746             /**
7747              * Number 9 key.
7748              * @since 1.3.1
7749              * @constant
7750              */
7751             NUM_9 : 0x0039,

7754              * @since 1.3.1
7755              * @constant
7756              */
7757             CH_UP : 0x01AB,

8369            K_U : 0x055,

8372             * @since 1.20.8
8373             * @constant
8374             */
8375            K_I : 0x049,
8376            /**

8378             * @since 1.20.8
8379             * @constant
8380             */
8381            K_O : 0x04F,
8382            /**
8383             * Keyboard key : p
8384             * @since 1.20.8
8385             * @constant
8386             */
8387            K_P : 0x050,
8388            /**
8389             * Keyboard key : Rightbracket(])
8390             * @since 1.20.8
8391             * @constant
8392             */
8393            K_RBRACKET : 0x0DD,
8394            /**
8395             * Keyboard key : Leftbracket([)
8396             * @since 1.20.8
8397             * @constant
8398             */
8399            K_LBRACKET : 0x0DB,
8400            /**

8402             * @since 1.20.8
8403             * @constant
8404             */
8405            K_BACKSLASH : 0x0DC,
8406            /**

8408             * @since 1.20.8
8409             * @constant
8410             */
8411            K_A : 0x041,

8718            /**

8720             * @since 1.20.8

8722             */
8723            K_WIN: 0x05B,
8724             /**
8725 		    * Assistive Menu key.
8726 		    * @since 1.21.5
8727 		    * @constant
8728             */
8729             ASSISTIVE_MENU : 0x02E3,
8730             /**

8733             * @constant
8734             */
8735             THREE_DIGIT_INPUT : 0x02E4,
8736             /**

8738             * @since 1.23.2
8739             * @constant
8740             */
8741             LIVETV : 0x02E5,
8742             /**
8743             * Go to Prev key.
8744             * @since 1.23.2
8745             * @constant
8746             */
8747             GOTOPREV : 0x02E6,
8748             /**
8749             * Go to Next key.
8750             * @since 1.23.2
8751             * @constant
8752             */
8753             GOTONEXT : 0x02E7,
8754             /**
8755             * Terrestrial channel type change key.
8756             * @since 1.23.2
8757             * @constant
8758             */
8759             TER : 0x02E8,
8760             /**
8761             * BS channel type change key.
8762             * @since 1.23.2
8763             * @constant
8764             */
8765             BS : 0x02E9,
8766             /**
8767             * CS1 channel type change key.
8768             * @since 1.23.2
8769             * @constant
8770             */
8771             CS1 : 0x02EA,
8772             /**
8773             * CS2 channel type change key.
8774             * @since 1.23.2
8775             * @constant
8776             */
8777             CS2 : 0x02EB,
8778             /**
8779             * CS4K channel type change key.
8780             * @since 1.23.2
8781             * @constant
8782             */
8783             CS4K : 0x02EC,
8784             /**
8785             * BS4K channel type change key.
8786             * @since 1.23.2
8787             * @constant
8788             */
8789             BS4K : 0x02ED,
8790             /**
8791             * Number 11 key.
8792             * @since 1.23.2
8793             * @constant
8794             */
8795             NUM_11 : 0x02EE,
8796             /**
8797             * Number 12 key.
8798             * @since 1.23.2
8799             * @constant
8800             */
8801 			NUM_12 : 0x02EF,
8802 			/**
8803             * Netflix key.
8804             * @since 1.24.3
8805             * @constant
8806             */ 			
8807             NETFLIX : 0x040D
8808         };
8809         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_0]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_0;                // 0x0030(48) => 0x0030(48)
8810         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_1]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_1;                // 0x0031(49) => 0x0031(49)
8811         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_2]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_2;                // 0x0032(50) => 0x0032(50)
8812         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_3]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_3;                // 0x0033(51) => 0x0033(51)
8813         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_4]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_4;                // 0x0034(52) => 0x0034(52)

8816         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_7]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_7;                // 0x0037(55) => 0x0037(55)

8818         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_9]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_9;                // 0x0039(57) => 0x0039(57)

8820         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.CH_DOWN]           = hcap.key.Code.CH_DOWN;              // 0x01AC(428) => 0x01AC(428)
8821         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.GUIDE]             = hcap.key.Code.GUIDE;                // 0x01CA(458) => 0x01CA(458)
8822         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.INFO]              = hcap.key.Code.INFO;                 // 0x01C9(457) => 0x01C9(457)

8883         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.ENERGY_SAVING]     = hcap.key.Code.ENERGY_SAVING;        // 0x02C5(709) => 0x02C5(709)
8884         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.FAV]               = hcap.key.Code.FAV;                  // 0x02C6(710) => 0x02C6(710)
8885         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.FLASHBK]           = hcap.key.Code.FLASHBK;              // 0x02C7(711) => 0x02C7(711)
8886         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.INPUT]             = hcap.key.Code.INPUT;                // 0x02C8(712) => 0x02C8(712)
8887         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.MARK]              = hcap.key.Code.MARK;                 // 0x02C9(713) => 0x02C9(713)
8888         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NETCAST]           = 714;                                // 0x03E8(1000) => 0x02CA(714)
8889         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PIP]               = hcap.key.Code.PIP;                  // 0x02CB(715) => 0x02CB(715)
8890         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PIP_CH_DOWN]       = hcap.key.Code.PIP_CH_DOWN;          // 0x02CC(716) => 0x02CC(716)
8891         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PIP_CH_UP]         = hcap.key.Code.PIP_CH_UP;            // 0x02CD(717) => 0x02CD(717)
8892         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PIP_INPUT]         = hcap.key.Code.PIP_INPUT;            // 0x02CE(718) => 0x02CE(718)
8893         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PIP_SWAP]          = hcap.key.Code.PIP_SWAP;             // 0x02CF(719) => 0x02CF(719)
8894         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.Q_MENU]            = 720;                                // *0x03EA(1002) => 0x02D0(720)
8895         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.Q_VIEW]            = 721;                                // *0x03EF(1007) => 0x02D1(721)
8896         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RATIO]             = 722;                                // *0x03ED(1005) => 0x02D2(722)
8897         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SAP]               = hcap.key.Code.SAP;                  // 0x02D3(723) => 0x02D3(723)
8898         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SIMPLINK]          = hcap.key.Code.SIMPLINK;             // 0x02D4(724) => 0x02D4(724)
8899         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.STB]               = hcap.key.Code.STB;                  // 0x02D5(725) => 0x02D5(725)
8900         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.T_OPT]             = 727;                                // *0x03EC(1004) => 0x02D7(727)
8901         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.TEXT]              = 728;                                // *0x01CB(459) => 0x02D8(728)
8902         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SLEEP_TIMER]       = hcap.key.Code.SLEEP_TIMER;          // 0x02D9(729) => 0x02D9(729)
8903         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.TV]                = hcap.key.Code.TV;                   // 0x02DA(730) => 0x02DA(730)
8904         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.TV_RAD]            = hcap.key.Code.TV_RAD;               // 0x02DB(731) => 0x02DB(731)
8905         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.VCR]               = hcap.key.Code.VCR;                  // 0x02DC(732) => 0x02DC(732)
8906         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.POWER_LOWBATTERY]  = hcap.key.Code.POWER_LOWBATTERY;     // 0x02DD(733) => 0x02DD(733)
8907         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SMART_HOME]        = hcap.key.Code.SMART_HOME;           // 0x02DE(734) => 0x02DE(734)
8908         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SCREEN_REMOTE]     = hcap.key.Code.SCREEN_REMOTE;        // 0x02DF(735) => 0x02DF(735)
8909         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.POINTER]           = hcap.key.Code.POINTER;              // 0x02E0(736) => 0x02E0(736)
8910         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.LG_3D]             = hcap.key.Code.LG_3D;                // 0x02E1(737) => 0x02E1(737)
8911         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.DATA]              = hcap.key.Code.DATA;                 // 0x02E2(738) => 0x02E2(738)
8912         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_GRAVE]           = hcap.key.Code.K_GRAVE;              // 0x0C0(192) => 0x0C0(192)
8913         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_MINUS]           = hcap.key.Code.K_MINUS;              // 0x0BD(189) => 0x0BD(189)
8914         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_EQUAL]           = hcap.key.Code.K_EQUAL;              // 0x0BB(187) => 0x0BB(187)
8915         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_Q]               = hcap.key.Code.K_Q;                  // 0x051(81) => 0x051(81)
8916         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_W]               = hcap.key.Code.K_W;                  // 0x057(87) => 0x057(87)
8917         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_E]               = hcap.key.Code.K_E;                  // 0x045(69) => 0x045(69)
8918         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_R]               = hcap.key.Code.K_R;                  // 0x052(82) => 0x052(82)
8919         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_T]               = hcap.key.Code.K_T;                  // 0x054(84) => 0x054(84)
8920         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_Y]               = hcap.key.Code.K_Y;                  // 0x059(89) => 0x059(89)
8921         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_U]               = hcap.key.Code.K_U;                  // 0x055(85) => 0x055(85)
8922         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_I]               = hcap.key.Code.K_I;                  // 0x049(73) => 0x049(73)

8946         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_COMMA]           = hcap.key.Code.K_COMMA;              // 0x0BC(188) => 0x0BC(188)
8947         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_DOT]             = hcap.key.Code.K_DOT;                // 0x0BE(190) => 0x0BE(190)
8948         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_SLASH]           = hcap.key.Code.K_SLASH;              // 0x0BF(191) => 0x0BF(191)
8949         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_ASTERISK]        = hcap.key.Code.K_ASTERISK;           // 0x06A(106) => 0x06A(106)
8950         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_PLUS]            = hcap.key.Code.K_PLUS;               // 0x06B(107) => 0x06B(107)
8951         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_SPACE]           = hcap.key.Code.K_SPACE;              // 0x020(32) => 0x020(32)
8952         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_F7]              = hcap.key.Code.K_F7;                 // 0x076(118) => 0x076(118)
8953         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_F8]              = hcap.key.Code.K_F8;                 // 0x077(119) => 0x077(119)
8954         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_F9]              = hcap.key.Code.K_F9;                 // 0x078(120) => 0x078(120)
8955         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_F10]             = hcap.key.Code.K_F10;                // 0x079(121) => 0x079(121)
8956         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_F11]             = hcap.key.Code.K_F11;                // 0x07A(122) => 0x07A(122)
8957         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_F12]             = hcap.key.Code.K_F12;                // 0x07B(123) => 0x07B(123)
8958         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_ENTER]           = hcap.key.Code.K_ENTER;              // 0x0D(13) => 0x0D(13)
8959         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_ESC]             = hcap.key.Code.K_ESC;                // 0x01B(113) => 0x01B(113)
8960         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_BACKSPACE]       = hcap.key.Code.K_BACKSPACE;          // 0x08(8) => 0x08(8)
8961         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_TAB]             = hcap.key.Code.K_TAB;                // 0x09(9) => 0x09(9)
8962         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_CAPSLOCK]        = hcap.key.Code.K_CAPSLOCK;           // 0x014(20) => 0x014(20)
8963         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_SHIFT]           = hcap.key.Code.K_SHIFT;              // 0x010(16) => 0x010(16)
8964         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_CTRL]            = hcap.key.Code.K_CTRL;               // 0x011(17) => 0x011(17)
8965         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_LALT]            = hcap.key.Code.K_LALT;               // 0x012(18) => 0x012(18)
8966         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_RALT]            = hcap.key.Code.K_RALT;               // 0x012(18) => 0x012(18)
8967         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_KOR_ENG]         = hcap.key.Code.K_KOR_ENG;            // 0x015(21) => 0x015(21)
8968         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_SCRLLOCK]        = hcap.key.Code.K_SCRLLOCK;           // 0x091(145) => 0x091(145)
8969         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_INSERT]          = 1045;                               // 0x02D(45) => 0x415(1045) BSIDFC-3764
8970         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_HOME]            = hcap.key.Code.K_HOME;               // 0x024(36) => 0x024(36)
8971         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_DELETE]          = hcap.key.Code.K_DELETE;             // 0x02E(46) => 0x02E(46)
8972         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_END]             = hcap.key.Code.K_END;                // 0x023(35) => 0x023(35)
8973         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_NUMLOCK]         = hcap.key.Code.K_NUMLOCK;            // 0x090(144) => 0x090(144)
8974         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.K_WIN]             = hcap.key.Code.K_WIN;                // 0x05B(91) => 0x05B(91)
8975         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.ASSISTIVE_MENU]    = hcap.key.Code.ASSISTIVE_MENU;       // 0x02E3(739) => 0x02E3(739)
8976         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.THREE_DIGIT_INPUT] = hcap.key.Code.THREE_DIGIT_INPUT;    // 0x02E4(740) => 0x02E4(740)
8977         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.LIVETV]            = hcap.key.Code.LIVETV;               // 0x02E5(741) => 0x02E5(741)
8978         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.GOTOPREV]          = hcap.key.Code.GOTOPREV;             // 0x02E6(742) => 0x02E6(742)
8979         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.GOTONEXT]          = hcap.key.Code.GOTONEXT;             // 0x02E7(743) => 0x02E7(743)
8980         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.TER]               = hcap.key.Code.TER;                  // 0x02E8(744) => 0x02E8(744)
8981         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.BS]                = hcap.key.Code.BS;                   // 0x02E9(745) => 0x02E9(745)
8982         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.CS1]               = hcap.key.Code.CS1;                  // 0x02EA(746) => 0x02EA(746)
8983         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.CS2]               = hcap.key.Code.CS2;                  // 0x02EB(747) => 0x02EB(747)
8984         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.CS4K]              = hcap.key.Code.CS4K;                 // 0x02EC(748) => 0x02EC(748)
8985         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.BS4K]              = hcap.key.Code.BS4K;                 // 0x02ED(749) => 0x02ED(749)
8986         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_11]            = hcap.key.Code.NUM_11;               // 0x02EE(750) => 0x02EE(750)
8987         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_12]            = hcap.key.Code.NUM_12;               // 0x02EF(751) => 0x02EF(751)
8988 		hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NETFLIX]           = 752;              				  // *0x040D(1037) => 0x02F0(752)
8989                 
8990         /**
8991          * Add/Modify a key item in the key table.<br>
8992          * <ul>
8993          *   <li>Add : If keycode is not in the key table, the key item will be added to the key table.</li>
8994          *   <li>Modify : If keycode is in the key table, but its virtual_keycode or attribute is different, the key item in the key table will be modified.</li>
8995          * </ul>
8996          * Keycode with attribute 2 or 3 in the key table is delivered to application as its virtual_keycode, not keycode.<br>
8997          * Keycode not in the key table is delivered to application as the keycode itself.
8998          *  
8999          * @param {Object} param
9000          * <ul>
9001          *   <li>{Number} param.keycode [Required] - custom RCU raw data (4 bytes). 0x00000000 for all LG RCU reserved keycode.</li>
9002          *   <li>{Number} param.virtualKeycode [Required] - virtual keycode defined by LG in <a href="hcap.key.Code.html">hcap.key.Code</a>.</li>
9003          *   <li>{Number} param.attribute [Required] - attribute of the key item.<br>
9004          *   <div align=center>
9005          *     <table class="hcap_spec" width=600>
9006          *       <thead>
9007          *         <tr>
9008          *           <th>Attribute</th>
9009          *           <th>Action</th>
9010          *         </tr>
9011          *       </thead>
9012          *       <tbody>
9013          *         <tr class="odd"><td>0</td><td class="left">Processed by TV (LG firmware). For Portal key (hcap.key.Code.PORTAL) when its attribute is 0, TV will launch the initial HCAP page.</td></tr>
9014          *         <tr>            <td>1</td><td class="left">Processed according to HCAP Mode defined in <a href="hcap.mode.html#.getHcapMode">hcap.mode.getHcapMode()</a>.</td></tr>
9015          *         <tr class="odd"><td>2</td><td class="left">Processed by application.</td></tr>
9016          *         <tr>            <td>3</td><td class="left">Processed by browser and application on browser while browser is running. Otherwise, processed by TV (LG firmware).</td></tr>
9017          *       </tbody>
9018          *       <tfoot>
9019          *         <tr><th colspan="6">HCAP Key Attribute & Action</td></tr>
9020          *       </tfoot>
9021          *     </table>
9022          *   </div>
9023          *   </li>
9024          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
9025          *       Setting to the same setting as before will invoke this callback function.
9026          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9027          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9028          *       // No parameter.
9029          *   }</pre>
9030          *   </li>
9031          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9032          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9033          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9034          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9035          *   }</pre>
9036          *   </li>
9037          * </ul>
9038          *  
9039          * @since 1.3.1
9040          * 
9041          * @see
9042          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.clearKeyTable">hcap.key.clearKeyTable()</a><br>
9043          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.removeKeyItem">hcap.key.removeKeyItem()</a><br>
9044          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.sendKey">hcap.key.sendKey()</a>
9045          *
9046          * @example
9047          * // add custom keycode as MENU with attribue 2 and change the attribute of LG GUIDE key to attribute 0
9048          * hcap.key.addKeyItem({
9049          *      "keycode" : 0x12345678,
9050          *      "virtualKeycode" : hcap.key.Code.MENU,
9051          *      "attribute" : 2,
9052          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9053          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9054          *          hcap.key.addKeyItem({
9055          *               "keycode" : 0,
9056          *               "virtualKeycode" : hcap.key.Code.GUIDE,
9057          *               "attribute" : 0,
9058          *               "onSuccess" : function() {
9059          *                   console.log("onSuccess");
9060          *               }, 
9061          *               "onFailure" : function(f) {
9062          *                   console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9063          *               }
9064          *          });
9065          *      }, 
9066          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9067          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9068          *      }
9069          * });
9070          */
9071         hcap.key.addKeyItem = function (param) {
9072             param.virtualKeycode = hcap_key_table[param.virtualKeycode];
9073             hcap_command("add_key_item", param);
9074         };
9075         /**
9076          * Remove a key item in the key table.
9077          *  
9078          * @param {Object} param
9079          * <ul>
9080          *   <li>{Number} param.keycode [Required] - custom RCU raw data (4 bytes) to remove. If the keycode is 0x00000000 (reserved keycode for LG RCU), param.onFailure is invoked.</li>
9081          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
9082          *       Remove for the keycode not in the key table will invoke this callback function.
9083          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9084          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9085          *       // No parameter.
9086          *   }</pre>
9087          *   </li>
9088          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9089          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9090          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9091          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9092          *   }</pre>
9093          *   </li>
9094          * </ul>
9095          *  
9096          * @since 1.3.1
9097          * 
9098          * @see
9099          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.addKeyItem">hcap.key.addKeyItem()</a><br>
9100          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.clearKeyTable">hcap.key.clearKeyTable()</a><br>
9101          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.sendKey">hcap.key.sendKey()</a>
9102          *
9103          * @example
9104          * hcap.key.removeKeyItem({
9105          *      "keycode" : 0x12345678,
9106          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9107          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9108          *      }, 
9109          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9110          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9111          *      }
9112          * });
9113          */
9114         hcap.key.removeKeyItem = function (param) {
9115             hcap_command("remove_key_item", param);
9116         };
9117         /**
9118          * Clear the key table and restore it to the factory default.
9119          *  
9120          * @param {Object} param
9121          * <ul>
9122          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9123          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9124          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9125          *       // No parameter.
9126          *   }</pre>
9127          *   </li>
9128          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9129          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9130          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9131          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9132          *   }</pre>
9133          *   </li>
9134          * </ul>
9135          *  
9136          * @since 1.3.1
9137          * 
9138          * @see
9139          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.addKeyItem">hcap.key.addKeyItem()</a><br>
9140          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.removeKeyItem">hcap.key.removeKeyItem()</a><br>
9141          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.sendKey">hcap.key.sendKey()</a>
9142          *
9143          * @example
9144          * hcap.key.clearKeyTable({
9145          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9146          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9147          *      }, 
9148          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9149          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9150          *      }
9151          * });
9152          */
9153         hcap.key.clearKeyTable = function (param) {
9154             hcap_command("clear_key_table", param);
9155         };
9156         /**
9157          * Deliver a virtual keycode from application to TV.<br>
9158          * virtual_keycode is defined by LG and is processed like a key from LG RCU.<br>
9159          * Therefore the delivered virtual_keycode is mapped to a key item [keycode = 0x00000000, virtual_keycode] in the key table.<br>
9160          * Application should be cautious not to come into the infinite loop because the sent key to TV can come back to the application again according to the key table setting.<br>
9161          * Also using modifers can combine keys
9162          *  
9163          *  
9164          * @param {Object} param
9165          * <ul>
9166          *   <li>{Number} param.virtualKeycode [Required] - virtual keycode defined in <a href="hcap.key.Code.html">hcap.key.Code</a>.</li>
9167          *   <li>{Number} param.modifier [Required] - modifier key / virtual keycode defined in <a href="hcap.key.Code.html">hcap.key.Code</a>.</li>
9168          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9169          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9170          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9171          *       // No parameter.
9172          *   }</pre>
9173          *   </li>
9174          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9175          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9176          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9177          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9178          *   }</pre>
9179          *   </li>
9180          * </ul>
9181          *  
9182          * @since 1.3.1
9183          * 
9184          * @see
9185          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.addKeyItem">hcap.key.addKeyItem()</a><br>
9186          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.clearKeyTable">hcap.key.clearKeyTable()</a><br>
9187          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.removeKeyItem">hcap.key.removeKeyItem()</a>
9188          *
9189          * @example
9190          * hcap.key.sendKey({
9191          *      "virtualKeycode" : hcap.key.Code.MENU,
9192          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9193          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9194          *      }, 
9195          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9196          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9197          *      }
9198          * });
9199          * 
9200          * hcap.key.sendKey({
9201          *      "virtualKeycode" : hcap.key.Code.NUM_1,
9202          *      "modifier" : hcap.key.Code.CS1,
9203          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9204          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9205          *      }, 
9206          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9207          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9208          *      }
9209          * });
9210          */
9211         hcap.key.sendKey = function (param) {
9212             param.virtualKeycode = hcap_key_table[param.virtualKeycode];
9213             hcap_command("send_key", param);
9214         };
9215         /**
9216          * @namespace hcap.mouse
9217          */
9218         hcap.mouse = {};
9219         /**
9220          * Checks whether the mouse pointer is visible or not. 
9221          *  
9222          * @param {Object} param
9223          * <ul>
9224          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9225          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9226          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
9227          *       // {Boolean} param.isVisible - true if the mouse pointer is visible, else false.
9228          *   }</pre>
9229          *   </li>
9230          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9231          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9232          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9233          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9234          *   }</pre>
9235          *   </li>
9236          * </ul>
9237          *  
9238          * @since 1.3.1
9239          * 
9240          * @see
9241          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setMouseVisible">hcap.mouse.setMouseVisible()</a>
9242          *
9243          * @example
9244          * hcap.mouse.isMouseVisible({
9245          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
9246          *          console.log("onSuccess : mouse visible = " + s.isVisible);
9247          *      }, 
9248          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9249          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9250          *      }
9251          * });
9252          */
9253         hcap.mouse.isMouseVisible = function (param) {
9254             hcap_command("get_mouse_visible", param);
9255         };
9256         /**
9257          * Sets the mouse visibility.
9258          *  
9259          * @param {Object} param
9260          * <ul>
9261          *   <li>{Boolean} param.isVisible [Required] - true for mouse to be visible, else false.</li>
9262          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9263          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9264          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9265          *       // No Parameter.
9266          *   }</pre>
9267          *   </li>
9268          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9269          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9270          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9271          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9272          *   }</pre>
9273          *   </li>
9274          * </ul>
9275          *  
9276          * @since 1.3.1
9277          * 
9278          * @see
9279          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.isMouseVisible">hcap.mouse.isMouseVisible()</a>
9280          *
9281          * @example
9282          * hcap.mouse.setMouseVisible({
9283          *     "isVisible" : true,
9284          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9285          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9286          *      }, 
9287          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9288          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9289          *      }
9290          * });
9291          */
9292         hcap.mouse.setMouseVisible = function (param) {
9293             hcap_command("set_mouse_visible", param);
9294         };
9295         /**
9296          * Checks whether the pointer of pointing devices (MMR) is on or off.<br>
9297          * Mouse visibility APIs (hcap.mouse.isMouseVisible, hcap.mouse.setMouseVisible) are for virtual arrow cursor of HCAP browser handled by RCU in the environment physical pointing devices are not support.<br>
9298          * But pointer APIs (hcap.mouse.isPointerOn, hcap.mouse.setPointerOn) are for real mouse pointer of physical pointing devices.<br>
9299          * 
9300          * @param {Object} param
9301          * <ul>
9302          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9303          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9304          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
9305          *       // {Boolean} param.isOn - true if the pointer is on, else false.
9306          *   }</pre>
9307          *   </li>
9308          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9309          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9310          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9311          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9312          *   }</pre>
9313          *   </li>
9314          * </ul>
9315          *  
9316          * @since 1.19.0
9317          * 
9318          * @see
9319          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerOn">hcap.mouse.setPointerOn()</a>
9320          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.getPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition()</a>
9321          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition()</a>
9322          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.clickPointer">hcap.mouse.clickPointer()</a>
9323          *
9324          * @example
9325          * hcap.mouse.isPointerOn({
9326          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
9327          *          console.log("onSuccess : pointer on = " + s.isOn);
9328          *      }, 
9329          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9330          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9331          *      }
9332          * });
9333          */
9334         hcap.mouse.isPointerOn = function (param) {
9335             hcap_command("is_pointer_on", param);
9336         };
9337         /**
9338          * Switches on the pointer of pointing devices (MMR) or off.
9339          * 
9340          * @param {Object} param
9341          * <ul>
9342          *   <li>{Boolean} param.isOn [Required] - true for the pointer to be on, else false.</li>
9343          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9344          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9345          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9346          *       // No Parameter.
9347          *   }</pre>
9348          *   </li>
9349          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9350          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9351          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9352          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9353          *   }</pre>
9354          *   </li>
9355          * </ul>
9356          *  
9357          * @since 1.19.0
9358          * 
9359          * @see
9360          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.isPointerOn">hcap.mouse.isPointerOn()</a>
9361          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.getPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition()</a>
9362          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition()</a>
9363          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.clickPointer">hcap.mouse.clickPointer()</a>
9364          *
9365          * @example
9366          * hcap.mouse.setPointerOn({
9367          *     "isOn" : true,
9368          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9369          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9370          *      }, 
9371          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9372          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9373          *      }
9374          * });
9375          */
9376         hcap.mouse.setPointerOn = function (param) {
9377             hcap_command("set_pointer_on", param);
9378         };
9379         /**
9380          * Gets the pointer position of pointing devices (MMR).<br>
9381          * The position is the coordinate in the HCAP OSD resolution (Property "display_resolution").
9382          * 
9383          * @param {Object} param
9384          * <ul>
9385          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9386          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9387          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
9388          *       // {Number} param.x - X coordiate of the pointer.
9389          *       // {Number} param.y - Y coordiate of the pointer.
9390          *   }</pre>
9391          *   </li>
9392          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9393          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9394          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9395          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9396          *   }</pre>
9397          *   </li>
9398          * </ul>
9399          *  
9400          * @since 1.20.0
9401          * 
9402          * @see
9403          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.isPointerOn">hcap.mouse.isPointerOn()</a>
9404          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerOn">hcap.mouse.setPointerOn()</a>
9405          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition()</a>
9406          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.clickPointer">hcap.mouse.clickPointer()</a>
9407          *
9408          * @example
9409          * hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition({
9410          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
9411          *          console.log("onSuccess : pointer position (" + s.x + "," + s.y + ")");
9412          *      }, 
9413          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9414          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9415          *      }
9416          * });
9417          */
9418         hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition = function (param) {
9419             hcap_command("get_pointer_position", param);
9420         };
9421         /**
9422          * Sets the pointer position of pointing devices (MMR).<br>
9423          * The position is the coordinate in the HCAP OSD resolution (Property "display_resolution").
9424          * 
9425          * @param {Object} param
9426          * <ul>
9427          *   <li>{Number} param.x [Required] - X coordiate of the pointer.</li>
9428          *   <li>{Number} param.y [Required] - Y coordiate of the pointer.</li>
9429          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9430          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9431          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9432          *       // No Parameter.
9433          *   }</pre>
9434          *   </li>
9435          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9436          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9437          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9438          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9439          *   }</pre>
9440          *   </li>
9441          * </ul>
9442          *  
9443          * @since 1.20.0
9444          * 
9445          * @see
9446          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.isPointerOn">hcap.mouse.isPointerOn()</a>
9447          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerOn">hcap.mouse.setPointerOn()</a>
9448          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.getPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition()</a>
9449          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.clickPointer">hcap.mouse.clickPointer()</a>
9450          *
9451          * @example
9452          * hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition({
9453          *      "x" : 200,
9454          *      "y" : 100,
9455          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9456          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9457          *      }, 
9458          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9459          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9460          *      }
9461          * });
9462          */
9463         hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition = function (param) {
9464             hcap_command("set_pointer_position", param);
9465         };
9466         /**
9467          * Clicks the pointer of pointing devices (MMR) in the current position.
9468          * 
9469          * @param {Object} param
9470          * <ul>
9471          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9472          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9473          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9474          *       // No Parameter.
9475          *   }</pre>
9476          *   </li>
9477          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9478          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9479          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9480          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9481          *   }</pre>
9482          *   </li>
9483          * </ul>
9484          *  
9485          * @since 1.20.0
9486          * 
9487          * @see
9488          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.isPointerOn">hcap.mouse.isPointerOn()</a>
9489          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerOn">hcap.mouse.setPointerOn()</a>
9490          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.getPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition()</a>
9491          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition()</a>
9492          *
9493          * @example
9494          * hcap.mouse.clickPointer({
9495          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9496          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9497          *      }, 
9498          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9499          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9500          *      }
9501          * });
9502          */
9503         hcap.mouse.clickPointer = function (param) {
9504             hcap_command("click_pointer", param);
9505         };
9506         /**
9507          * Sets the pointer size of pointing devices (MMR).
9508          * 
9509          * @param {Object} param
9510          * <ul>
9511          *   <li>{Number} param.size [Required] - 1 for small size, 2 for middle size and 3 for large size.</li>
9512          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9513          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9514          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9515          *       // No Parameter.
9516          *   }</pre>
9517          *   </li>
9518          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9519          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9520          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9521          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9522          *   }</pre>
9523          *   </li>
9524          * </ul>
9525          *  
9526          * @since 1.19.0
9527          * 
9528          * @example
9529          * hcap.mouse.setPointerSize({
9530          *     "size" : 2,
9531          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9532          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9533          *      }, 
9534          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9535          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9536          *      }
9537          * });
9538          */
9539         hcap.mouse.setPointerSize = function (param) {
9540             hcap_command("set_pointer_size", param);
9541         };
9542         /**
9543          * @namespace hcap.property
9544          */
9545         hcap.property = {};
9546         /**
9547          * Gets the current hotel mode settings.
9548          * 
9549          * @param {Object} param
9550          * <ul>
9551          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9552          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9553          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
9554          *       // {String} param.hotelMode - current hotel mode settings in JSON type.
9555          *       // '{
9556          *       //     "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable LG Hotel Mode operation or not. Default is "off" or not.
9557          *       //                        // If "enable" is "on",
9558          *       //                        // 1) Menu - General - "Reset to Initial Settings" and "Home/Store Mode" 
9559          *       //                        //    cannot be changed.
9560          *       //                        // 2) Scheduled recording is disabled. Guide menu - "Information", 
9561          *       //                        //    "Manual Timer" and "Play Key" are disappeared and are not worked. 
9562          *       //                        //    DVR-related progress bar, REC key and Play key are not worked.
9563          *       //                        // 3) External devices connected to TV (ex. Simplink) are worked according 
9564          *       //                        //    to the settings of "Hotel Mode Operation" - "Aux Source Settings" and
9565          *       //                        //    "Input Source Change".
9566          *       //                        // 4) Web browser is started in privacy mode. (Web history is not stored)
9567          *       //                        // 5) The functionality of LG Connect Apps is terminated.
9568          *       //                        // 6) Voice Recognition (Speak to TV) and Motion Gesture are not worked.
9569          *       //                        // 7) ECO (Energy Saving), 15 Min Auto Off and 2 Hour Off (On Timer) are 
9570          *       //                        //    deactivated.
9571          *       //                        // 8) When Hote Mode is On in DC On, the settings of ECO, 15 Min Auto Off 
9572          *       //                        //    and 2 Hour Off (On Timer) are restored. Then if Hotel Mode is Off 
9573          *       //                        //    after DC Off and DC On, previous settings are removed and default 
9574          *       //                        //    values are restored.
9575          *       //                        // 9) User Guide key is not worked.  
9576          *       //         "on" // enable hotel mode.
9577          *       //         "off" // disable hotel mode.
9578          *       //     "settings":{Object} { // Setting values to be applied when "enable" is "on".
9579          *       //         "powerOnStatus":{String}, // Determine the TV status when main power (AC) is on. Default is 
9580          *       //                                   // "std".
9581          *       //             "pwr" // make TV power-on status when AC is on. To make sure TV is able to be turned on, 
9582          *       //                   // if both "irOperation" and "localKeyOperation" are "blockAll", 
9583          *       //                   // settings.powerOnStatus will be changed to "pwr" automatically. 
9584          *       //             "std" // make TV stand-by status when AC is on. If "enable" is changed to "on",
9585          *       //                   // settings.powerOnStatus will be changed to "std" automatically.
9586          *       //             "lst" // make TV last power status when AC is on. AC is off in power-on status, AC is on, 
9587          *       //                   // and then TV will go back to power-on status. AC is off in stand-by status, AC 
9588          *       //                   // is on, and then TV will be in stand-by status.
9589          *       //         "volume":{Object}, { // Volume settings.
9590          *       //             "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable volume settings such as "Start Volume", 
9591          *       //                                // "Maximum Volume" and "Minimum Volume" or not. Default is "off".
9592          *       //                 "on" // enable volume settings.
9593          *       //                 "off" // disable volume settings.
9594          *       //             "settings":{Object}, { // Setting values to be applied when settings.volume.enable is "on".
9595          *       //                 "startVolume":{Object}, { // Start volume when TV is turned on.
9596          *       //                     "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable start volume or not. Default is "off".
9597          *       //                         "on" // enable start volume.
9598          *       //                         "off" // disable start volume.
9599          *       //                     "level":{Number} // start volume level (0 <= Min <= Start <= Max <= 100). 
9600          *       //                                      // Default is 0. This is worked when 
9601          *       //                                      // settings.volume.settings.startVolume.enable is "on". If "level"
9602          *       //                                      // is smaller than "minimumVolume", "minimumVolume" will be the 
9603          *       //                                      // start volume level. If "level" is bigger than "maximumVolume", 
9604          *       //                                      // "maximumVolume" will be the start volume level. 
9605          *       //                                      // 'On Timer'-related volume level is fixed with "level" when 
9606          *       //                                      // 'Public Display Mode'/'Hotel Mode Operation' are enabled.
9607          *       //                 }
9608          *       //                 "minimumVolume":{Number}, // Minimum volume level (0 <= Min <= Start <= Max <= 100). 
9609          *       //                                           // Default is 0. Setting a volume level smaller than 
9610          *       //                                           // "minimumVolume" will be ignored. If "minimumVolume" is 
9611          *       //                                           // set to bigger than the current volume level in the mute 
9612          *       //                                           // state, mute will be disabled.
9613          *       //                 "maximumVolume":{Number} // Maximum volume level (0 <= Min <= Start <= Max <= 100). 
9614          *       //                                          // Default is 100. Setting a volume level bigger than 
9615          *       //                                          // "maximumVolume" will be ignored. If "maximumVolume" is 
9616          *       //                                          // set to smaller than the current volume level in the mute 
9617          *       //                                          // state, mute will be disabled.
9618          *       //             }
9619          *       //         }
9620          *       //         "keyManagement":{Object}, { // Settings for the management of Local/Front key and Remote 
9621          *       //                                     // Control key.
9622          *       //             "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable IR Operation and Local Key Operation, or not. 
9623          *       //                                // Default is "off".
9624          *       //                 "on" // enable the key management.
9625          *       //                 "off" // disable the key management.
9626          *       //             "settings":{Object} { // Setting values to be applied when settings.keyManagement.enable
9627          *       //                                   // is "on".
9628          *       //                 "irOperation":{String}, // IR (Remote Control) key management. Default is "normal".
9629          *       //                     "normal" // block no IR key.
9630          *       //                     "usePwrOnly" // block all IR keys except the power key and service mode keys 
9631          *       //                                  // (In-Start, In-Stop, Power-Only, ADJ, Hotel-Mode, Hotel-Mode-Ready,
9632          *       //                                  // p-Check, S-Check, In-Time, FMode-Init, FMode-Start, FMode-AV, 
9633          *       //                                  // FMode-F1). And IR key combinations to enter Installation Menu and 
9634          *       //                                  // Special Menu (In-Start, EZ-Adjust, etc) are possible in 
9635          *       //                                  // "usePwrOnly" status. 
9636          *       //                     "blockAll" // block all IR keys except service mode keys (In-Start, In-Stop, 
9637          *       //                                // Power-Only, ADJ, Hotel-Mode, Hotel-Mode-Ready, p-Check, S-Check, 
9638          *       //                                // In-Time, FMode-Init, FMode-Start, FMode-AV, FMode-F1). And IR key 
9639          *       //                                // combinations to enter Installation Menu and Special Menu (In-Start,
9640          *       //                                // EZ-Adjust, etc) are possible in "blockAll" status.
9641          *       //                 "localKeyOperation":{String} // Local/Front key management. Default is "normal".
9642          *       //                     "normal" // block no Local/Front key.
9643          *       //                     "usePwrOnly" // block all Local/Front keys except the power key. Long press (3 secs)
9644          *       //                                  // of the Local/Front cross key is worked as the power key.
9645          *       //                     "blockAll" // block all Local/Front keys.
9646          *       //             }
9647          *       //         }
9648          *       //         "limitedMode":{Object}, { // Settings to limit TV functionalities.
9649          *       //             "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable settings.limitedMode.settings items or not. Default
9650          *       //                                // is "off". If settings.limitedMode.enable is "on", Screen Remote App 
9651          *       //                                // (123/Input key in MRCU) is not worked.
9652          *       //                 "on" // enable "limitedMode"
9653          *       //                 "off" // disable "limitedMode"
9654          *       //             "settings":{Object} { // Setting values to be applied when settings.limitedMode.enable is
9655          *       //                                   // "on".
9656          *       //                 "setupMenu":{String}, // Whether to permit to enter Setup (Channel) Menu or not.
9657          *       //                                       // Default is "on".
9658          *       //                     "on" // permit to enter Setup Menu.
9659          *       //                     "off" // prohibit from entering Setup Menu. Auto Tuning is not displayed in the
9660          *       //                           // channel change when the channel map is empty.
9661          *       //                 "programmeChange":{String}, // Whether to permit to change the channel or not. Default
9662          *       //                                             // is "on".
9663          *       //                     "on" // permit to change the channel and enter the channel menu.
9664          *       //                     "off" // prohibit from changing the channel. Channel-related keys (channel up/down, 
9665          *       //                           // number, guide, etc) channel menus (Setup Menu, etc) are disabled.
9666          *       //                           // Setting values in the menu 'On Time'-'Programme' are fixed.  
9667          *       //                 "menuDisplay":{String}, // Whether to permit to enter the menu or not. Default is "on".
9668          *       //                     "on" // permit to enter the menu.
