9669          *       //                     "off" // prohibit from entering the menu. But it is possible to enter Installation
9670          *       //                           // Menu with press-and-hold of Menu key longer than 5 seconds. It is not
9671          *       //                           // permitted MRCU (Magic Remote Control Unit) via Bluetooth to control TV.
9672          *       //                 "osdDisplay":{String}, // Whether to display OSDs or not. Default is "on".
9673          *       //                     "on" // display OSDs.
9674          *       //                     "off" // All OSDs except Installation Menu, In Start Menu, Adjust and Power Only OSD
9675          *       //                           // are not displayed. Although Volume OSD is not displayed in "osdDisplay"
9676          *       //                           // "off", Volume OSD can be displayed with the property "volume_ui"-"1" by HCAP.
9677          *       //                           // MRCU cannot control TV. OSD is not displayed and settings cannot be changed
9678          *       //                           // for Ratio and Energysaving Hotkey.
9679          *       //                 "systemProviderMode":{String} // Whether to enable System Provider Mode or not. Default
9680          *       //                                               // is "off".
9681          *       //                     "on" // enable System Provider Mode in which Sound (Smart Sound Mode, Sound Mode, 
9682          *       //                          // Sound Effect, Volume Mode, Sound Out, DTV Audio Setting, AV Sync Adjustment,
9683          *       //                          // Sound Optimizer, Sound Test), Picture (Smart Picture Mode, Picture Mode 
9684          *       //                          // Settings, Energy Saving, Picture Test, 3D Picture Test, HDMI Ultra HD Deep 
9685          *       //                          // Color), Accessibility (Pointer Options, Video Description, Audio Description, 
9686          *       //                          // Audio Description Volume, Audio Guidance, Enlarge Focused Image, Hard of 
9687          *       //                          // Hearing, Teletext), General (Language, Location, Time & Date, Timers/Auto
9688          *       //                          // Power Off, Alarm/Timer Power On/Off, Standby Light, Home/Store Mode, Set ID,
9689          *       //                          // SIMPLINK, Reset to Initial Settings), Programmes (Programme Tuning,
9690          *       //                          // Programme Manager, Copy Programmes, Channel Plus, My Channels) are blocked.
9691          *       //                     "off" // disable System Provider Mode.
9692          *       //             }
9693          *       //         }
9694          *       //         "dtvProgrammeUpdate":{String}, { // Whether to update DTV channels automatically or not. Default
9695          *       //                                          // is "manual".
9696          *       //             "auto" // update the channel map according to the DTV channel stream.
9697          *       //             "manual" // maintain the channel map even though DTV channel information in the channel 
9698          *       //                      // stream is changed.
9699          *       //         }
9700          *       //         "powerOnDefault":{Object}, { // Settings for power-on. 
9701          *       //             "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable settings for the input, programme and AV settings 
9702          *       //                                // when TV is turned on (DC On) from AC On or stand-by, or not. Default
9703          *       //                                // is "off". If HCAP start channel is set, settings.powerOnDefault.enable
9704          *       //                                // will be "off" automatically, and then even though
9705          *       //                                // settings.powerOnDefault.enable is set to "on" again, HCAP start
9706          *       //                                // channel has higher priority than "powerOnDefault" settings.
9707          *       //                 "on" // enable power-on settings.
9708          *       //                 "off" // disable power-on settings.
9709          *       //             "settings":{Object} { // Setting values to be applied when settings.powerOnDefault.enable
9710          *       //                                   // is "on".
9711          *       //                 "input":{String}, // Change to the specified input source in the power-on. Default
9712          *       //                                   // is "off".
9713          *       //                     "off" // "input" is disabled.
9714          *       //                     "dtv" // Digital TV
9715          *       //                     "atv" // Analog TV
9716          *       //                     "catv" // Cable TV
9717          *       //                     "cadtv" // Cable DTV
9718          *       //                     "ca-radio" // Cable Radio
9719          *       //                     "sdtv" // Satellite DTV
9720          *       //                     "s-radio" // Satellite Radio
9721          *       //                     "scart" // SCART
9722          *       //                     "av1" // AV 1
9723          *       //                     "av2" // AV 2
9724          *       //                     "av3" // AV 3
9725          *       //                     "rgb" // RGB
9726          *       //                     "comp1" // Component 1
9727          *       //                     "comp2" // Component 2
9728          *       //                     "comp3" // Component 3
9729          *       //                     "hdmi1" // HDMI 1
9730          *       //                     "hdmi2" // HDMI 2
9731          *       //                     "hdmi3" // HDMI 3
9732          *       //                     "hdmi4" // HDMI 4
9733          *       //                 "programme":{String}, // If the external input in the power-on is TV, specify the 
9734          *       //                                       // programme in the power-on.
9735          *       //                 "avSetting":{String}, // Audio/Video setting. Default is "off".
9736          *       //                     "on" // restore internal Audio/Video setting values. The internal setting 
9737          *       //                          // values are not exposed.
9738          *       //                     "off" // disable internal Audio/Video settings in the power-on.
9739          *       //                 "aspectRatio":{String} // Aspect Ratio setting. Default is "disable".
9740          *       //                     "disable" // The last aspect ratio setting.
9741          *       //                     "original" // Automatic aspect ratio.
9742          *       //                     "4:3" // 4:3 aspect ratio.
9743          *       //                     "16:9" // 16:9 aspect ratio.
9744          *       //             }
9745          *       //         }
9746          *       //         "auxSourceSetting":{Object}, { // Auxiliary source settings
9747          *       //             "enable":{String}, Whether to enable aux source settings or not. Default is "off".
9748          *       //                 "on" // enable aux source settings. Only selected aux sources are enabled.
9749          *       //                 "off" // disable aux source setting. All available aux sources are enabled.
9750          *       //             "settings":{Array} [ // Setting values to be applied when settings.auxSourceSetting.enable
9751          *       //                                  // is "on".
9752          *       //                 "av1" // AV 1
9753          *       //                 "av2" // AV 2
9754          *       //                 "av3" // AV 3
9755          *       //                 "rgb" // RGB
9756          *       //                 "comp1" // Component 1
9757          *       //                 "comp2" // Component 2
9758          *       //                 "comp3" // Component 3
9759          *       //                 "hdmi1" // HDMI 1
9760          *       //                 "hdmi2" // HDMI 2
9761          *       //                 "hdmi3" // HDMI 3
9762          *       //                 "hdmi4" // HDMI 4
9763          *       //             ]
9764          *       //         }
9765          *       //         "powerManagement":{String}, // TV is turned off if there is no key input from the local, 
9766          *       //                                     // front or remote for the designated time since the last key 
9767          *       //                                     // input. Default is "off".
9768          *       //             "off" // disable "powerManagement".
9769          *       //             "1hour" // TV is turned off after 1 hour.
9770          *       //             "2hours" // TV is turned off after 2 hours.
9771          *       //             "3hours" // TV is turned off after 3 hours.
9772          *       //             "4hours" // TV is turned off after 4 hours.
9773          *       //             "5hours" // TV is turned off after 5 hours.
9774          *       //             "6hours" // TV is turned off after 6 hours.
9775          *       //             "7hours" // TV is turned off after 7 hours.
9776          *       //         "radioVideoBlank":{Object} // Settings for the video of DVB analog radio channels.
9777          *       //             "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable settings for the mute of the radio programme video.
9778          *       //                                // Default is "off".
9779          *       //                 "on" // enable the radio video mute setting.
9780          *       //                 "off" // disable the radio video mute setting.
9781          *       //             "settings":{Object} { // Setting values to be applied when settings.radioVideoBlank.enable
9782          *       //                                   // is "on".
9783          *       //                 "startOfRadioProgramme":{Number}, // 1 ~ 199. Default is 1. Make the 
9784          *       //                                                   // "countOfRadioProgramme" radio videos blank from 
9785          *       //                                                   // the channel of "startOfProgramme".
9786          *       //                 "countOfRadioProgramme":{Number} // 0 ~ 10. Default is 1. "startOfRadioProgramme" + 
9787          *       //                                                  // "countOfRadioProgramme" <= Max of the programme 
9788          *       //                                                  // number + 1. 0 means that none of radio programmes
9789          *       //                                                  // will not be video-mute.
9790          *       //     }
9791          *       // }' 
9792          *   }</pre>
9793          *   </li>
9794          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
9795          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9796          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9797          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9798          *   }</pre>
9799          *   </li>
9800          * </ul>
9801          * 
9802          * @see
9803          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.setHotelMode">hcap.property.setHotelMode()</a><br>
9804          * 
9805          * @since 1.20.0
9806          * 
9807          * @example
9808          * hcap.property.getHotelMode({
9809          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
9810          *          console.log("onSuccess : hotel mode settings = " + s.hotelMode);
9811          *      }, 
9812          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9813          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9814          *      }
9815          * });
9816          */
9817         hcap.property.getHotelMode = function (param) {
9818             hcap_command("get_hotel_mode", param);
9819         };
9820         /**
9821          * Sets the hotel mode.<br>
9822          * If this is called while Installation Menu is being shown, Installation Menu will be destroyed automatically.<br>
9823          * Reboot is strongly recommended after this call is succeeded because some changes in hotel mode requires reboot to be applied.  
9824          * 
9825          * @param {Object} param
9826          * <ul>
9827          *   <li>{Number} param.hotelMode [Required] - hotel mode settings to set. Now that hotelMode must have all items in the success callback parameter hotelMode of <a href="hcap.property.html#.getHotelMode">hcap.property.getHotelMode()</a>, we're strongly recommend to change the setting values based on the result of <a href="hcap.property.html#.getHotelMode">hcap.property.getHotelMode()</a>. If it misses some items, it'll be failed to set the hotel mode.</li>
9828          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9829          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9830          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9831          *       // No Parameter.
9832          *   }</pre>
9833          *   </li>
9834          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
9835          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9836          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9837          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9838          *   }</pre>
9839          *   </li>
9840          * </ul>
9841          * 
9842          * @see
9843          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getHotelMode">hcap.property.getHotelMode()</a><br>
9844          * 
9845          * @since 1.20.0
9846          * 
9847          * @example
9848          * hcap.property.setHotelMode({
9849          *      "hotelMode" : `{
9850          *          "enable":"on",
9851          *          "settings":{
9852          *              "powerOnStatus":"stand_by",
9853          *              "volume":{
9854          *                  "enable":"off",
9855          *                  "settings":{
9856          *                      "startVolume":{
9857          *                          "enable":"off",
9858          *                          "level":0
9859          *                      },
9860          *                      "minimumVolume":0,
9861          *                      "maximumVolume":100
9862          *                  }
9863          *              },
9864          *              "keyManagement":{
9865          *                  "enable":"off",
9866          *                  "settings":{
9867          *                      "irOperation":"normal",
9868          *                      "localKeyOperation":"normal"
9869          *                  }
9870          *              },
9871          *              "limitedMode":{
9872          *                  "enable":"off",
9873          *                  "settings":{
9874          *                      "setupMenu":"on",
9875          *                      "programmeChange":"on",
9876          *                      "menuDisplay":"on",
9877          *                      "osdDisplay":"on",
9878          *                      "systemProviderMode":"off"
9879          *                  }
9880          *              },
9881          *              "dtvProgrammeUpdate":"Manual",
9882          *              "powerOnDefault":{
9883          *                  "enable":"off",
9884          *                  "settings":{
9885          *                      "input":"off",
9886          *                      "programme":"2",
9887          *                      "avSetting":"off",
9888          *                      "aspectRatio":"disable"
9889          *                  }
9890          *              },
9891          *              "auxSourceSetting":{
9892          *                  "enable":"off",
9893          *                  "settings":[{"av1":"off"},{"av2":"off"},{"av3":"off"},{"rgb":"off"},{"comp1":"off"},{"comp2":"off"},{"comp3":"off"},{"hdmi1":"off"},{"hdmi2":"off"},{"hdmi3":"off"},{"hdmi4":"off"}]},
9894          *              "powerManagement":"off",
9895          *              "radioVideoBlank":{
9896          *                  "enable":"off",
9897          *                  "settings":{
9898          *                      "startOfRadioProgramme":1,
9899          *                      "countOfRadioProgramme":1
9900          *                  }
9901          *              }
9902          *          }
9903          *      }`,
9904          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9905          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9906          *      }, 
9907          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9908          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9909          *      }
9910          * });
9911          */
9912         hcap.property.setHotelMode = function (param) {
9913             hcap_command("set_hotel_mode", param);
9914         };
9915         /** 
9916          * @namespace hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey
9917          */
9918         hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey = {
9919             /**
9920              * Backlight (0 ~ 100)
9921              * @since 1.6.0
9922              * @constant
9923              */
9924             BACKLIGHT : 1,
9925             /**
9926              * Contrast (0 ~ 100)
9927              * @since 1.6.0
9928              * @constant
9929              */
9930             CONTRAST : 2,
9931             /**
9932              * Brightness (0 ~ 100)
9933              * @since 1.6.0
9934              * @constant
9935              */
9936             BRIGHTNESS : 3,
9937             /**
9938              * Sharpness (0 ~ 100)
9939              * @since 1.6.0
9940              * @constant
9941              */
9942             SHARPNESS : 4,
9943             /**
9944              * Color (0 ~ 100), 0 : Black
9945              * @since 1.6.0
9946              * @constant
9947              */
9948             COLOR : 5,
9949             /**
9950              * Tint (0 ~ 100), 0 : Red, 100 : Green
9951              * @since 1.6.0
9952              * @constant
9953              */
9954             TINT : 6,
9955             /**
9956              * Color Temperature (0 ~ 100), 0 : Warm, 100 : Cold
9957              * @since 1.6.0
9958              * @constant
9959              */
9960             COLOR_TEMPERATURE : 7,
9961             /**
9962              * Aspect Ratio. Supported values depend on TV model.<br>
9963              * <ul>
9964              *   <li>1 : Normal Screen (4:3), Resizes images to the previous standard 4:3.</li>
9965              *   <li>2 : Wide (16:9), Resizes images to fit the screen width.</li>
9966              *   <li>3 : Horizon (Spectacle), Full Wide,  When TV receives the wide screen signal, it will let you adjust the picture horizontally or vertically, in a linear proportion, to fill the entire screen fully. 4:3 and 14:9 video are supported in full screen without any video distortion through DTV input. In Analog/DTV/AV/Scart mode, Full Wide is available.</li>
9967              *   <li>4 : Zoom, Resizes the image to fit the screen width. The top and bottom parts of the image may be cut off.</li>
9968              *   <li>6 : Original, Auto (Set by program), When your TV receives a wide screen signal, it will automatically change to the broadcasted picture format.</li>
9969              *   <li>7 : 14:9, You can see the picture format of 14:9 or the general TV program in the 14:9 mode. The 14:9 screen is displayed in the same way as in 4:3, but is moved up or down.</li>
9970              *   <li>10 : Cinema Zoom1, Choose Cinema Zoom when you want to enlarge the picture incorrect proportion.</li>
9971              * </ul>
9972              * 
9973              * @since 1.6.0
9974              * @constant
9975              */
9976             ASPECT_RATIO : 8,
9977 			/**
9978              * Just scan (0 ~ 2), 0 : Off, 1 : On, 2 : Auto. <br>
9979              * <ul>
9980              *    <li>Displays video images in the original size without removing parts of the edge of the image.</li>
9981              * </ul>
9982              * @since 1.24.10
9983              * @constant
9984              */
9985             JUST_SCAN : 9
9986         };
9987         /**
9988          * Gets the picture property value for the current media input source.
9989          * 
9990          * @param {Object} param
9991          * <ul>
9992          *   <li>{Number} param.key [Required] - picture property key type. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey</a>.</li>
9993          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9994          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9995          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
9996          *       // {Number} param.value - picture property value of the requested property key. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey</a>.
9997          *   }</pre>
9998          *   </li>
9999          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10000          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10001          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10002          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10003          *   }</pre>
10004          *   </li>
10005          * </ul>
10006          * 
10007          * @see
10008          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.BACKLIGHT">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.BACKLIGHT</a><br>
10009          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.CONTRAST">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.CONTRAST</a><br>
10010          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.BRIGHTNESS">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.BRIGHTNESS</a><br>
10011          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.SHARPNESS">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.SHARPNESS</a><br>
10012          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.COLOR">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR</a><br>
10013          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.TINT">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.TINT</a><br>
10014          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.COLOR_TEMPERATURE">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR_TEMPERATURE</a><br>
10015          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.ASPECT_RATIO">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.ASPECT_RATIO</a><br>
10016 		 * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.JUST_SCAN">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.JUST_SCAN</a><br>
10017          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.setPictureProperty">hcap.property.setPictureProperty()</a><br>
10018          * 
10019          * @since 1.6.0
10020          * 
10021          * @example
10022          * hcap.property.getPictureProperty({
10023          *      "key" : hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR_TEMPERATURE,
10024          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
10025          *          console.log("onSuccess : property value = " + s.value);
10026          *      }, 
10027          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10028          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10029          *      }
10030          * });
10031          */
10032         hcap.property.getPictureProperty = function (param) {
10033             hcap_command("get_picture_property", param);
10034         };
10035         /**
10036          * Sets the picture property value for the current media input source.
10037          * 
10038          * @param {Object} param
10039          * <ul>
10040          *   <li>{Number} param.key [Required] - picture property key type. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey</a>.</li>
10041          *   <li>{Number} param.value [Required] - picture property value of the requested property key. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey</a>.</li>
10042          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
10043          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10044          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
10045          *       // No Parameter.
10046          *   }</pre>
10047          *   </li>
10048          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10049          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10050          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10051          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10052          *   }</pre>
10053          *   </li>
10054          * </ul>
10055          * 
10056          * @see
10057          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.BACKLIGHT">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.BACKLIGHT</a><br>
10058          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.CONTRAST">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.CONTRAST</a><br>
10059          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.BRIGHTNESS">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.BRIGHTNESS</a><br>
10060          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.SHARPNESS">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.SHARPNESS</a><br>
10061          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.COLOR">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR</a><br>
10062          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.TINT">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.TINT</a><br>
10063          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.COLOR_TEMPERATURE">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR_TEMPERATURE</a><br>
10064          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.ASPECT_RATIO">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.ASPECT_RATIO</a><br>
10065 		 * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.JUST_SCAN">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.JUST_SCAN</a><br>
10066          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getPictureProperty">hcap.property.getPictureProperty()</a><br>
10067          * 
10068          * @since 1.6.0
10069          * 
10070          * @example
10071          * hcap.property.setPictureProperty({
10072          *      "key" : hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR_TEMPERATURE,
10073          *      "value" : 10,
10074          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
10075          *          console.log("onSuccess");
10076          *      }, 
10077          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10078          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10079          *      }
10080          * });
10081          */
10082         hcap.property.setPictureProperty = function (param) {
10083             hcap_command("set_picture_property", param);
10084         };
10085         /**
10086          * @namespace hcap.property.PictureMode
10087          */
10088         hcap.property.PictureMode = {
10089             /**
10090              * Picture Mode : Vivid
10091              * @since 1.20.0
10092              * @constant
10093              */
10094             VIVID : 1,
10095             /**
10096              * Picture Mode : Standard
10097              * @since 1.20.0
10098              * @constant
10099              */
10100             STANDARD : 2,
10101             /**
10102              * Picture Mode : Eco
10103              * @since 1.20.0
10104              * @constant
10105              */
10106             ECO : 3,
10107             /**
10108              * Picture Mode : Cinema
10109              * @since 1.20.0
10110              * @constant
10111              */
10112             CINEMA : 4,
10113             /**
10114              * Picture Mode : Sports
10115              * @since 1.20.0
10116              * @constant
10117              */
10118             SPORTS : 5,
10119             /**
10120              * Picture Mode : Game
10121              * @since 1.20.0
10122              * @constant
10123              */
10124             GAME : 6,
10125             /**
10126              * Picture Mode : Photo
10127              * @since 1.20.0
10128              * @constant
10129              */
10130             PHOTO : 7,
10131             /**
10132              * Picture Mode : Expert (Bright Room)
10133              * @since 1.20.0
10134              * @constant
10135              */
10136             EXPERT_BRIGHT_ROOM : 8,
10137             /**
10138              * Picture Mode : Expert (Dark Room)
10139              * @since 1.20.0
10140              * @constant
10141              */
10142             EXPERT_DARK_ROOM : 9
10143         };
10144         /**
10145          * Gets the current picture mode.
10146          * 
10147          * @param {Object} param
10148          * <ul>
10149          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
10150          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10151          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
10152          *       // {Number} param.mode - picture mode. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html">hcap.property.PictureMode</a>.
10153          *       // {Boolean} param.isUser - false when all picture property values are default in the picture mode, otherwise true.
10154          *   }</pre>
10155          *   </li>
10156          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10157          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10158          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10159          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10160          *   }</pre>
10161          *   </li>
10162          * </ul>
10163          * 
10164          * @see
10165          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.VIVID">hcap.property.PictureMode.VIVID</a><br>
10166          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.STANDARD">hcap.property.PictureMode.STANDARD</a><br>
10167          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.ECO">hcap.property.PictureMode.ECO</a><br>
10168          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.CINEMA">hcap.property.PictureMode.CINEMA</a><br>
10169          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.SPORTS">hcap.property.PictureMode.SPORTS</a><br>
10170          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.GAME">hcap.property.PictureMode.GAME</a><br>
10171          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.PHOTO">hcap.property.PictureMode.PHOTO</a><br>
10172          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.EXPERT_BRIGHT_ROOM">hcap.property.PictureMode.EXPERT_BRIGHT_ROOM</a><br>
10173          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.EXPERT_DARK_ROOM">hcap.property.PictureMode.EXPERT_DARK_ROOM</a><br>
10174          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.setPictureMode">hcap.property.setPictureMode()</a><br>
10175          * 
10176          * @since 1.20.0
10177          * 
10178          * @example
10179          * hcap.property.getPictureMode({
10180          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
10181          *          console.log("onSuccess : picture mode = " + s.mode + ", is user = " + s.isUser);
10182          *      }, 
10183          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10184          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10185          *      }
10186          * });
10187          */
10188         hcap.property.getPictureMode = function (param) {
10189             hcap_command("get_picture_mode", param);
10190         };
10191         /**
10192          * Sets the picture mode.
10193          * 
10194          * @param {Object} param
10195          * <ul>
10196          *   <li>{Number} param.mode [Required] - picture mode. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html">hcap.property.PictureMode</a>.</li>
10197          *   <li>{Boolean} param.reset [Required] - true to reset all picture property values to default in the picture mode, otherwise false.</li>
10198          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
10199          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10200          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
10201          *       // No Parameter.
10202          *   }</pre>
10203          *   </li>
10204          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10205          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10206          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10207          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10208          *   }</pre>
10209          *   </li>
10210          * </ul>
10211          * 
10212          * @see
10213          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.VIVID">hcap.property.PictureMode.VIVID</a><br>
10214          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.STANDARD">hcap.property.PictureMode.STANDARD</a><br>
10215          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.ECO">hcap.property.PictureMode.ECO</a><br>
10216          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.CINEMA">hcap.property.PictureMode.CINEMA</a><br>
10217          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.SPORTS">hcap.property.PictureMode.SPORTS</a><br>
10218          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.GAME">hcap.property.PictureMode.GAME</a><br>
10219          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.PHOTO">hcap.property.PictureMode.PHOTO</a><br>
10220          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.EXPERT_BRIGHT_ROOM">hcap.property.PictureMode.EXPERT_BRIGHT_ROOM</a><br>
10221          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.EXPERT_DARK_ROOM">hcap.property.PictureMode.EXPERT_DARK_ROOM</a><br>
10222          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getPictureMode">hcap.property.getPictureMode()</a><br>
10223          * 
10224          * @since 1.20.0
10225          * 
10226          * @example
10227          * hcap.property.setPictureMode({
10228          *      "mode" : hcap.property.PictureMode.VIVID,
10229          *      "reset" : true,
10230          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
10231          *          console.log("onSuccess");
10232          *      }, 
10233          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10234          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10235          *      }
10236          * });
10237          */
10238         hcap.property.setPictureMode = function (param) {
10239             hcap_command("set_picture_mode", param);
10240         };
10241         /**
10242          * Gets the value of platform property. The property can be the TV specification values or user setting values. 
10243          *  
10244          * @param {Object} param
10245          * <ul>
10246          *   <li>{String} param.key [Required] - property key string.<br>
10247          *   <div>
10248          *     <table class="hcap_spec">
10249          *       <thead>
10250          *         <tr>
10251          *           <th>Key</th>
10252          *           <th>Description</th>
10253          *           <th>Read/Write</th>
10254          *           <th>Value Format</th>
10255          *           <th>Value example (default value for the predefined value set)</th>
10256          *         </tr>
10257          *       </thead>
10258          *       <tbody>
10259          *         <tr class="odd">
10260          *           <td>hcap_js_extension_version</td>
10261          *           <td class="left">Hcap js extension version of middleware</td>
10262          *           <td>Read</td>
10263          *           <td class="left">[version string]<br>free format string</td>
10264          *           <td>1.2.4.5</td>
10265          *         </tr>
10266          *         <tr>
10267          *           <td>hcap_middleware_version</td>
10268          *           <td class="left">Version of middleware</td>
10269          *           <td>Read</td>
10270          *           <td class="left">[version string]<br>free format string</td>
10271          *           <td>1.2.4.5.4417</td>
10272          *         </tr>
10273          *         <tr class="odd">
10274          *           <td>model_name</td>
10275          *           <td class="left">Product model name<br>(IN START:Model Name)</td>
10276          *           <td>Read</td>
10277          *           <td class="left">[model name] <br>free format string</td>
10278          *           <td>GLOBAL-PLAT2</td>
10279          *         </tr>
10280          *         <tr>
10281          *           <td>platform_version</td>
10282          *           <td class="left">Platform management version<br>(IN START:S/W Version)</td>
10283          *           <td>Read</td>
10284          *           <td class="left">[version string] <br>free format string</td>
10285          *           <td>03.00.06.01</td>
10286          *         </tr>
10287          *         <tr class="odd">
10288          *           <td>micom_version</td>
10289          *           <td class="left">Platform micom management version<br>(IN START:MICOM Version)</td>
10290          *           <td>Read</td>
10291          *           <td class="left">[version string] <br>free format string</td>

10293          *         </tr>

10305          *           <td class="left">[version string] <br>free format string</td>
10306          *           <td>APP History Ver.: 3018</td>
10307          *         </tr>

10311          *           <td>Read</td>
10312          *           <td class="left">[version string] <br>free format string</td>
10313          *           <td>1.1.8</td>
10314          *         </tr>
10315          *         <tr class="odd">
10316          *           <td>serial_number</td>
10317          *           <td class="left">Product serial number<br>(IN START:Serial Number)</td>
10318          *           <td>Read</td>
10319          *           <td class="left">[serial number] <br>free format string</td>
10320          *           <td>SKJY1107</td>
10321          *         </tr>

10324          *           <td class="left">Graphics display resolution. Only 1280x720 and 1920x1080 are supported (since HCAP HTML 1.20.0). Just after changing the resolution, reboot is needed.</td>

10327          *           <td>1280x720</td>

10341          *           <td>1</td>

10498          *           <td>Read</td>
10499          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : application will not be updated<br>1 : application will be updated</td>
10500          *           <td>0</td>

10523          *         <tr>

10526          *           </td>

10529          *           <td>10485760</td>
10530          *         </tr>  
10531          *         <tr class="odd">
10532          *           <td>max_content_cache_size</td>
10533          *           <td class="left">specifies the max cache storage size in byte for carousel content.
10534          *           </td>
10535          *           <td>Read</td>
10536          *           <td class="left">[max content cache storage size] Byte(s)</td>
10537          *           <td>10485760</td>
10538          *         </tr>  
10539          *         <tr>
10540          *           <td>osd_layer_id</td>
10541          *           <td class="left">ID of HCAP OSD layer</td>
10542          *           <td>Read</td>
10543          *           <td class="left">[number string]</td>
10544          *           <td>4</td>
10545          *         </tr>
10546          *         <tr class="odd">
10547          *           <td>key_delivery_to_simplink</td>
10548          *           <td class="left">determine whether key input is delivered to Simplink or key input is processed accroding to HCAP key attribute. This property is effective only when Simplink device is connected to TV.
10549          *           </td>
10550          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10551          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : key input is processed according to HCAP key attribute.<br>1 : key input is delivered to Simplink. Therefore HCAP application gets no key input.</td>
10552          *           <td>0</td>
10553          *         </tr>  
10554          *         <tr>
10555          *           <td>room_number</td>
10556          *           <td class="left">[since 1.5.0] room number which TV is located in. When room number is changed, property 'tv_name' will be changed to the same value as 'room_number'.</td>
10557          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10558          *           <td class="left">[string] free format string. Max length is 21. (Factory initial value is '[TV]serial_number'.)</td>
10559          *           <td>[TV]204</td>
10560          *         </tr>
10561          *         <tr class="odd">
10562          *           <td>instant_power</td>
10563          *           <td class="left">[since 1.6.0] specify the mode of instant power on.</td>
10564          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10565          *           <td class="left">[0|10|1|2] <br>0 : disable TV instant power on.
10566          *                                    <br>    At power off by <a href="hcap.power.html#.powerOff">hcap.power.powerOff()</a> and power key in RCU[Remote Control Unit] : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY.
10567          *                                    <br>    At power on by power key in RCU : STANDBY -> NORMAL.
10568          *                                    <br>    At reboot by <a href="hcap.power.html#.reboot">hcap.power.reboot()</a> : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> NORMAL.
10569          *                                    <br>    Power mode change NORMAL->WARM(WAIT) by <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a> is not supported.
10570          *                                    <br>    Power mode change WARM(WAIT)->NORMAL by <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a> is supported.
10571          *                                    <br>[since 1.19.0] 10 : keep TV turned on while AC power is applied.
10572          *                                    <br>    At power off by <a href="hcap.power.html#.powerOff">hcap.power.powerOff()</a> : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> NORMAL.
10573          *                                    <br>    At power off by power key in RCU : No effect.
10574          *                                    <br>    At power on by power key in RCU : No effect.
10575          *                                    <br>    [since 1.18.4] At reboot by <a href="hcap.power.html#.reboot">hcap.power.reboot()</a> : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> NORMAL.
10576          *                                    <br>    Power mode change NORMAL<->WARM(WAIT) by <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a> is not supported.
10577          *                                    <br>1 : enable TV instant power on.
10578          *                                    <br>    At power off by <a href="hcap.power.html#.powerOff">hcap.power.powerOff()</a> and power key in RCU : [NORMAL|WARM(WAIT)] -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> WARM(WAIT).
10579          *                                    <br>    At power on by power key in RCU : WARM(WAIT) -> NORMAL.
10580          *                                    <br>    [since 1.18.4] At reboot by <a href="hcap.power.html#.reboot">hcap.power.reboot()</a> : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> NORMAL. WARM(WAIT) -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> WARM(WAIT).
10581          *                                    <br>    Power mode change NORMAL<->WARM(WAIT) by <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a> is supported.
10582          *                                    <br>[since 1.9.0] 2 : enable TV instant power on.
10583          *                                    <br>    At power off by <a href="hcap.power.html#.powerOff">hcap.power.powerOff()</a> : [NORMAL|WARM(WAIT)] -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> WARM(WAIT).
10584          *                                    <br>    At power off by power key in RCU : NORMAL -> WARM(WAIT).
10585          *                                    <br>    At power on by power key in RCU : WARM(WAIT) -> NORMAL.
10586          *                                    <br>    [since 1.18.4] At reboot by <a href="hcap.power.html#.reboot">hcap.power.reboot()</a> : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> NORMAL. WARM(WAIT) -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> WARM(WAIT).
10587          *                                    <br>    Power mode change NORMAL<->WARM(WAIT) by <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a> is supported.
10588          *           </td>
10589          *           <td>0</td>
10590          *         </tr>
10591          *         <tr>
10592          *           <td>wol_w</td>
10593          *           <td class="left">[since 1.5.1] specifies TV power status when turning TV on from standby state by Wakeup Frame. Whether to support "wol_w" or not depends on TV models.</td>
10594          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10595          *           <td class="left">[normal|warm|off]</td>
10596          *           <td>off</td>

10678          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10679          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : when network error is occurred, notify network status change to the application and the browser has no action.<br>1 : when network error is occurred, the browser loads an error page for a while and tries to load the previous page. If the previous page can be loaded in off-line, the page will be loaded, or the browser will be destroyed. When pressing PORTAL key in the browser termination, TV tries to load initial page designated in xait.xml.</td>
10680          *           <td>1</td>

10720          *           <td>Read/Write</td>

"soft_ap" is reset to "0" in the power off sequence (NORMAL -> WARM -> OFF). Soft AP configuration is stored even for "soft_ap" "0", and when "soft_ap" is "1", soft AP and VLAN is initialized with the stored configuration.</td>
10727          *           <td>Read/Write</td>

10756          *              If "alternative_lg_service_xml" exists and it starts with "http://" or "https://", download the value of "alternative_lg_service_xml".<br>

10766          *              Otherwise, HCAP HTML application specified in "alternative_url" will be launched.</td>

10860          *           <td>0</td>
10861          *         </tr>
10862          *         <tr>
10863          *           <td>clock_source</td>
10864          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] set the clock source.</td>
10865          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10866          *           <td class="left">[off|pro:centric|tv|ntp|admin]<br>off : update the clock time for all clock sources.
10867          *                                                          <br>pro:centric : update the clock time only for the Pro:Centric data channel time.
10868          *                                                          <br>tv : update the clock time only for the TV channel time.
10869          *                                                          <br>ntp : update the clock time only for the NTP (Network Time Protocol) server time.
10870          *                                                          <br>admin : update the clock time only for the time requested by <a href="hcap.time.html#.setLocalTime">hcap.time.setLocalTime()</a>. If <a href="hcap.time.html#.setLocalTime">hcap.time.setLocalTime()</a> is called in the other clock source than "admin", "clock_source" will be changed to "admin" automatically.</td>
10871          *           <td>off : when Pro:Centric is OFF.<br>
10872          *               pro:centric : when Pro:Centric is enabled.</td>
10873          *         </tr>
10874          *         <tr class="odd">
10875          *           <td>xait_version</td>
10876          *           <td class="left">[since 1.20.0] xait version in the local xait.xml</td>
10877          *           <td>Read</td>
10878          *           <td class="left">[number string] <br>number format string</td>
10879          *           <td></td>
10880          *         </tr>
10881          *         <tr>
10882          *           <td>asl_mode</td>
10883          *           <td class="left">[since 1.20.1] Whether ASL(Application Side Loading) mode is supported, or not.</td>
10884          *           <td>Read</td>
10885          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : ASL mode is disabled.<br>1 : ASL mode is enabled.</td>
10886          *           <td>0</td>
10887          *         </tr>
10888          *         <tr class="odd">
10889          *           <td>screensaver_control</td>
10890          *           <td class="left">[since 1.20.1] Indicates who is in charge of handling the screensaver.</td>
10891          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10892          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : The Pro:Centric platform is in charge of starting and ending a screensaver.<br>1 : HCAP Application is in charge of starting and ending a screensaver. <a href="_global_.html#event:screensaver_event_received">screensaver_event_received()</a> is provided for implementing screensaver by HCAP Application.</td>
10893          *           <td>0</td>
10894          *         </tr>
10895          *         <tr>
10896          *           <td>rms_trusted_ip</td>
10897          *           <td class="left">[since 1.20.3] Set the ip address that can execute all commands of RMS(Remote Manager Service) include Security APIs</td>
10898          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10899          *           <td class="left">[string]<br>ip address</td>
10900          *           <td>10.186.122.21</td>
10901          *         </tr>
10902          *         <tr class="odd">
10903          *           <td>lg_service_xml_version</td>
10904          *           <td class="left">[since 1.21.0] lg service xml version in the local lgservice.xml</td>
10905          *           <td>Read</td>
10906          *           <td class="left">[number string] <br>number format string</td>
10907          *           <td></td>
10908          *         </tr>
10909          *         <tr>
10910          *           <td>input_splash_image</td>
10911          *           <td class="left">[since 1.23.0] determine whether to enable splash image or not.</td>
10912          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10913          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : disable splash image.<br>1 : enable splash image.</td>
10914          *           <td>1</td>
10915          *         </tr>
10916          *         <tr class="odd">
10917          *           <td>tv_zone / stb_zone</td>
10918          *           <td class="left">[since 1.20.8][UA Only] Set the tv_zone / stb_zone that used for cloning</td>
10919          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10920          *           <td class="left">[0-8] <br>number format string</td>
10921          *           <td>"1"</td>
10922          *         </tr>
10923          *         <tr>
10924          *           <td>wifi_zone</td>
10925          *           <td class="left">[since 1.20.8][UA Only] Set the wifi_zone that used for cloning</td>
10926          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10927          *           <td class="left">[0-99] <br>number format string</td>
10928          *           <td>"5"</td>
10929          *         </tr>
10930          *         <tr class="odd">
10931          *           <td>cec_device_control</td>
10932          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.0] Determine whether to control the automatic input switching for the CEC device. This feature requires Simplink (HDMI-CEC) to be turned on. </td>
10933          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10934          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0: Enable automatic input switching of the CEC device. (TV default Policy) <br>1: Disable automatic input switching of the CEC device. The CEC device input can be manually switched in the SI App.</td>
10935          *           <td>"0"</td>
10936          *         </tr>
10937          *         <tr>
10938          *           <td>automatic_update</td>
10939          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.2] determine whether to enable automatic software update.</td>
10940          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10941          *           <td class="left">[off|on|once]<br>off : disable automatic software updates.
10942          *                                         <br>on : enable automatic software updates.
10943          *                                         <br>once : Use automatic software updates once and change to "off".
10944          *           <td>"off"</td>
10945          *         </tr>
10946          *         <tr class="odd">
10947          *           <td>hdmi_out</td>
10948          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.8] Set HDMI-CEC(SimplinkOut) [Support STB Only]</td>
10949          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10950          *           <td class="left">[0|1|2]<br>0 : off 
10951          *           						 <br>1 : powersync
10952          *           						 <br>2 : configure </td>
10953          *           <td>"0"</td>
10954          *         </tr>
10955          *         <tr>
10956          *           <td>standby_light</td>
10957          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.8] determine whether to use standy light</td>
10958          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10959          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : off <br>1 : on</td>
10960          *           <td>"1"</td>
10961          *         </tr>
10962          *         <tr class="odd">
10963          *           <td>lgchannels</td>
10964          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.8] determine whether to enable LG Channels</td>
10965          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10966          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : disable LG Channels <br>1 : enable LG Channels</td>
10967          *           <td>"0"</td>
10968          *         </tr>
10969          *         <tr>
10970          *           <td>tv_bluetooth_central_ui</td>
10971          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.8] The TV Bluetooth message UI is not displayed on reboot after setting the value "0".</td>
10972          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10973          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : TV Bluetooth UI is disabled.<br>1 : TV Bluetooth UI is enabled.</td>
10974          *           <td>"1"</td>
10975          *         </tr> 
10976          *        <tr>
10977          *           <td>auto_ota_update</td>
10978          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.10] Determine to enable the automatic firmware update.</td>
10979          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10980          *           <td class="left">[0|1|2]<br>0 : Off (default)<br>1 : On<br>2 : Once</td>
10981          *           <td>"0"</td>
10982          *         </tr>
10983          *         <tr>
10984          *           <td>update_detect_noti</td>
10985          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.10] Determine to activate the show the update notification when detecting the new firmware update. </td>
10986          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10987          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : Off (default)<br>1 : On </td>
10988          *           <td>"0"</td>
10989          *         </tr>
10990          *         <tr>
10991          *           <td>fota_group</td>
10992          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.10] Set the group name to support separate firmware by the group for automatic firmware updates.</td>
10993          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
10994          *           <td class="left">[string]<br>group name</td>
10995          *           <td>"LGE"</td>
10996          *         </tr>
10997          *         <tr>
10998          *           <td>rcu_low_battery_toast</td>
10999          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.10] Determine whether to display the low-battery toast messages that occurred by Multi-IR RCU only once after power-on.</td>
11000          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
11001          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : Disable to display the low-battery toast messages.<br>1 : Enable to display the low-battery toast messages. (default)</td>
11002          *           <td>"1"</td>
11003          *         <tr>
11004          *           <td>customer_code</td>
11005          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.10] Identifier code for the SSAI(Server Side Ad Insertion) of LG Channels.</td>
11006          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
11007          *           <td class="left">[string]<br>customer code</td>
11008          *           <td>"00000000"</td>
11009          *         </tr>
11010          *         <tr>
11011          *           <td>si_name</td>
11012          *           <td class="left">[since 1.24.10] SI name for the SSAI(Server Side Ad Insertion) of LG Channels.</td>
11013          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
11014          *           <td class="left">[string]<br>si name</td>
11015          *           <td>"LGE"</td>
11016          *         </tr>
11017          *         </tr>     
11018          *       </tbody>
11019          *       <tfoot>
11020          *         <tr><th colspan="5">HCAP Property</td></tr>
11021          *       </tfoot>
11022          *     </table>
11023          *   </div>
11024          *   </li>
11025          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
11026          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
11027          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
11028          *       // {String} param.value - property value.
11029          *   }</pre>
11030          *   </li>
11031          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
11032          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
11033          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
11034          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
11035          *   }</pre>
11036          *   </li>
11037          * </ul>
11038          *  
11039          * @since 1.3.1
11040          * 
11041          * @see
11042          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.setProperty">hcap.property.setProperty()</a><br>
11043          * <a href="_global_.html#event:property_changed">{Event} property_changed</a>
11044          *
11045          * @example
11046          * hcap.property.getProperty({
11047          *      "key" : "model_name",
11048          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
11049          *          console.log("onSuccess : property value = " + s.value);
11050          *      }, 
11051          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
11052          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
11053          *      }
11054          * });
11055          */
11056         hcap.property.getProperty = function (param) {
11057             hcap_command("get_property", param);
11058         };
11059         /**
11060          * Sets a platform property.
11061          * Please refer to writable property key and value in <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a>.
11062          *
11063          * @param {Object} param
11064          * <ul>
11065          *   <li>{String} param.key [Required] - property key to be set.</li>
11066          *   <li>{String} param.value [Required] - property value to be set.</li>
11067          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
11068          *       Setting to the same value for the key as before will invoke this callback function.
11069          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
11070          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
11071          *       // No parameter.
11072          *   }</pre>
11073          *   </li>
11074          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
11075          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
11076          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
11077          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
11078          *   }</pre>
11079          *   </li>
11080          * </ul>
11081          *  
11082          * @since 1.3.1
11083          * 
11084          * @see
11085          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a><br>
11086          * <a href="_global_.html#event:property_changed">{Event} property_changed</a>
11087          *
11088          * @example
11089          * hcap.property.setProperty({
11090          *      "key" : "tv_volume_ui", 
11091          *      "value" : "0", 
11092          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
11093          *          console.log("onSuccess");
11094          *      }, 
11095          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
11096          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
11097          *      }
11098          * });
11099          */
11100         hcap.property.setProperty = function (param) {
11101             hcap_command("set_property", param);
11102         };
11103         /** 
11104          * @namespace hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem
11105          */
11106         hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem = {
11107             /**
11108              * Password type of installer menu enterance. (0 ~ 3)
11109              * @since 1.22.0
11110              * @constant
11111              */
11112             INSTALLER_SEQ : 0,
11113             /**
11114              * Sets number of hours of no activity before automatic shut off. (0 ~ 7)
11115              * @since 1.22.0
11116              * @constant
11117              */
11118             POWER_MANAGE : 1,
11119             /**
11120              * Set to 1 to enable Auto Turn ON when AC power is applied. (0 ~ 3)
11121              * @since 1.22.0
11122              * @constant
11123              */
11124             AC_ON : 2,
11125             /**
11126              * Selects Tuning Band: 0=Broadcast, 1=CATV, 2=HRC, 3=IRC. (0 ~ 3)
11127              * @since 1.22.0
11128              * @constant
11129              */
11130             BAND : 3,
11131             /**
11132              * Channel tuned when TV is turned ON. (Set to 255 to tune to channel tuned before TV turned OFF.) (0 ~ 127, 253, 255)
11133              * @since 1.22.0
11134              * @constant
11135              */
11136             STRT_CHANNEL : 4,
11137             /**
11138              * If set to 1, cannot tune from current channel. (0 / 1)
11139              * @since 1.22.0
11140              * @constant
11141              */
11142             CHAN_LOCK : 5,
11143             /**
11144              * Volume level when TV is turned ON. (Set to 255 to use volume level before TV turned OFF.) (0 ~ 63, 255)
11145              * @since 1.22.0
11146              * @constant
11147              */
11148             STRT_VOLUME : 7,
11149             /**
11150              * Sets minimum allowable volume setting. (0 ~ 63)
11151              * @since 1.22.0
11152              * @constant
11153              */
11154             MIN_VOLUME : 8,
11155             /**
11156              * Sets maximum allowable volume setting. (0 ~ 63)
11157              * @since 1.22.0
11158              * @constant
11159              */
11160             MAX_VOLUME : 9,
11161             /**
11162              * Set to 1 to disable Mute Function. (0 / 1)
11163              * @since 1.22.0
11164              * @constant
11165              */
11166             MUTE_DISABLE : 10,
11167             /**
11168              * Set to 1 to disable menu navigation keys on display panel. (0 / 1)
11169              * @since 1.22.0
11170              * @constant
11171              */
11172             KEY_DEFEAT : 11,
11173             /**
11174              * Set to 1 to enable bank descrete IR dode. (0 / 1)
11175              * @since 1.22.0
11176              * @constant
11177              */
11178             IR_BANKS_ENABLE : 12,
11179             /**
11180              * Set to 1 to enable TV ON when channel up/down key is pressed. (0 / 1)
11181              * @since 1.22.0
11182              * @constant
11183              */
11184             SCAN_MODE : 13,
11185             /**
11186              * Set to 1 to use start channel for channnel map pivot point at Scan Mode. (0 / 1)
11187              * @since 1.22.0
11188              * @constant
11189              */
11190             STRT_CH_IN_SM : 14,
11191             /**
11192              * Set to 1 to enable Sleep Timer. (0 / 1)
11193              * @since 1.22.0
11194              * @constant
11195              */
11196             SLEEP_TIMER : 15,
11197             /**
11198              * Set to 1 to enable On/Off Timers. (0 / 1)
11199              * @since 1.22.0
11200              * @constant
11201              */
11202             EN_TIMER : 16,
11203             /**
11204              * Set to 1 to enable Alarm. (0 / 1)
11205              * @since 1.22.0
11206              * @constant
11207              */
11208             ALARM : 17,
11209             /**
11210              * Determines an additional IR code scheme to which the TV will respond. (0, 16 ~ 24, 64 ~ 65)
11211              * @since 1.22.0
11212              * @constant
11213              */
11214             FEATURE_LEVEL : 20,
11215             /**
11216              * Set to 1 to enable V-Chip (Parental Control) functions. (0 / 1)
11217              * @since 1.22.0
11218              * @constant
11219              */
11220             V_CHIP : 21,
11221             /**
11222              * Sets number of V-Chip blocking hours. (0 ~ 99)
11223              * @since 1.22.0
11224              * @constant
11225              */
11226             MAX_BLK_HRS : 22,
11227             /**
11228              * Set to 1 to retain caption setting set before TV turned OFF. (0 / 1)
11229              * @since 1.22.0
11230              * @constant
11231              */
11232             CAPTION_LOCK : 23,
11233             /**
11234              * Set to 1 to enter Channel Preview/Banks Setup Menu when channel preview key is pressed. (0 / 1)
11235              * @since 1.22.0
11236              * @constant
11237              */
11238             FUNCTION_PRE : 25,
11239             /**
11240              * Pillow speaker selection menu. (0 ~162, 254)
11241              * @since 1.22.0
11242              * @constant
11243              */
11244             HOSPITAL_MODE : 27,
11245             /**
11246              * If set to 0, limits direct access to favorite channels. (0 / 1)
11247              * @since 1.22.0
11248              * @constant
11249              */
11250             CH_OVERIDE : 28,
11251             /**
11252              * Set to 1 to remap the PTC's direct tune channels for Aux inputs from 13xto 9x. (0 / 1)
11253              * @since 1.22.0
11254              * @constant
11255              */
11256             REMAP_AUX_INPS : 29,
11257             /**
11258              * If set to 1, enables ACK feature of MPI. (0 / 1)
11259              * @since 1.22.0
11260              * @constant
11261              */
11262             ACK_MASK : 30,
11263             /**
11264              * Selects poll rate for MPI. (20 ~ 169)
11265              * @since 1.22.0
11266              * @constant
11267              */
11268             POLL_RATE : 31,
11269             /**
11270              * Sets baud rate for MPI. (186 ~ 227)
11271              * @since 1.22.0
11272              * @constant
11273              */
11274             TIMING_PULSE : 32,
11275             /**
11276              * 
11277              * @since 1.22.0
11278              * @constant
11279              */
11280             COMPORT_EN : 34,
11281             /**
11282              * Set to 0 to disable HDMI 1. Set to 1 enable HDMI 1. Set to 5 to enable HDMI 1 but disable Hot Plug Detect (HPD) circuit. (0 ~2)
11283              * @since 1.22.0
11284              * @constant
11285              */
11286             HDMI1_ENABLE : 35,
11287             /**
11288              * Set to 1 to enable display panel Video 1 input jack. (0 / 1)
11289              * @since 1.22.0
11290              * @constant
11291              */
11292             REAR_AUX_EN : 39,
11293             /**
11294              * Determines the status of the SIMPLINK feature. (0 / 1)
11295              * @since 1.22.0
11296              * @constant
11297              */
11298             SIMPLINK_EN : 41,
11299             /**
11300              * Sets aux input for Auto sensing. (0 ~ 255)
11301              * @since 1.22.0
11302              * @constant
11303              */
11304             AUTO_INPUTS : 42,
11305             /**

11307              * @since 1.22.0
11308              * @constant
11309              */
11310             STRT_AUX_SRCE : 46,
11311             /**
11312              * Set to 1 for MPI Aux source to be reported as a channel number instead of Channel 0. (0 / 1)
11313              * @since 1.22.0
11314              * @constant
11315              */
11316             AUX_STATUS : 47,
11317             /**

11320              * @constant
11321              */
11322             DIS_AUDIO_M : 49,
11323             /**
11324              * Set to 1 to disable Channel-Time display. (0 / 1)
11325              * @since 1.22.0
11326              * @constant
11327              */
11328             DIS_CH_TIME : 53,
11329             /**
11330              * Set to 1 to enable custom color for the Channel-Time display. (0 / 1)
11331              * @since 1.22.0
11332              * @constant
11333              */
11334             EN_CH_T_COL : 69,
11335             /**

11337              * @since 1.22.0
11338              * @constant
11339              */
11340             FOR_CH_TIME : 70,
11341             /**
11342              * Chooses custom background color for the Channel-Time display. (0 ~ 7)
11343              * @since 1.22.0
11344              * @constant
11345              */
11346             BCK_CH_TIME : 71,
11347             /**
11348              * If set to 1 and item 028 CH. OVERIDE is set to 0, �뜝�럥�맶�뜝�럥�쑋占쎈쇀占쎈첍T AVAILABLE�뜝�럥�맶�뜝�럥吏쀥뜝�럩援� (0 / 1)

11350              * @constant
11351              */
11352             CH_NOT_AVBLE : 73,
11353             /**
11354              * If set to 1 and loss of MPI communication occurs, TV tunes to Start Channel. (0 / 1)
11355              * @since 1.22.0
11356              * @constant
11357              */
11358             REVERT_CH : 75,
11359             /**
11360              * Quick shutoff. (0 ~ 17)
11361              * @since 1.22.0
11362              * @constant
11363              */
11364             QUICK_SHUTOFF : 77,
11365             /**
11366              * User programmable number, most significant byte. (0 ~ 255)
11367              * @since 1.22.0
11368              * @constant
11369              */
11370             UPN_MSB : 78,
11371             /**
11372              * User programmable number, most significant byte - 1. (0 ~ 255)
11373              * @since 1.22.0
11374              * @constant
11375              */
11376             UPN_MSB_1 : 79,
11377             /**
11378              * User programmable number, most significant byte - 2. (0 ~ 255)
11379              * @since 1.22.0
11380              * @constant
11381              */
11382             UPN_MSB_2 : 80,
11383             /**
11384              * User programmable number, least significant byte. (0 ~ 255)
11385              * @since 1.22.0
11386              * @constant
11387              */
11388             UPN_LSB : 81,
11389             /**
11390              * Enforces rigid MPI checksum. (0 / 1)
11391              * @since 1.22.0
11392              * @constant
11393              */
11394             CHKSUM_ERROR : 82,
11395             /**
11396              * Relaxes MPI timing to be compatible with PC-based Windows-controlled systems. (0 ~ 5)
11397              * @since 1.22.0
11398              * @constant
11399              */
11400             HANDSHK_TIME : 83,
11401             /**
11402              * Removes block hours setting for Parental Control and makes block permanent. (0 / 1)
11403              * @since 1.22.0
11404              * @constant
11405              */
11406             PERMANENT_BLK : 84,
11407             /**

11409              * @since 1.22.0
11410              * @constant
11411              */
11412             V_MUTE_TIME : 86,
11413             /**
11414              * Set to 1 to enable RGB Aux input. (0 / 1)
11415              * @since 1.22.0
11416              * @constant
11417              */
11418             REAR_RGB_EN : 87,
11419             /**
11420              * If set to 1, audio is muted if no signal is present. (0 / 1)
11421              * @since 1.22.0
11422              * @constant
11423              */
11424             EN_NOISE_MUTE : 88,
11425             /**
11426              * If set to 1, keyboard is locked out, IR is still functional. (0 / 1)
11427              * @since 1.22.0
11428              * @constant
11429              */
11430             KEY_LOCK : 90,
11431             /**
11432              * Set to 0 to disable HDMI 2. Set to 1 to enable HDMI 2. (0 ~ 2)
11433              * @since 1.22.0
11434              * @constant
11435              */
11436             HDMI2_ENABLE : 91,
11437             /**
11438              * Set to 0 to disable HDMI 3. Set to 1 to enable HDMI 3. (0 ~ 2)
11439              * @since 1.22.0
11440              * @constant
11441              */
11442             HDMI3_ENABLE : 92,
11443             /**
11444              * Set to 1 to enable the LG proprieatary Remote Jack Pack feature interface. (0 / 1)
11445              * @since 1.22.0
11446              * @constant
11447              */
11448             RJP_AVAILABLE : 93,
11449             /**
11450              * Set to 0 to disable feature on Function Menu. Set to 1 to enable feature on Function Menu. (0 / 1)
11451              * @since 1.22.0
11452              * @constant
11453              */
11454             SAP_MENU_EN : 94,
11455             /**
11456              * Sets default aspect ratio at power up. See detailed descriptions and item 106. (0 ~ 4)
11457              * @since 1.22.0
11458              * @constant
11459              */
11460             DEF_ASP_RATIO : 96,
11461             /**
11462              * Sets external audio output. (0 ~ 9)
11463              * @since 1.22.0
11464              * @constant
11465              */
11466             AUDIO_OUTPUT : 97,
11467             /**
11468              * Set to 0 to disable Pro:Centric operation. Set to 1 for Flash Mode. Set to 2 for GEM (Java Application) Mode. Set to 3 for HTML Mode. (0 ~ 3)
11469              * @since 1.22.0
11470              * @constant
11471              */
11472             PROCENTRIC : 98,
11473             /**
11474              * Sets the level of the TV picture back lighting. (1 ~ 202, 255)
11475              * @since 1.22.0
11476              * @constant
11477              */
11478             BACK_LIGHTING : 99,
11479             /**
11480              * Selects HDMI connection for display panel: 3=HDMI1, 4=HDMI2, 5=HDMI3. (3 ~5)
11481              * @since 1.22.0
11482              * @constant
11483              */
11484             VIDEO_INTERFACE : 100,
11485             /**
11486              * Set to 2 to disalbe the STB's MMR feature. (0 / 2)
11487              * @since 1.22.0
11488              * @constant
11489              */
11490             IR_FEEDBACK : 101,
11491             /**
11492              * Selects ATSC band. (0 ~ 4)
11493              * @since 1.22.0
11494              * @constant
11495              */
11496             ATSC_BAND : 102,
11497             /**
11498              * Set to 1 (default) for Physical Channel scan. Set to 0 for Virtual Channel scan. (0 / 1)
11499              * @since 1.22.0
11500              * @constant
11501              */
11502             ATSC_TUNE_MODE : 103,
11503             /**
11504              * Selects Minor Start Channel. Set to 0 for NTSC. (0 ~ 255)
11505              * @since 1.22.0
11506              * @constant
11507              */
11508             START_MINOR_CH : 104,
11509             /**
11510              * Sets format for video output: 1=720p, 4=1080p, 5=1366x768, 6=2160p. (1, 4, 5, 6)
11511              * @since 1.22.0
11512              * @constant
11513              */
11514             VID_OUT_FORMAT : 105,
11515             /**
11516              * To retain set aspect ratio on power cycle, set to 1. Set to 0 for default ratio on power cycle. (0 / 1)
11517              * @since 1.22.0
11518              * @constant
11519              */
11520             ASP_RATIO_LOCK : 106,
11521             /**
11522              * Selects the type of banner to display during channel change. (0 / 1)
11523              * @since 1.22.0
11524              * @constant
11525              */
11526             BANNER_SELECT : 107,
11527             /**
11528              * Sets display panel baud rate: 0=1200, 1=2400, 2=9600, 3=115200. (0 ~ 3)
11529              * @since 1.22.0
11530              * @constant
11531              */
11532             PANEL_COM : 108,
11533             /**
11534              * Set to 1 to enable handshaking. (0 / 1)
11535              * @since 1.22.0
11536              * @constant
11537              */
11538             PANEL_HNDSHAKE : 109,
11539             /**
11540              * Sets the display panel communication delay time. (0 ~ 15)
11541              * @since 1.22.0
11542              * @constant
11543              */
11544             PANEL_DELAY : 110,
11545             /**
11546              * Determines a preset fixed volume level to set in the display panel.(0 ~ 15)
11547              * @since 1.22.0
11548              * @constant
11549              */
11550             PANEL_VOL_PRE : 111,
11551             /**
11552              * Sets the volume in the panel for start volume. (0 ~ 63)
11553              * @since 1.22.0
11554              * @constant
11555              */
11556             PANEL_STRT_VOL : 112,
11557             /**
11558              * Sets display panel communication command set. (0 ~ 4)
11559              * @since 1.22.0
11560              * @constant
11561              */
11562             PANEL_TYPE : 113,
11563             /**
11564              * Keeps volume level of panel in range. (0 ~ 63)
11565              * @since 1.22.0
11566              * @constant
11567              */
11568             PANEL_MIN_VOL : 114,
11569             /**
11570              * Keeps volume level of panel in range. (0 ~ 63)
11571              * @since 1.22.0
11572              * @constant
11573              */
11574             PANEL_MAX_VOL : 115,
11575             /**
11576              * Set to 0 for Normal. Set to 1 for Blank. (0 / 1)
11577              * @since 1.22.0
11578              * @constant
11579              */
11580             VIDEO_MUTE_EN : 116,
11581             /**
11582              * Set to 0 for Normal. Set to 1 to load presets for all Installer Menu settings. (0 / 1)
11583              * @since 1.22.0
11584              * @constant
11585              */
11586             FACT_DEFAULT : 117,
11587             /**
11588              * Determines the powered status of the embedded b-LAN module and the GAME CONTROL/MPI port. (1, 3, 7)
11589              * @since 1.22.0
11590              * @constant
11591              */
11592             POWER_SAVINGS : 118,
11593             /**
