13140          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13141          *          var media = hcap.Media.createMedia({
13142          *              "url" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.avi", 
13143          *              "mimeType" : "video/mp4", 
13144          *              "subtitleUrl" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.smi"
13145          *          });
13146          *          media.play({
13147          *              "onSuccess" : function() {
13148          *                  console.log("onSuccess");
13149          *                  media.setSubtitle({
13150          *                      "type" :  hcap.Media.SubtitleType.INTERNAL_SUBTITLE,
13151          *                      "index" : 0,
13152          *                      "onSuccess" : function() {
13153          *                          console.log("onSuccess");
13154          *                      },
13155          *                      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13156          *                          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13157          *                      }
13158          *                  });
13159          *              }, 
13160          *              "onFailure" : function(f) {
13161          *                  console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13162          *              }
13163          *          });
13164          *      },
13165          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13166          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13167          *      }
13168          * });
13169          */
13170         hcap.Media.prototype.setSubtitle = function (param) {
13171             if (media_object === null) {
13172                 param.onFailure({"errorMessage" : "already destroyed."});
13173                 return;
13174             }
13175             hcap_command("media_set_subtitle", param);
13176         };
13177         /**
13178          * @namespace hcap.Media.SubtitleType
13179          */
13180         hcap.Media.SubtitleType = {
13181             /**
13182              * None
13183              * @since 1.22.0
13184              * @constant
13185              */
13186         	NONE : 0,
13187             /**
13188              * Internal Subtitle
13189              * @since 1.22.0
13190              * @constant
13191              */
13192             INTERNAL_SUBTITLE : 1,
13193             /**
13194              * External Subtitle
13195              * @since 1.22.0
13196              * @constant
13197              */
13198             EXTERNAL_SUBTITLE : 2,
13199             /**
13200              * Closed Caption
13201              * @since 1.22.0
13202              * @constant
13203              */
13204             CLOSED_CAPTION : 3
13205         };
13206         /**
13207          * @namespace hcap.rms
13208          */
13209         hcap.rms = {};
13210         /**
13211          * Request RMS (Remote Management System) command in XML format to RMS.<br>
13212          * RMS XML protocol will be provided separately.<br>
13213          * Response for this request will be received by the result of this API or by registering the <a href="_global_.html#event:rms_response_received">{Event} rms_response_received</a>. How to receive the response is different command by command. 
13214          * 
13215          * @param {Object} param
13216          * <ul>
13217          *   <li>{String} param.message [Required] - RMS request message in XML.</li>
13218          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13219          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13220          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
13221          *       // {String} param.response - response result for the request.
13222          *   }</pre>
13223          *   </li>
13224          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
13225          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13226          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13227          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13228          *   }</pre>
13229          *   </li>
13230          * </ul>
13231          *  
13232          * @since 1.6.0
13233          * 
13234          * @see
13235          * <a href="_global_.html#event:rms_response_received">{Event} rms_response_received</a><br>
13236          *
13237          * @example
13238          * hcap.rms.requestRms({
13239          *      "message" : "xxxxxxx",
13240          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
13241          *          console.log("onSuccess : response message = " + s.response);
13242          *      }, 
13243          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13244          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13245          *      }
13246          * });
13247          */
13248         hcap.rms.requestRms = function (param) {
13249             hcap_command("request_rms", param);
13250         };
13251         /** 
13252          * @namespace hcap.socket
13253          */
13254         hcap.socket = { };
13255         /**
13256          * Open UDP socket daemon.<br>
13257          * To try opening UDP socket daemon with a port that has already been opened will be failed. In this case, please close the previous daemon and try it again.<br>
13258 	 * And if the application is unloaded, all opened UDP socket daemons will be destroyed.<br>
13259 	 *
13260          *  
13261          * @param {Object} param
13262          * <ul>
13263          *   <li>{Number} param.port [Required] - socket port number to open its UDP socket daemon.</li>
13264          *   <li>{String} param.multicastIp [Optional] - multicast IP address to use multicast functionality in UDP socket daemon. If it is not defined, Daemon did not received packets from multicast groups(224.0.0.0 ~ 239.255.255.255) </li>
13265 	 *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13266          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13267          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
13268          *       // No Parameter.
13269          *   }</pre>
13270          *   </li>
13271          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13272          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13273          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13274          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13275          *   }</pre>
13276          *   </li>
13277          * </ul>
13278          *  
13279          * @since 1.6.0
13280          * 
13281          * @see
13282          * <a href="hcap.socket.html#.closeUdpDaemon">hcap.socket.closeUdpDaemon()</a><br>
13283          * <a href="_global_.html#event:udp_data_received">{Event} udp_data_received</a><br>
13284          * <a href="hcap.socket.html#.sendUdpData">hcap.socket.sendUdpData()</a><br>
13285          *
13286          * @example
13287          * hcap.socket.openUdpDaemon({
13288          *      "port" : 9311,
13289 	 *      "multicastIp" : "239.0.0.1",
13290          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
13291          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13292          *      }, 
13293          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13294          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13295          *      }
13296          * });
13297          */
13298         hcap.socket.openUdpDaemon = function (param) {
13299             hcap_command("open_udp_daemon", param);
13300         };
13301         /**
13302          * Close UDP socket daemon.<br>
13303          * 
13304          * @param {Object} param
13305          * <ul>
13306          *   <li>{Number} param.port [Required] - port number of UDP connection to close.</li>
13307          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13308          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13309          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
13310          *       // No Parameter.
13311          *   }</pre>
13312          *   </li>
13313          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13314          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13315          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13316          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13317          *   }</pre>
13318          *   </li>
13319          * </ul>
13320          *  
13321          * @since 1.6.0
13322          * 
13323          * @see
13324          * <a href="hcap.socket.html#.openUdpDaemon">hcap.socket.openUdpDaemon()</a><br>
13325          * <a href="_global_.html#event:udp_data_received">{Event} udp_data_received</a><br>
13326          * <a href="hcap.socket.html#.sendUdpData">hcap.socket.sendUdpData()</a><br>
13327          *
13328          * @example
13329          * hcap.socket.closeUdpDaemon({
13330          *      "port" : 9311,
13331          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
13332          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13333          *      }, 
13334          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13335          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13336          *      }
13337          * });
13338          */
13339         hcap.socket.closeUdpDaemon = function (param) {
13340             hcap_command("close_udp_daemon", param);
13341         };
13342         /**
13343          * Open TCP socket daemon.<br>
13344          * To try opening TCP socket daemon with a port that has already been opened will be failed. In this case, please close the previous daemon and try it again.<br>
13345          * And if the application is unloaded, all opened TCP socket daemons will be destroyed.<br>
13346          * 
13347          * @param {Object} param
13348          * <ul>
13349          *   <li>{Number} param.port [Required] - socket port number to open its TCP socket daemon.</li>
13350          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13351          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13352          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
13353          *       // No Parameter.
13354          *   }</pre>
13355          *   </li>
13356          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13357          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13358          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13359          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13360          *   }</pre>
13361          *   </li>
13362          * </ul>
13363          *  
13364          * @since 1.10.1
13365          * 
13366          * @see
13367          * <a href="hcap.socket.html#.closeTcpDaemon">hcap.socket.closeTcpDaemon()</a><br>
13368          * <a href="_global_.html#event:tcp_data_received">{Event} tcp_data_received</a><br>
13369          *
13370          * @example
13371          * hcap.socket.openTcpDaemon({
13372          *      "port" : 9312,
13373          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
13374          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13375          *      }, 
13376          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13377          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13378          *      }
13379          * });
13380          */
13381         hcap.socket.openTcpDaemon = function (param) {
13382             hcap_command("open_tcp_daemon", param);
13383         };
13384         /**
13385          * Close TCP socket daemon.<br>
13386          * 
13387          * @param {Object} param
13388          * <ul>
13389          *   <li>{Number} param.port [Required] - port number of TCP connection to close.</li>
13390          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13391          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13392          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
13393          *       // No Parameter.
13394          *   }</pre>
13395          *   </li>
13396          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13397          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13398          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13399          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13400          *   }</pre>
13401          *   </li>
13402          * </ul>
13403          *  
13404          * @since 1.10.1
13405          * 
13406          * @see
13407          * <a href="hcap.socket.html#.openTcpDaemon">hcap.socket.openTcpDaemon()</a><br>
13408          * <a href="_global_.html#event:tcp_data_received">{Event} tcp_data_received</a><br>
13409          *
13410          * @example
13411          * hcap.socket.closeTcpDaemon({
13412          *      "port" : 9312,
13413          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
13414          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13415          *      }, 
13416          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13417          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13418          *      }
13419          * });
13420          */
13421         hcap.socket.closeTcpDaemon = function (param) {
13422             hcap_command("close_tcp_daemon", param);
13423         };
13424         /**
13425          * Send UDP packet data to remote UDP server.<br>
13426          * 
13427          * @param {Object} param
13428          * <ul>
13429          *   <li>{String} param.ip [Required] - IP address of remote UDP server to send UDP packet data.</li>
13430          *   <li>{Number} param.port [Required] - port number of remote UDP server.</li>
13431          *   <li>{String} param.udpData [Required] - UDP packet data.</li>
13432          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13433          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13434          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
13435          *       // No Parameter.
13436          *   }</pre>
13437          *   </li>
13438          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13439          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13440          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13441          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13442          *   }</pre>
13443          *   </li>
13444          * </ul>
13445          *  
13446          * @since 1.10.1
13447          * 
13448          * @see
13449          * <a href="hcap.socket.html#.openUdpDaemon">hcap.socket.openUdpDaemon()</a><br>
13450          * <a href="hcap.socket.html#.closeUdpDaemon">hcap.socket.closeUdpDaemon()</a><br>
13451          * <a href="_global_.html#event:udp_data_received">{Event} udp_data_received</a><br>
13452          *
13453          * @example
13454          * hcap.socket.sendUdpData({
13455          *      "ip" : "192.168.123.56",
13456          *      "port" : 7222,
13457          *      "udpData" : "UDP packet data to send",
13458          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
13459          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13460          *      }, 
13461          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13462          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13463          *      }
13464          * });
13465          */
13466         hcap.socket.sendUdpData = function (param) {
13467             hcap_command("send_udp_data", param);
13468         };
13469         hcap.drm = {};
13470         /*
13471          * @namespace hcap.drm.securemedia
13472          */
13473         hcap.drm.securemedia = {};
13474         /**
13475          * initialize secure media agent.<br>
13476          * 
13477          * @param {Object} param
13478          * <ul>
13479          *   <li>{String} param.companyName [Required] - This is used to separate service providers using SecureMedia.</li>
13480          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13481          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13482          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
13483          *       // No Parameter.
13484          *   }</pre>
13485          *   </li>
13486          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13487          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13488          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13489          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13490          *   }</pre>
13491          *   </li>
13492          * </ul>
13493          *  
13494          * @since 1.7.0
13495          * 
13496          * @see
13497          * @example
13498          * hcap.drm.securemedia.initialize({
13499          *      "companyName" : "LGE",
13500          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
13501          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13502          *      }, 
13503          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13504          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13505          *      }
13506          * });
13507          * 
13508          * If you want to use secure media DRM, you should add information to url on hcap.Media.createMedia method.
13509          * That url has device id, password, user data for right manager and register url. And each parameter should have be seperated with "|" character. 
13510          * For example of url is "http://71.170.161.24/sm/Airplane-Encrypted/hls_CE_DEVICES.m3u8?|DRM_INFO={DEVICE_ID=E8:5B:5B:B8:7F:CF|AINFO1=<user><id>vzec81yq</id><domain>DNET</domain></user>|AINFO2=KLCISIPCTEMJAE3LuKoRLzjLkg//8yQxsSSRFj4wWRjQ6Rs5x3SAH8fc|REGISTER_URL=https://gwott30.verizon.net/esam/esamservice}|COMPONENT=HLS"
13511          * 
13512          * var media = hcap.Media.createMedia({
13513          *      "url" : "http://71.170.161.24/sm/Airplane-Encrypted/hls_CE_DEVICES.m3u8?|DRM_INFO={DEVICE_ID=E8:5B:5B:B8:7F:CF|AINFO1=<user><id>vzec81yq</id><domain>DNET</domain></user>|AINFO2=KLCISIPCTEMJAE3LuKoRLzjLkg//8yQxsSSRFj4wWRjQ6Rs5x3SAH8fc|REGISTER_URL=https://gwott30.verizon.net/esam/esamservice}|COMPONENT=HLS", 
13514          *      "mimeType" : "video/mpeg", 
13515          *      "drmType" : "SECUREMEDIA",
13516          *      "subtitleUrl" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.smi",
13517          * });
13518          */
13519         hcap.drm.securemedia.initialize = function (param) {
13520             hcap_command("secure_media_drm_initialize", param);
13521         };
13522         /**
13523          * unregister secure media agent.<br>
13524          * 
13525          * @param {Object} param
13526          * <ul>
13527          *   <li>{String} param.companyName [Required] - This is used to separate service providers using SecureMedia.</li>
13528          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13529          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13530          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
13531          *       // No Parameter.
13532          *   }</pre>
13533          *   </li>
13534          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13535          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13536          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13537          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13538          *   }</pre>
13539          *   </li>
13540          * </ul>
13541          *  
13542          * @since 1.7.0
13543          * 
13544          * @see
13545          * @example
13546          * hcap.drm.securemedia.unregister({
13547          *      "companyName" : "LGE",
13548          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
13549          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13550          *      }, 
13551          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13552          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13553          *      }
13554          * });
13555          */
13556         hcap.drm.securemedia.unregister = function (param) {
13557             hcap_command("secure_media_drm_unregister", param);
13558         };
13559         /**
13560          * check whether secure media agent register.<br>
13561          * 
13562          * @param {Object} param
13563          * <ul>
13564          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13565          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13566          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
13567          *       // {Boolean} param.isRegisteration - true if the secure media agent is registered successfully, else false.
13568          *   }</pre>
13569          *   </li>
13570          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13571          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13572          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13573          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13574          *   }</pre>
13575          *   </li>
13576          * </ul>
13577          *  
13578          * @since 1.7.0
13579          * 
13580          * @see
13581          * @example
13582          * hcap.drm.securemedia.isRegistration({
13583          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
13584          *          console.log("onSuccess" + s.isRegisteration);
13585          *      }, 
13586          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13587          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13588          *      }
13589          * });
13590          */
13591         hcap.drm.securemedia.isRegistration = function (param) {
13592             hcap_command("secure_media_drm_is_registration", param);
13593         };
13594         /**
13595          * register secure media agent.<br>
13596          * 
13597          * @param {Object} param
13598          * <ul>
13599          *   <li>{String} param.deviceInfo [Required] - device info, It becomes ID for SecureMedia (ex> E8:5B:5B:B8:7F:CF).</li>
13600          *   <li>{String} param.appInfo [Required] - It becomes password.</li>
13601          *   <li>{String} param.esamUrl [Required] - It is the url of ESAM server.</li>
13602          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13603          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13604          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
13605          *       // No Parameter.
13606          *   }</pre>
13607          *   </li>
13608          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13609          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13610          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13611          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13612          *   }</pre>
13613          *   </li>
13614          * </ul>
13615          *  
13616          * @since 1.7.0
13617          * 
13618          * @see
13619          * @example
13620          * hcap.drm.securemedia.register({
13621          *      "deviceInfo" : "E8:5B:5B:B8:7F:CF",
13622          *      "appInfo" : "<user><id>vzec81yq</id><domain>DNET</domain></user>",
13623          *      "esamUrl" : "http://71.170.161.24/sm/Airplane-Encrypted/hls_CE_DEVICES.m3u8?|DRM_INFO={DEVICE_ID=E8:5B:5B:B8:7F:CF|AINFO1=<user><id>vzec81yq</id><domain>DNET</domain></user>|AINFO2=KLCISIPCTEMJAE3LuKoRLzjLkg//8yQxsSSRFj4wWRjQ6Rs5x3SAH8fc|REGISTER_URL=https://gwott30.verizon.net/esam/esamservice}|COMPONENT=HLS",
13624          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
13625          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13626          *      }, 
13627          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13628          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13629          *      }
13630          * });
13631          */
13632         hcap.drm.securemedia.register = function (param) {
13633             hcap_command("secure_media_drm_register", param);
13634         };
13635         /**
13636          * finalize secure media agent.<br>
13637          * 
13638          * @param {Object} param
13639          * <ul>
13640          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13641          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13642          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
13643          *       // No Parameter.
13644          *   }</pre>
13645          *   </li>
13646          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13647          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13648          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13649          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13650          *   }</pre>
13651          *   </li>
13652          * </ul>
13653          *  
13654          * @since 1.7.0
13655          * 
13656          * @see
13657          * @example
13658          * hcap.drm.securemedia.finalize({
13659          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
13660          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13661          *      }, 
13662          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13663          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13664          *      }
13665          * });
13666          */
13667         hcap.drm.securemedia.finalize = function (param) {
13668             hcap_command("secure_media_drm_finalize", param);
13669         };
13670         /** 
13671          * @namespace hcap.file
13672          */
13673         hcap.file = { };
13674         /**
13675          * Gets the USB storage list.<br>
13676          * 
13677          * @param {Object} param
13678          * <ul>
13679          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13680          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13681          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
13682          *       // {Array} param.list - list for the USB storage devices connected to TV.
13683          *       //         {String} param.list[].name - unique device name within the system
13684          *       //         {String} param.list[].displayName - display name
13685          *       //         {String} param.list[].mountPoint - mount point path
13686          *       //         {String} param.list[].status - status among "INIT"(device is initializing), "AVAILABLE"(device is available), "BUSY"(device is unavailable for a while because device is busy in the other work) and "OFFLINE"(device is physically connected but is unavailable)
13687          *       //         {String} param.list[].filesystemStatus - filesystem status among "READ_ONLY" and "READ_WRITE"
13688          *       //         {String} param.list[].totalSize - total size in bytes
13689          *       //         {String} param.list[].freeSize - free size in bytes
13690          *   }</pre>
13691          *   </li>
13692          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13693          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13694          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13695          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13696          *   }</pre>
13697          *   </li>
13698          * </ul>
13699          * 
13700          * @since 1.18.1
13701          * 
13702          * @see
13703          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.getUsbStorageFileList">hcap.file.getUsbStorageFileList()</a><br>
13704          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.downloadFileToUsb">hcap.file.downloadFileToUsb()</a><br>
13705          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.deleteUsbFile">hcap.file.deleteUsbFile()</a><br>
13706          * <a href="_global_.html#event:usb_file_downloaded">{Event} usb_file_downloaded</a><br>
13707          *
13708          * @example
13709          * hcap.file.getUsbStorageList({
13710          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
13711          *          console.log("onSuccess : list length = " + s.list.length);
13712          *          for (var i = 0; i < s.list.length; i++) {
13713          *              console.log(
13714          *                  "[" + i + "].name = " + s.list[i].name +
13715          *                  "[" + i + "].displayName = " + s.list[i].displayName +
13716          *                  "[" + i + "].mountPoint = " + s.list[i].mountPoint +
13717          *                  "[" + i + "].status = " + s.list[i].status +
13718          *                  "[" + i + "].filesystemStatus = " + s.list[i].filesystemStatus +
13719          *                  "[" + i + "].totalSize = " + s.list[i].totalSize +
13720          *                  "[" + i + "].freeSize = " + s.list[i].freeSize
13721          *              );
13722          *          }
13723          *      },
13724          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13725          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13726          *      }
13727          * });
13728          */
13729         hcap.file.getUsbStorageList = function (param) {
13730             hcap_command("get_usb_storage_list", param);
13731         };
13732         /**
13733          * Gets the file list for the given path in a USB storage.<br>
13734          * 
13735          * @param {Object} param
13736          * <ul>
13737          *   <li>{String} param.path [Required] - directory path to get file list. Only the directory equal to or lower than a USB mount point path is allowed.</li>
13738          *   <li>{Number} param.position [Optional] - start position (starts with 0) where starts to make file list in the directory. Default <em>position</em> is 0.</li>
13739          *   <li>{Number} param.length [Optional] - at most the <em>length</em> number of files from the <em>position</em> will be listed up. Default <em>length</em> is 100.</li>
13740          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13741          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13742          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
13743          *       // {Array} param.list - file list
13744          *       //         {String} param.list[].name - file name
13745          *       //         {String} param.list[].type - file type among "BLK"(block device), "CHR"(character device), "DIR"(directory), "FIFO"(named pipe), "LNK"(symbolic link), "REG"(regular file), "SOCK"(UNIX domain socket) and "UNKNOWN"(unknown)
13746          *       //         {String} param.list[].length - file length
13747          *   }</pre>
13748          *   </li>
13749          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13750          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13751          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13752          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13753          *   }</pre>
13754          *   </li>
13755          * </ul>
13756          * 
13757          * @since 1.18.1
13758          * 
13759          * @see
13760          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.getUsbStorageList">hcap.file.getUsbStorageList()</a><br>
13761          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.downloadFileToUsb">hcap.file.downloadFileToUsb()</a><br>
13762          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.deleteUsbFile">hcap.file.deleteUsbFile()</a><br>
13763          * <a href="_global_.html#event:usb_file_downloaded">{Event} usb_file_downloaded</a><br>
13764          *
13765          * @example
13766          * hcap.file.getUsbStorageList({
13767          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
13768          *          hcap.file.getUsbStorageFileList({
13769          *              "path" : s[0].mountPoint,
13770          *              "onSuccess" : function (param) {
13771          *                  console.log("file list length = " + param.list.length);
13772          *                  for (var i = 0; i < param.list.length; i++) {
13773          *                      console.log(
13774          *                          "[" + i + "].name = " + param.list[i].name +
13775          *                          "[" + i + "].type = " + param.list[i].type +
13776          *                          "[" + i + "].length = " + param.list[i].length
13777          *                      );
13778          *                  }
13779          *              },
13780          *              "onFailure" : function(ff) {
13781          *                  console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + ff.errorMessage);
13782          *              }
13783          *          });
13784          *      },
13785          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13786          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13787          *      }
13788          * });
13789          */
13790         hcap.file.getUsbStorageFileList = function (param) {
13791             hcap_command("get_usb_storage_file_list", param);
13792         };
13793         /**
13794          * Downloads the file given by uri to the path in the USB storage.<br>
13795          * 
13796          * The result for the download can be obtained by registering the 
13797          * <a href="_global_.html#event:usb_file_downloaded">{Event} usb_file_downloaded</a><br><br>
13798          *     
13799          * @param {Object} param
13800          * <ul>
13801          *   <li>{String} param.uri [Required] - URI for the file to download to the USB storage. Only "http" and "https" are allowed.</li>
13802          *   <li>{String} param.path [Required] - file path to download the file of uri. The file path should be equal to or lower than a USB mount point path. And if the directory doesn't exist, it will be created automatically.</li>
13803          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13804          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13805          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
13806          *       // No Parameter.
13807          *   }</pre>
13808          *   </li>
13809          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13810          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13811          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13812          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13813          *   }</pre>
13814          *   </li>
13815          * </ul>
13816          * 
13817          * @since 1.18.3
13818          * 
13819          * @see
13820          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.getUsbStorageList">hcap.file.getUsbStorageList()</a><br>
13821          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.getUsbStorageFileList">hcap.file.getUsbStorageFileList()</a><br>
13822          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.deleteUsbFile">hcap.file.deleteUsbFile()</a><br>
13823          * <a href="_global_.html#event:usb_file_downloaded">{Event} usb_file_downloaded</a><br>
13824          *
13825          * @example
13826          * hcap.file.downloadFileToUsb({
13827          *      "uri" : "http://mycompany.com/resource/a.mp3",
13828          *      "path" : "/tmp/usb/sda/sda1/download/b.mp3",
13829          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
13830          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13831          *      },
13832          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13833          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13834          *      }
13835          * });
13836          */
13837         hcap.file.downloadFileToUsb = function (param) {
13838             hcap_command("download_file_to_usb", param);
13839         };
13840         /**
13841          * Deletes the file or directory given by the path in the USB storage.<br>
13842          *     
13843          * @param {Object} param
13844          * <ul>
13845          *   <li>{String} param.path [Required] - file path or directory path to delete in the USB storage. Only the file path or the directory path under a USB mount point path (except the root directory of a USB mount point path as a directory path) are allowed. The designated path will be deleted without any warning. (It is same as "rm -rf") And if the path doesn't exist, the success callback will be returned.</li>
13846          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
13847          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13848          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
13849          *       // No Parameter.
13850          *   }</pre>
13851          *   </li>
13852          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
13853          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
13854          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
13855          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
13856          *   }</pre>
13857          *   </li>
13858          * </ul>
13859          * 
13860          * @since 1.18.3
13861          * 
13862          * @see
13863          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.getUsbStorageList">hcap.file.getUsbStorageList()</a><br>
13864          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.getUsbStorageFileList">hcap.file.getUsbStorageFileList()</a><br>
13865          * <a href="hcap.file.html#.downloadFileToUsb">hcap.file.downloadFileToUsb()</a><br>
13866          * <a href="_global_.html#event:usb_file_downloaded">{Event} usb_file_downloaded</a><br>
13867          *
13868          * @example
13869          * hcap.file.deleteUsbFile({
13870          *      "path" : "/tmp/usb/sda/sda1/download/a.mp4", // or a directory "/tmp/usb/sda/sda1/download"
13871          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
13872          *          console.log("onSuccess");
13873          *      },
13874          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
13875          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
13876          *      }
13877          * });
13878          */
13879         hcap.file.deleteUsbFile = function (param) {
13880             hcap_command("delete_usb_file", param);
13881         };
13882         /**
13883          * @namespace hcap.rs232c
13884          */
13885         hcap.rs232c = {};
13886         /**
13887          * @namespace hcap.rs232c.BaudRate
13888          */
13889         hcap.rs232c.BaudRate = {
13890             /**
13891              * unknown value.
13892              * @since 1.18.4
13893              * @constant
13894              */
13895             BR_UNKNOWN : 0,
13896             /**
13897              * baud rate 110.
13898              * @since 1.18.4
13899              * @constant
13900              */
13901             BR_110 : 110,
13902             /**
13903              * baud rate 300.
13904              * @since 1.18.4
13905              * @constant
13906              */
13907             BR_300 : 300,
13908             /**
13909              * baud rate 600.
13910              * @since 1.18.4
13911              * @constant
13912              */
13913             BR_600 : 600,
13914             /**
13915              * baud rate 1200.
13916              * @since 1.18.4
13917              * @constant
13918              */
13919             BR_1200 : 1200,
13920             /**
13921              * baud rate 2400.
13922              * @since 1.18.4
13923              * @constant
13924              */
13925             BR_2400 : 2400,
13926             /**
13927              * baud rate 4800.
13928              * @since 1.18.4
13929              * @constant
13930              */
13931             BR_4800 : 4800,
13932             /**
13933              * baud rate 9600.
13934              * @since 1.18.4
13935              * @constant
13936              */
13937             BR_9600 : 9600,
13938             /**
13939              * baud rate 14400.
13940              * @since 1.18.4
13941              * @constant
13942              */
13943             BR_14400 : 14400,
13944             /**
13945              * baud rate 19200.
13946              * @since 1.18.4
13947              * @constant
13948              */
13949             BR_19200 : 19200,
13950             /**
13951              * baud rate 38400.
13952              * @since 1.18.4
13953              * @constant
13954              */
13955             BR_38400 : 38400,
13956             /**
13957              * baud rate 57600.
13958              * @since 1.18.4
13959              * @constant
13960              */
13961             BR_57600 : 57600,
13962             /**
13963              * baud rate 115200.
13964              * @since 1.18.4
13965              * @constant
13966              */
13967             BR_115200 : 115200,
13968             /**
13969              * baud rate 128000.
13970              * @since 1.18.4
13971              * @constant
13972              */
13973             BR_128000 : 128000,
13974             /**
13975              * baud rate 230400.
13976              * @since 1.18.4
13977              * @constant
13978              */
13979             BR_230400 : 230400,
13980             /**
13981              * baud rate 256000.
13982              * @since 1.18.4
13983              * @constant
13984              */
13985             BR_256000 : 256000,
13986             /**
13987              * baud rate 512000.
13988              * @since 1.18.4
13989              * @constant
13990              */
13991             BR_512000 : 512000,
13992             /**
13993              * baud rate 768000.
13994              * @since 1.18.4
13995              * @constant
13996              */
13997             BR_768000 : 768000,
13998             /**
13999              * baud rate 921600.
14000              * @since 1.18.4
14001              * @constant
14002              */
14003             BR_921600 : 921600,
14004             /**
14005              * baud rate 1024000.
14006              * @since 1.18.4
14007              * @constant
14008              */
14009             BR_1024000 : 1024000
14010         };
14011         /**
14012          * @namespace hcap.rs232c.DataBit
14013          */
14014         hcap.rs232c.DataBit = {
14015             /**
14016              * unknown value.
14017              * @since 1.18.4
14018              * @constant
14019              */
14020             BIT_UNKNOWN : 0,
14021             /**
14022              * data bit 7 bit.
14023              * @since 1.18.4
14024              * @constant
14025              */
14026             BIT_7 : 7,
14027             /**
14028              * data bit 8 bit.
14029              * @since 1.18.4
14030              * @constant
14031              */
14032             BIT_8 : 8
14033         };
14034         /**
14035          * @namespace hcap.rs232c.Parity
14036          */
14037         hcap.rs232c.Parity = {
14038             /**
14039              * unknown value.
14040              * @since 1.18.4
14041              * @constant
14042              */
14043             UNKNOWN : 0,
14044             /**
14045              * parity none.
14046              * @since 1.18.4
14047              * @constant
14048              */
14049             NONE : 1,
14050             /**
14051              * parity even.
14052              * @since 1.18.4
14053              * @constant
14054              */
14055             EVEN : 2,
14056             /**
14057              * parity odd.
14058              * @since 1.18.4
14059              * @constant
14060              */
14061             ODD : 3
14062         };
14063         /**
14064          * @namespace hcap.rs232c.StopBit
14065          */
14066         hcap.rs232c.StopBit = {
14067             /**
14068              * unknown value.
14069              * @since 1.18.4
14070              * @constant
14071              */
14072             UNKNOWN : 0,
14073             /**
14074              * stop bit 1 bit.
14075              * @since 1.18.4
14076              * @constant
14077              */
14078             BIT_1 : 1,
14079             /**
14080              * stop bit 2 bit.
14081              * @since 1.18.4
14082              * @constant
14083              */
14084             BIT_2 : 2
14085         };
14086         /**
14087          * @namespace hcap.rs232c.FlowControl
14088          */
14089         hcap.rs232c.FlowControl = {
14090             /**
14091              * unknown value.
14092              * @since 1.18.4
14093              * @constant
14094              */
14095             UNKNOWN : 0,
14096             /**
14097              * flow control none.
14098              * @since 1.18.4
14099              * @constant
14100              */
14101             NONE : 1,
14102             /**
14103              * flow control Xon/Xoff.
14104              * @since 1.18.4
14105              * @constant
14106              */
14107             XON_XOFF : 2,
14108             /**
14109              * flow control hardware.
14110              * @since 1.18.4
14111              * @constant
14112              */
14113             HARDWARE : 3
14114         };
14115         /**
14116          * Returns the current RS232C configuration.<br>
14117          * This is worked only when the property "rs232c" is "1".<br>
14118          *     
14119          * @param {Object} param
14120          * <ul>
14121          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14122          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14123          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14124          *       // {Number} param.port - COM port such as 1 for COM1 and 13 for COM13.
14125          *       // {Number} param.baudRate - baud rate (hcap.rs232c.BaudRate)
14126          *       // {Number} param.dataBit - data bit (hcap.rs232c.DataBit)
14127          *       // {Number} param.parity - parity (hcap.rs232c.Parity)
14128          *       // {Number} param.stopBit - stop bit (hcap.rs232c.StopBit)
14129          *       // {Number} param.flowControl - flow control (hcap.rs232c.FlowControl)
14130          *       // {Number} param.rxTimeoutInMs - Rx data timeout in ms which could be set from 0 to 1000(ms) by 10(ms). Max buffer size for Rx data is 80 bytes. For the Rx data bigger than 80 bytes, 80 bytes will be delivered to HCAP application first regardless of the timeout and the rest of the data will be sent in the next timeout.
14131          *   }</pre>
14132          *   </li>
14133          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14134          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14135          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14136          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14137          *   }</pre>
14138          *   </li>
14139          * </ul>
14140          * 
14141          * @since 1.18.4
14142          * 
14143          * @see
14144          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.rs232c.setConfiguration()</a><br>
14145          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.sendData">hcap.rs232c.sendData()</a><br>
14146          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.setStartupData">hcap.rs232c.setStartupData()</a><br>
14147          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.clearStartupData">hcap.rs232c.clearStartupData()</a><br>
14148          * <a href="_global_.html#event:rs232c_data_received">{Event} rs232c_data_received</a><br>
14149          *
14150          * @example
14151          * hcap.rs232c.getConfiguration({
14152          *      "onSuccess" : function(p) {
14153          *          console.log("onSuccess : port = " + p.port + ", baud rate = " + p.baudRate + ", data bit = " + p.dataBit + ", parity = " + p.parity + ", stop bit = " + p.stopBit + ", flow control = " + p.flowControl + ", Rx timeout (ms) = " + p.rxTimeoutInMs);
14154          *      },
14155          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14156          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14157          *      }
14158          * });
14159          */
14160         hcap.rs232c.getConfiguration = function (param) {
14161             hcap_command("rs232c_get_configuration", param);
14162         };
14163         /**
14164          * Sets the RS232C configuration.<br>
14165          * This is worked only when the property "rs232c" is "1".<br>
14166          * Once RS232C is configured, it maintains its configuration unless the property "rs232c" is changed, TV is reset or other setting values are configured.<br>
14167          * If given setting value is not supported in the platform, it will be failed.<br>
14168          * Supported setting values are dependent on the platform or the model.<br>
14169          * To set rs232c configuration, we recommend to get the current configuration, modify it for values you want to change and set.<br>
14170          *     
14171          * @param {Object} param
14172          * <ul>
14173          *   <li>{Number} param.port [Required] - COM port such as 1 for COM1 and 13 for COM13.</li>
14174          *   <li>{Number} param.baudRate [Required] - baud rate (hcap.rs232c.BaudRate)</li>
14175          *   <li>{Number} param.dataBit [Required] - data bit (hcap.rs232c.DataBit)</li>
14176          *   <li>{Number} param.parity [Required] - parity (hcap.rs232c.Parity)</li>
14177          *   <li>{Number} param.stopBit [Required] - stop bit (hcap.rs232c.StopBit)</li>
14178          *   <li>{Number} param.flowControl [Required] - flow control (hcap.rs232c.FlowControl)</li>
14179          *   <li>{Number} param.rxTimeoutInMs [Required] - Rx data timeout in ms which could be set from 0 to 1000(ms) by 10(ms). Max buffer size for Rx data is 80 bytes. For the Rx data bigger than 80 bytes, 80 bytes will be delivered to HCAP application first regardless of the timeout and the rest of the data will be sent in the next timeout.</li>
14180          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14181          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14182          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14183          *       // No Parameter.
14184          *   }</pre>
14185          *   </li>
14186          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14187          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14188          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14189          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14190          *   }</pre>
14191          *   </li>
14192          * </ul>
14193          * 
14194          * @since 1.18.4
14195          * 
14196          * @see
14197          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.rs232c.getConfiguration()</a><br>
14198          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.sendData">hcap.rs232c.sendData()</a><br>
14199          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.setStartupData">hcap.rs232c.setStartupData()</a><br>
14200          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.clearStartupData">hcap.rs232c.clearStartupData()</a><br>
14201          * <a href="_global_.html#event:rs232c_data_received">{Event} rs232c_data_received</a><br>
14202          *
14203          * @example
14204          * hcap.rs232c.setConfiguration({
14205          *      "port" : 3,
14206          *      "baudRate" : hcap.rs232c.BaudRate.BR_115200,
14207          *      "dataBit" : hcap.rs232c.DataBit.BIT_7,
14208          *      "parity" : hcap.rs232c.Parity.NONE,
14209          *      "stopBit" : hcap.rs232c.StopBit.BIT_1,
14210          *      "flowControl" : hcap.rs232c.FlowControl.NONE,
14211          *      "rxTimeoutInMs" : 10,
14212          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14213          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14214          *      },
14215          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14216          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14217          *      }
14218          * });
14219          */
14220         hcap.rs232c.setConfiguration = function (param) {
14221             hcap_command("rs232c_set_configuration", param);
14222         };
14223         /**
14224          * Sends RS232C data.<br>
14225          * This is worked only when the property "rs232c" is "1".<br>
14226          *     
14227          * @param {Object} param
14228          * <ul>
14229          *   <li>{String} param.data - rs232c data string converted from binary data to ascii data such as ascii "3B1C42" for binary 0x3B1C42 with param.dataLength 3 (3 bytes) and ascii "00" for binary null data (0x00) with param.dataLength 1 (1 byte).</li>
14230          *   <li>{Number} param.dataLength - received rs232c data length in bytes. Max length of EU model is 255 (bytes) and US model is 32 (bytes).</li>
14231          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14232          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14233          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14234          *       // No Parameter.
14235          *   }</pre>
14236          *   </li>
14237          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14238          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14239          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14240          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14241          *   }</pre>
14242          *   </li>
14243          * </ul>
14244          * 
14245          * @since 1.18.4
14246          * 
14247          * @see
14248          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.rs232c.getConfiguration()</a><br>
14249          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.rs232c.setConfiguration()</a><br>
14250          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.setStartupData">hcap.rs232c.setStartupData()</a><br>
14251          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.clearStartupData">hcap.rs232c.clearStartupData()</a><br>
14252          * <a href="_global_.html#event:rs232c_data_received">{Event} rs232c_data_received</a><br>
14253          *
14254          * @example
14255          * hcap.rs232c.sendData({
14256          *      "data" : "3B1C42",
14257          *      "dataLength" : 3,
14258          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14259          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14260          *      },
14261          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14262          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14263          *      }
14264          * });
14265          */
14266         hcap.rs232c.sendData = function (param) {
14267             hcap_command("rs232c_send_data", param);
14268         };
14269         /**
14270          * Sets startup command which is fired to RS232C when TV is turned on. [since 1.24.0] EU model only.<br>
14271          * This is worked only when the property "rs232c" is "1".<br>
14272          *     
14273          * @param {Object} param
14274          * <ul>
14275          *   <li>{String} param.data - rs232c data string converted from binary data to ascii data such as ascii "3B1C42" for binary 0x3B1C42 with param.dataLength 3 (3 bytes) and ascii "00" for binary null data (0x00) with param.dataLength 1 (1 byte).</li>
14276          *   <li>{Number} param.dataLength - received rs232c data length in bytes. Max length of EU model is 255 (bytes) and US model is 32 (bytes).</li>
14277          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14278          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14279          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14280          *       // No Parameter.
14281          *   }</pre>
14282          *   </li>
14283          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14284          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14285          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14286          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14287          *   }</pre>
14288          *   </li>
14289          * </ul>
14290          * 
14291          * @since 1.18.4
14292          * 
14293          * @see
14294          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.rs232c.getConfiguration()</a><br>
14295          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.rs232c.setConfiguration()</a><br>
14296          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.sendData">hcap.rs232c.sendData()</a><br>
14297          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.clearStartupData">hcap.rs232c.clearStartupData()</a><br>
14298          * <a href="_global_.html#event:rs232c_data_received">{Event} rs232c_data_received</a><br>
14299          *
14300          * @example
14301          * hcap.rs232c.setStartupData({
14302          *      "data" : "3B1C42",
14303          *      "dataLength" : 3,
14304          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14305          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14306          *      },
14307          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14308          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14309          *      }
14310          * });
14311          */
14312         hcap.rs232c.setStartupData = function (param) {
14313             hcap_command("rs232c_set_teaching_data", param);
14314         };
14315         /**
14316          * Clears startup command which is fired to RS232C when TV is turned on. [since 1.24.0] EU model only.<br>
14317          * This is worked only when the property "rs232c" is "1".<br>
14318          *     
14319          * @param {Object} param
14320          * <ul>
14321          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14322          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14323          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14324          *       // No Parameter.
14325          *   }</pre>
14326          *   </li>
14327          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14328          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14329          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14330          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14331          *   }</pre>
14332          *   </li>
14333          * </ul>
14334          * 
14335          * @since 1.18.4
14336          * 
14337          * @see
14338          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.rs232c.getConfiguration()</a><br>
14339          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.rs232c.setConfiguration()</a><br>
14340          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.sendData">hcap.rs232c.sendData()</a><br>
14341          * <a href="hcap.rs232c.html#.setStartupData">hcap.rs232c.setStartupData()</a><br>
14342          * <a href="_global_.html#event:rs232c_data_received">{Event} rs232c_data_received</a><br>
14343          *
14344          * @example
14345          * hcap.rs232c.clearStartupData({
14346          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14347          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14348          *      },
14349          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14350          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14351          *      }
14352          * });
14353          */
14354         hcap.rs232c.clearStartupData = function (param) {
14355             hcap_command("rs232c_clear_teaching_data", param);
14356         };
14357         /** 
14358          * @namespace hcap.system
14359          */
14360         hcap.system = { };
14361         /**
14362          * Requests screen capture.<br>
14363          * 
14364          * @param {Object} param
14365          * <ul>
14366          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14367          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14368          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14369          *       // No Parameter.
14370          *   }</pre>
14371          *   </li>
14372          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14373          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14374          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14375          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14376          *   }</pre>
14377          *   </li>
14378          * </ul>
14379          *  
14380          * @since 1.23.0
14381          * 
14382          * @see
14383          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.getScreenCaptureImage">hcap.system.getScreenCaptureImage()</a><br>
14384          *
14385          * @example
14386          * hcap.system.requestScreenCaptureImage({
14387          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14388          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14389          *      }, 
14390          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14391          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14392          *      }
14393          * });
14394          */
14395         hcap.system.requestScreenCaptureImage = function (param) {
14396             hcap_command("request_screen_capture_image", param);
14397         };
14398         /**
14399          * Gets the screen capture image.<br>
14400          * 
14401          * @param {Object} param
14402          * <ul>
14403          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14404          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14405          *   param.onSuccess = function(param) {
14406          *       // {String} param.uri - URI for the screen capture image.
14407          *   }</pre>
14408          *   </li>
14409          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14410          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14411          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14412          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14413          *   }</pre>
14414          *   </li>
14415          * </ul>
14416          *  
14417          * @since 1.23.0
14418          * 
14419          * @see
14420          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.requestScreenCaptureImage">hcap.system.requestScreenCaptureImage()</a><br>
14421          *
14422          * @example
14423          * hcap.system.getScreenCaptureImage({
14424          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
14425          *          console.log("onSuccess : uri = " + s.uri);
14426          *      }, 
14427          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14428          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14429          *      }
14430          * });
14431          */
14432         hcap.system.getScreenCaptureImage = function (param) {
14433             hcap_command("get_screen_capture_image", param);
14434         };
14435         /**
14436          * Loads HCAP HTML application.<br>
14437          * When a HCAP HTML application has already been loaded, the HCAP HTML application is reloaded according to the "alternative_url" policy.<br>
14438          * That is, if the property "alternative_url" exists and it is not empty string, load "alternative_url". Otherwise, the application specified in XAIT.xml is loaded.<br>
14439          * 
14440          * @param {Object} param
14441          * <ul>
14442          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14443          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14444          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14445          *       // No Parameter.
14446          *   }</pre>
14447          *   </li>
14448          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14449          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14450          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14451          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14452          *   }</pre>
14453          *   </li>
14454          * </ul>
14455          *  
14456          * @since 1.19.0
14457          * 
14458          * @see
14459          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a>
14460          *
14461          * @example
14462          * hcap.system.launchHcapHtmlApplication({
14463          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14464          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14465          *      }, 
14466          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14467          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14468          *      }
14469          * });
14470          */
14471         hcap.system.launchHcapHtmlApplication = function (param) {
14472             hcap_command("launch_hcap_html_application", param);
14473         };
14474         /**
14475          * Gets the percentage of the used memory.<br>
14476          * 
14477          * @param {Object} param
14478          * <ul>
14479          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14480          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14481          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14482          *       // {Number} param.percentage - The percentage of used memory.
14483          *       // {Number} param.totalmemory - The size of total memory (MB).
14484          *       // {Number} param.freememory - The size of free memory (MB).
14485          *   }</pre>
14486          *   </li>
14487          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14488          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14489          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14490          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14491          *   }</pre>
14492          *   </li>
14493          * </ul>
14494          *  
14495          * @since 1.19.0
14496          * 
14497          * @see
14498          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.getCpuUsage">hcap.system.getCpuUsage()</a>
14499          *
14500          * @example
14501          * hcap.system.getMemoryUsage({
14502          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
14503          *          console.log("onSuccess : percentage of used memory = " + param.percentage + "free memory = " + param.freememory + "total memory = " + param.totalmemory  );
14504          *      }, 
14505          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14506          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14507          *      }
14508          * });
14509          */
14510         hcap.system.getMemoryUsage = function (param) {
14511             hcap_command("get_memory_usage", param);
14512         };
14513         /**
14514          * Gets the percentage of the used CPU resource.<br>
14515          * 
14516          * @param {Object} param
14517          * <ul>
14518          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14519          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14520          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14521          *       // {Number} param.percentage - percentage of used CPU resource.
14522          *   }</pre>
14523          *   </li>
14524          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14525          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14526          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14527          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14528          *   }</pre>
14529          *   </li>
14530          * </ul>
14531          *  
14532          * @since 1.19.0
14533          * 
14534          * @see
14535          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.getMemoryUsage">hcap.system.getMemoryUsage()</a>
14536          *
14537          * @example
14538          * hcap.system.getCpuUsage({
14539          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
14540          *          console.log("onSuccess : percentage of used CPU resource = " + param.percentage);
14541          *      }, 
14542          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14543          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14544          *      }
14545          * });
14546          */
14547         hcap.system.getCpuUsage = function (param) {
14548             hcap_command("get_cpu_usage", param);
14549         };
14550         /**
14551          * Requests to make HCAP application get focused.<br>
14552          * If this request is successful and the focus is changed from a Preloaded Application to HCAP Application,
14553          * HCAP Application will get the notification <a href="_global_.html#event:hcap_application_focus_changed">{Event} hcap_application_focus_changed</a><br><br>.
14554          * If HCAP Application gets focused already, there will be no notification regarding focus change.
14555          * This is worked only when the property "block_hotkey" is "1".
14556          * 
14557          * @param {Object} param
14558          * <ul>
14559          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function. 
14560          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14561          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14562          *       // No Parameter.
14563          *   }</pre>
14564          *   </li>
14565          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14566          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14567          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14568          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14569          *   }</pre>
14570          *   </li>
14571          * </ul>
14572          *  
14573          * @since 1.19.0
14574          *
14575          * @see
14576          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a><br>
14577          * 
14578          * @example
14579          * hcap.system.requestFocus({
14580          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14581          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14582          *      }, 
14583          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14584          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14585          *      }
14586          * });
14587          */
14588         hcap.system.requestFocus = function (param) {
14589             hcap_command("request_focus", param);
14590         };
14591         /**
14592          * Gets whether HCAP application gets focused or not.<br>
14593          * This is worked only when the property "block_hotkey" is "1".
14594          * 
14595          * @param {Object} param
14596          * <ul>
14597          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function. 
14598          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14599          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14600          *       // {Boolean} param.focused - true if the HCAP application gets focused, else false.
14601          *   }</pre>
14602          *   </li>
14603          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14604          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14605          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14606          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14607          *   }</pre>
14608          *   </li>
14609          * </ul>
14610          *  
14611          * @since 1.19.0
14612          *
14613          * @see
14614          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a><br>
14615          * 
14616          * @example
14617          * hcap.system.getFocused({
14618          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
14619          *          console.log("onSuccess : focused = " + param.focused);
14620          *      }, 
14621          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14622          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14623          *      }
14624          * });
14625          */
14626         hcap.system.getFocused = function (param) {
14627             hcap_command("get_focused", param);
14628         };
14629         /**
14630          * Requests XML cloning to TV.<br>
14631          * This acts exactly same as USB cloning.<br>
14632          * When the cloning is done, HCAP Application will get the notification <a href="_global_.html#event:cloning_done_received">{Event} cloning_done_received</a>.<br>
14633          * <strong>We strongly recommend reboot after xml cloning.</strong><br>
14634          * 
14635          * @param {Object} param
14636          * <ul>
14637          *   <li>{String} param.xml - XML string for cloning.</li>
14638          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14639          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14640          *   param.onSuccess = function() 
14641          *       // No Parameter.
14642          *   }</pre>
14643          *   </li>
14644          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14645          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14646          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14647          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14648          *   }</pre>
14649          *   </li>
14650          * </ul>
14651          * 
14652          * @since 1.19.0
14653          * 
14654          * @see
14655          * <a href="_global_.html#event:cloning_done_received">{Event} cloning_done_received</a><br>
14656          *
14657          * @example
14658          * hcap.system.requestCloning({
14659          *      "xml" : "<xml>....</xml>",
14660          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14661          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14662          *      },
14663          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14664          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14665          *      }
14666          * });
14667          */
14668         hcap.system.requestCloning = function (param) {
14669             hcap_command("request_cloning", param);
14670         };
14671         /**
14672          * Gets the supported locale item list with an item (specifier, language name, country name).<br>
14673          * Locale specifier is composed of {language code}-{country code} and it is worked as the identifier when setting system locale.<br>
14674          * 
14675          * @param {Object} param
14676          * <ul>
14677          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14678          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14679          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14680          *       // {Array} param.list - locale list supported by TV.
14681          *       //         {String} param.list[].specifier - locale specifier ({language code}-{country code} such as "en-GB" and "ko-KR")
14682          *       //         {String} param.list[].language - language name
14683          *       //         {String} param.list[].country - country name
14684          *       //                 param.list example - 
14685          *       //                     "list" :  [
14686          *       //                     { "specifier" : "en-GB", "language" : "English", "country" : "United Kingdom" },
14687          *       //                     { "specifier" : "ko-KR", "language" : "�뜝�럥�맶�뜝�럥�쑅占쎈뎨占쎈짗占쎌굲嶺뚮슡�뜉占쎌맶�뜝�럥吏쀥뜝�럩援꿨뜝�럩�쟼占쎈쐻�뜝占�", "country" : "�뜝�럥�맶�뜝�럥�쑅占쎈뎨占쎈짗占쎌굲嶺뚮슡�뜉占쎌맶占쎈쐻�뜝占�" },
14688          *       //                     ]
14689          *   }</pre>
14690          *   </li>
14691          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14692          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14693          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14694          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14695          *   }</pre>
14696          *   </li>
14697          * </ul>
14698          * 
14699          * @since 1.19.0
14700          * 
14701          * @see
14702          * <a href="_global_.html#event:locale_changed">{Event} locale_changed</a><br>
14703          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.getLocaleList">hcap.system.getLocaleList()</a><br>
14704          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.requestLocaleChange">hcap.system.requestLocaleChange()</a><br>
14705          *
14706          * @example
14707          * hcap.system.getLocaleList({
14708          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
14709          *          console.log("onSuccess : list length = " + s.list.length);
14710          *          for (var i = 0; i < s.list.length; i++) {
14711          *              console.log(
14712          *                  "list[" + i + "].specifier = " + s.list[i].specifier +
14713          *                  "list[" + i + "].language = " + s.list[i].language +
14714          *                  "list[" + i + "].country = " + s.list[i].country
14715          *              );
14716          *          }
14717          *      },
14718          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14719          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14720          *      }
14721          * });
14722          */
14723         hcap.system.getLocaleList = function (param) {
14724             hcap_command("get_locale_list", param);
14725         };
14726         /**
14727          * Gets the locale specifier of the current locale.<br>
14728          * 
14729          * @param {Object} param
14730          * <ul>
14731          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function. 
14732          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14733          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14734          *       // {String} param.specifier - locale specifier of the current locale.
14735          *       // {String} param.language - language name of the current locale.
14736          *       // {String} param.country - country name of the current locale.
14737          *   }</pre>
14738          *   </li>
14739          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14740          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14741          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14742          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14743          *   }</pre>
14744          *   </li>
14745          * </ul>
14746          *  
14747          * @since 1.19.0
14748          *
14749          * @see
14750          * <a href="_global_.html#event:locale_changed">{Event} locale_changed</a><br>
14751          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.getLocaleList">hcap.system.getLocaleList()</a><br>
14752          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.requestLocaleChange">hcap.system.requestLocaleChange()</a><br>
14753          * 
14754          * @example
14755          * hcap.system.getLocale({
14756          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
14757          *          console.log("onSuccess : specifier = " + param.specifier + ", language = " + param.language + ", country = " + param.country);
14758          *      }, 
14759          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14760          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14761          *      }
14762          * });
14763          */
14764         hcap.system.getLocale = function (param) {
14765             hcap_command("get_locale", param);
14766         };
14767         /**
14768          * Requests the system locale change to TV.<br>
14769          * It will return soon after the request is done.<br>
14770          * If the request is successful, the menu language will be changed and the locale change result will be notified through <a href="_global_.html#event:locale_changed">{Event} locale_changed</a>.<br>
14771          * 
14772          * @param {Object} param
14773          * <ul>
14774          *   <li>{String} param.specifier - locale specifier to set.</li>
14775          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14776          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14777          *   param.onSuccess = function()
