16466          *              "\n eddystone uuid          : " + s.eddyStoneUuid +
16467          *              "\n eddystone frame         : " + s.eddyStoneFrame +
16468          *              "\n eddystone url prefix    : " + s.eddyStoneUrlPrefix +
16469          *              "\n eddystone url ex code   : " + s.eddyStoneUrlExCode +
16470          *              "\n eddystone url           : " + s.eddyStoneUrl);
16471          *      }, 
16472          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
16473          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16474          *      }
16475          * });
16476          */
16477         hcap.beacon.getBeaconInformation = function (param) {
16478             hcap_command("get_beacon_information", param);
16479         };
16480         /**
16481          * Starts to scan beacon data.<br>
16482          * 
16483          * @param {Object} param
16484          * <ul>
16485          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16486          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16487          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16488          *       // No Parameter. 
16489          *   }</pre>
16490          *   </li>
16491          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16492          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16493          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
16494          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16495          *   }</pre>
16496          *   </li>
16497          * </ul>
16498          *  
16499          * @since 1.24.6
16500          * 
16501          * @see
16502          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.stopScan">hcap.beacon.stopScan()</a><br>
16503          * <a href="_global_.html#event:beacon_device_discovered">{Event} beacon_device_discovered</a><br>
16504          *
16505          * @example
16506          * hcap.beacon.startScan({
16507          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
16508          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16509          *      }, 
16510          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
16511          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16512          *      }
16513          * });
16514          */
16515         hcap.beacon.startScan = function (param) {
16516             hcap_command("beacon_start_scan", param);
16517         };
16518         /**
16519          * Stops beacon data scanning.<br>
16520          * 
16521          * @param {Object} param
16522          * <ul>
16523          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16524          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16525          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16526          *       // No Parameter. 
16527          *   }</pre>
16528          *   </li>
16529          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16530          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16531          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
16532          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16533          *   }</pre>
16534          *   </li>
16535          * </ul>
16536          *  
16537          * @since 1.24.6
16538          * 
16539          * @see
16540          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.startScan">hcap.beacon.startScan()</a><br>
16541          * <a href="_global_.html#event:beacon_device_discovered">{Event} beacon_device_discovered</a><br>
16542          *
16543          * @example
16544          * hcap.beacon.stopScan({
16545          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
16546          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16547          *      }, 
16548          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
16549          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16550          *      }
16551          * });
16552          */
16553         hcap.beacon.stopScan = function (param) {
16554             hcap_command("beacon_stop_scan", param);
16555         };
16556         /** 
16557          * @namespace hcap.bluetooth
16558          */
16559         hcap.bluetooth = { };
16560         /**
16561          * Sets the scan configuration such as visibility and connectability of the local device as a bluetooth device.<br>
16562          * We highly recommend not to change the connectability.<br>
16563          * 
16564          * @param {Object} param
16565          * <ul>
16566          *   <li>{Boolean} param.visible [Required] - true : visible to other bluetooth devices, false : invisible.</li>
16567          *   <li>{Boolean} param.connectable [Required] - true : connectable to other bluetooth devices, false : unconnectable.</li>
16568          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16569          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16570          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16571          *       // No Parameter. 
16572          *   }</pre>
16573          *   </li>
16574          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16575          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16576          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
16577          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16578          *   }</pre>
16579          *   </li>
16580          * </ul>
16581          *  
16582          * @since 1.19.0
16583          * 
16584          * @see
16585          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
16586          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.html#.disconnect">hcap.bluetooth.disconnect()</a><br>
16587          *
16588          * @example
16589          * hcap.bluetooth.setScanState({
16590          *      "visible" : true,
16591          *      "connectable" : true,
16592          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
16593          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16594          *      }, 
16595          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
16596          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16597          *      }
16598          * });
16599          */
16600         hcap.bluetooth.setScanState = function (param) {
16601             hcap_command("bt_gap_set_scan_state", param);
16602         };
16603         /**
16604          * Disconnects the device paired with the given bluetooth service profile.<br>
16605          * 
16606          * @param {Object} param
16607          * <ul>
16608          *   <li>{String} param.service [Required] - service profile ("hid" : HID profile / "audio" : audio src(A2DP) profile / "opc" : OPC profile / "audio_sink" : audio sink(A2DP) profile)
16609          *   <li>{String} param.address [Required] - BD (Bluetooth Device) address
16610          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16611          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16612          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16613          *       // No Parameter. 
16614          *   }</pre>
16615          *   </li>
16616          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16617          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16618          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
16619          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16620          *   }</pre>
16621          *   </li>
16622          * </ul>
16623          *  
16624          * @since 1.19.0
16625          * 
16626          * @see
16627          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
16628          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.html#.setScanState">hcap.bluetooth.setScanState()</a><br>
16629          *
16630          * @example
16631          * hcap.bluetooth.disconnect({
16632          *      "service" : "audio_sink",
16633          *      "address" : "00:1f:47:e2:04:3f",
16634          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
16635          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16636          *      }, 
16637          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
16638          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16639          *      }
16640          * });
16641          */
16642         hcap.bluetooth.disconnect = function (param) {
16643             hcap_command("bt_service_disconnect", param);
16644         };
16645         /**
16646          * Sets the bluetooth sound sync application is enabled or disabled.<br>
16647          * 
16648          * @param {Object} param
16649          * <ul>
16650          *   <li>{Boolean} param.enable [Required] - true : enable to bluetooth sound sync application, false : disable.</li>
16651          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16652          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16653          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16654          *       // No Parameter. 
16655          *   }</pre>
16656          *   </li>
16657          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16658          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16659          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
16660          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16661          *   }</pre>
16662          *   </li>
16663          * </ul>
16664          *  
16665          * @since 1.20.1
16666          * 
16667          * @see
16668          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.html#.getBluetoothSoundSync">hcap.bluetooth.getBluetoothSoundSync()</a><br>
16669          * <a href="_global_.html#event:ui_value_changed">{Event} ui_value_changed</a><br>
16670          *
16671          * @example
16672          * hcap.bluetooth.setBluetoothSoundSync({
16673          *      "enable" : true,
16674          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
16675          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16676          *      }, 
16677          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
16678          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16679          *      }
16680          * });
16681          */
16682         hcap.bluetooth.setBluetoothSoundSync = function (param) {
16683             hcap_command("set_bt_sound_sync", param);
16684         };
16685         /**
16686          * Gets whether bluetooth sound sync application is enabled or disabled.<br>
16687          * 
16688          * @param {Object} param
16689          * <ul>
16690          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16691          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16692          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
16693          *       // {Boolean} param.enable - true if the bluetooth sound sync application is enabled. false if the bluetooth sound sync application is disabled.
16694          *   }</pre>
16695          *   </li>
16696          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16697          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16698          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
16699          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16700          *   }</pre>
16701          *   </li>
16702          * </ul>
16703          *  
16704          * @since 1.20.1
16705          * 
16706          * @see
16707          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.html#.setBluetoothSoundSync">hcap.bluetooth.setBluetoothSoundSync()</a><br>
16708          *
16709          * @example
16710          * hcap.bluetooth.getBluetoothSoundSync({
16711          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
16712          *          console.log("onSuccess : bluetooth sound sync = " + param.enable);
16713          *      }, 
16714          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
16715          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16716          *      }
16717          * });
16718          */
16719         hcap.bluetooth.getBluetoothSoundSync = function (param) {
16720             hcap_command("get_bt_sound_sync", param);
16721         };
16722         /**
16723          * @namespace hcap.bluetooth.audio
16724          */
16725         hcap.bluetooth.audio = { };
16726         /**
16727          * Plays the bluetooth audio streaming.<br>
16728          * Precondition : Bluetooth audio device is connected.<br>
16729          * 
16730          * @param {Object} param
16731          * <ul>
16732          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16733          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16734          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16735          *       // No Parameter.
16736          *   }</pre>
16737          *   </li>
16738          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16739          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16740          *   param.onFailure = function(param) {
16741          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16742          *   }</pre>
16743          *   </li>
16744          * </ul>
16745          *  
16746          * @since 1.20.0
16747          * 
16748          * @see
16749          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
16750          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.stop">hcap.bluetooth.audio.stop()</a><br>
16751          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.pause">hcap.bluetooth.audio.pause()</a><br>
16752          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.forward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.forward()</a><br>
16753          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.backward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.backward()</a><br>
16754          *
16755          * @example
16756          * hcap.bluetooth.audio.play({
16757          *      "onSuccess":function() {
16758          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16759          *      }, 
16760          *      "onFailure":function(f) {
16761          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16762          *      }
16763          * });
16764          */
16765         hcap.bluetooth.audio.play = function (param) {
16766             hcap_command("bt_audio_play", param);
16767         };
16768         /**
16769          * Stops the bluetooth audio streaming.<br>
16770          * Precondition : Bluetooth audio device is connected.<br>
16771          * 
16772          * @param {Object} param
16773          * <ul>
16774          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16775          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16776          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16777          *       // No Parameter.
16778          *   }</pre>
16779          *   </li>
16780          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16781          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16782          *   param.onFailure = function(param) {
16783          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16784          *   }</pre>
16785          *   </li>
16786          * </ul>
16787          *  
16788          * @since 1.20.0
16789          * 
16790          * @see
16791          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
16792          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.play">hcap.bluetooth.audio.play()</a><br>
16793          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.pause">hcap.bluetooth.audio.pause()</a><br>
16794          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.forward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.forward()</a><br>
16795          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.backward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.backward()</a><br>
16796          *
16797          * @example
16798          * hcap.bluetooth.audio.stop({
16799          *      "onSuccess":function() {
16800          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16801          *      }, 
16802          *      "onFailure":function(f) {
16803          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16804          *      }
16805          * });
16806          */
16807         hcap.bluetooth.audio.stop = function (param) {
16808             hcap_command("bt_audio_stop", param);
16809         };
16810         /**
16811          * Pauses the bluetooth audio streaming.<br>
16812          * Precondition : Bluetooth audio device is connected.<br>
16813          * 
16814          * @param {Object} param
16815          * <ul>
16816          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16817          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16818          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16819          *       // No Parameter.
16820          *   }</pre>
16821          *   </li>
16822          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16823          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16824          *   param.onFailure = function(param) {
16825          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16826          *   }</pre>
16827          *   </li>
16828          * </ul>
16829          *  
16830          * @since 1.20.0
16831          * 
16832          * @see
16833          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
16834          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.play">hcap.bluetooth.audio.play()</a><br>
16835          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.stop">hcap.bluetooth.audio.stop()</a><br>
16836          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.forward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.forward()</a><br>
16837          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.backward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.backward()</a><br>
16838          *
16839          * @example
16840          * hcap.bluetooth.audio.pause({
16841          *      "onSuccess":function() {
16842          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16843          *      }, 
16844          *      "onFailure":function(f) {
16845          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16846          *      }
16847          * });
16848          */
16849         hcap.bluetooth.audio.pause = function (param) {
16850             hcap_command("bt_audio_pause", param);
16851         };
16852         /**
16853          * Plays the bluetooth audio streaming of the next track.<br>
16854          * Precondition : Bluetooth audio device is connected.<br>
16855          * 
16856          * @param {Object} param
16857          * <ul>
16858          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16859          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16860          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16861          *       // No Parameter.
16862          *   }</pre>
16863          *   </li>
16864          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16865          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16866          *   param.onFailure = function(param) {
16867          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16868          *   }</pre>
16869          *   </li>
16870          * </ul>
16871          *  
16872          * @since 1.20.0
16873          * 
16874          * @see
16875          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
16876          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.play">hcap.bluetooth.audio.play()</a><br>
16877          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.stop">hcap.bluetooth.audio.stop()</a><br>
16878          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.pause">hcap.bluetooth.audio.pause()</a><br>
16879          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.backward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.backward()</a><br>
16880          *
16881          * @example
16882          * hcap.bluetooth.audio.forward({
16883          *      "onSuccess":function() {
16884          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16885          *      }, 
16886          *      "onFailure":function(f) {
16887          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16888          *      }
16889          * });
16890          */
16891         hcap.bluetooth.audio.forward = function (param) {
16892             hcap_command("bt_audio_forward", param);
16893         };
16894         /**
16895          * Plays the bluetooth audio streaming of the previous track.<br>
16896          * Precondition : Bluetooth audio device is connected.<br>
16897          * 
16898          * @param {Object} param
16899          * <ul>
16900          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16901          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16902          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16903          *       // No Parameter.
16904          *   }</pre>
16905          *   </li>
16906          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16907          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16908          *   param.onFailure = function(param) {
16909          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16910          *   }</pre>
16911          *   </li>
16912          * </ul>
16913          *  
16914          * @since 1.20.0
16915          * 
16916          * @see
16917          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
16918          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.play">hcap.bluetooth.audio.play()</a><br>
16919          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.stop">hcap.bluetooth.audio.stop()</a><br>
16920          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.pause">hcap.bluetooth.audio.pause()</a><br>
16921          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.forward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.forward()</a><br>
16922          *
16923          * @example
16924          * hcap.bluetooth.audio.backward({
16925          *      "onSuccess":function() {
16926          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16927          *      }, 
16928          *      "onFailure":function(f) {
16929          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16930          *      }
16931          * });

16933         hcap.bluetooth.audio.backward = function (param) {

16935         };
16936         /**
16937          * @namespace hcap.bluetooth.central
16938          */
16939         hcap.bluetooth.central = { };
16940         /**
16941          * Start searching for nearby Bluetooth speakers.<br>
16942          * 
16943          * @param {Object} param
16944          * <ul>
16945          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16946          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16947          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16948          *       // No Parameter. 
16949          *   }</pre>
16950          *   </li>
16951          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16952          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16953          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
16954          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16955          *   }</pre>
16956          *   </li>
16957          * </ul>
16958          *  
16959          * @since 1.24.8
16960          * 
16961          * @see
16962          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
16963          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.cancelDiscover">hcap.bluetooth.central.cancelDiscover()</a><br>
16964          *
16965          * @example
16966          * hcap.bluetooth.central.startDiscover({
16967          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
16968          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16969          *      }, 
16970          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
16971          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16972          *      }
16973          * });
16974          */
16975         hcap.bluetooth.central.startDiscover = function (param) {
16976             hcap_command("bt_central_start_discover", param);
16977         };
16978                /**
16979          * Cancel searching for Bluetooth speaker devices.<br>
16980          * 
16981          * @param {Object} param
16982          * <ul>
16983          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16984          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16985          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16986          *       // No Parameter. 
16987          *   }</pre>
16988          *   </li>
16989          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16990          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16991          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
16992          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16993          *   }</pre>
16994          *   </li>
16995          * </ul>
16996          *  
16997          * @since 1.24.8
16998          * 
16999          * @see
17000          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.startDiscover">hcap.bluetooth.central.startDiscover()</a><br>
17001          *
17002          * @example
17003          * hcap.bluetooth.central.cancelDiscover({
17004          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17005          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17006          *      }, 
17007          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17008          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17009          *      }
17010          * });
17011          */
17012         hcap.bluetooth.central.cancelDiscover = function (param) {
17013             hcap_command("bt_central_cancel_discover", param);
17014         };
17015         /**
17016          * Connect the found Bluetooth speaker device.<br>
17017          * 
17018          * @param {Object} param
17019          * <ul>
17020          *   <li>{Number} param.address [Required] - The MAC address of any Bluetooth speaker device found that you want to connect to.</li>
17021          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17022          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17023          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17024          *       // No Parameter. 
17025          *   }</pre>
17026          *   </li>
17027          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17028          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17029          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17030          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17031          *   }</pre>
17032          *   </li>
17033          * </ul>
17034          *  
17035          * @since 1.24.8
17036          * 
17037          * @see
17038          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.startDiscover">hcap.bluetooth.central.startDiscover()</a><br>
17039          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.disconnect">hcap.bluetooth.central.disconnect()</a><br>
17040          *
17041          * @example
17042          * hcap.bluetooth.central.connect({
17043          *      "address" : "00:1f:47:e2:04:3f",
17044          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17045          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17046          *      }, 
17047          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17048          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17049          *      }
17050          * });
17051          */
17052         hcap.bluetooth.central.connect = function (param) {
17053             hcap_command("bt_central_connect", param);
17054         };
17055         /**
17056          * Disconnect the Bluetooth speaker device.<br>
17057          * 
17058          * @param {Object} param
17059          * <ul>
17060          *   <li>{Number} param.address [Required] - The MAC address of the device you want to disconnect from the Bluetooth connection.</li>
17061          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17062          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17063          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17064          *       // No Parameter. 
17065          *   }</pre>
17066          *   </li>
17067          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17068          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17069          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17070          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17071          *   }</pre>
17072          *   </li>
17073          * </ul>
17074          *  
17075          * @since 1.24.8
17076          * 
17077          * @see
17078          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.startDiscover">hcap.bluetooth.central.startDiscover()</a><br>
17079          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.connect">hcap.bluetooth.central.connect()</a><br>
17080          *
17081          * @example
17082          * hcap.bluetooth.central.disconnect({
17083          *      "address" : "00:1f:47:e2:04:3f",
17084          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17085          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17086          *      }, 
17087          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17088          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17089          *      }
17090          * });
17091          */
17092         hcap.bluetooth.central.disconnect = function (param) {
17093             hcap_command("bt_central_disconnect", param);
17094         };
17095         /**
17096          * Allow or deny connection on TV when it receives connection requests from external Bluetooth devices.<br>
17097          * When reason is "incoming" in the bluetooth event type of "bt_peripheral_device_connection_status", It is required to decide whether to connect the external device on the TV.<br> 
17098          * 
17099          * @param {Object} param
17100          * <ul>
17101          *   <li>{Number} param.connection [Required] - true: allow connection, false: deny connection.</li>
17102          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17103          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17104          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17105          *       // No Parameter. 
17106          *   }</pre>
17107          *   </li>
17108          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17109          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17110          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17111          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17112          *   }</pre>
17113          *   </li>
17114          * </ul>
17115          *  
17116          * @since 1.24.8
17117          * 
17118          * @see
17119          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
17120          *
17121          * @example
17122          * hcap.bluetooth.central.allowConnectionRequest({
17123          *      "connection" : true,
17124          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17125          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17126          *      }, 
17127          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17128          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17129          *      }
17130          * });
17131          */
17132         hcap.bluetooth.central.allowConnectionRequest = function (param) {
17133             hcap_command("bt_central_allow_connection_request", param);
17134         };
17135         /**
17136          * Return the list of paired devices.<br>
17137          * The list of devices obtained through this API can be connected immediately without discovering.<br>
17138          * @param {Object} param
17139          * <ul>
17140          *   <li>{Number} param.address [Required] - The MAC address of the device you want to disconnect from the Bluetooth connection.</li>
17141          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17142          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17143          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17144          *       // No Parameter. 
17145          *   }</pre>
17146          *   </li>
17147          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17148          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17149          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17150          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17151          *   }</pre>
17152          *   </li>
17153          * </ul>
17154          *  
17155          * @since 1.24.8
17156          * 
17157          * @see
17158          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.removeRegisteredDevice">hcap.bluetooth.central.removeRegisteredDevice()</a><br>
17159          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.removeAllRegisteredDevice">hcap.bluetooth.central.removeAllRegisteredDevice()</a><br>
17160          *
17161          * @example
17162          * hcap.bluetooth.central.getRegisteredDeviceList({
17163          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
17164          *          console.log("onSuccess : list length = " + s.list.length);
17165          *              for (var i = 0; i < s.list.length; i++) {
17166          *                  console.log(
17167          *                      "[" + i + "].deviceClass = " + s.list[i].deviceClass +
17168          *                      "[" + i + "].address = " + s.list[i].address +
17169          *                      "[" + i + "].state = " + s.list[i].state +
17170          *                      "[" + i + "].name = " + s.list[i].name +
17171          *                      "[" + i + "].type = " + s.list[i].type
17172          *                  );
17173          *              }
17174          *      }, 
17175          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17176          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17177          *      }
17178          * });
17179          */
17180         hcap.bluetooth.central.getRegisteredDeviceList = function (param) {
17181             hcap_command("bt_central_get_registered_device_list", param);
17182         };
17183         /**
17184          * This API deletes pairing history one by one.<br>
17185 		 * If you are already connected to the relative device, automatically disconnect it and delete its pairing history.<br>
17186          * 
17187          * @param {Object} param
17188          * <ul>
17189          *   <li>{Number} param.address [Required] - The MAC address of the device to delete paired history.</li>
17190          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17191          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17192          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17193          *       // No Parameter. 
17194          *   }</pre>
17195          *   </li>
17196          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17197          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17198          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17199          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17200          *   }</pre>
17201          *   </li>
17202          * </ul>
17203          *  
17204          * @since 1.24.8
17205          * 
17206          * @see
17207          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.getRegisteredDeviceList">hcap.bluetooth.central.getRegisteredDeviceList()</a><br>
17208          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.removeAllRegisteredDevice">hcap.bluetooth.central.removeAllRegisteredDevice()</a><br>
17209          *
17210          * @example
17211          * hcap.bluetooth.central.removeRegisteredDevice({
17212          *      "address" : "00:1f:47:e2:04:3f",
17213          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17214          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17215          *      }, 
17216          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17217          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17218          *      }
17219          * });
17220          */
17221         hcap.bluetooth.central.removeRegisteredDevice = function (param) {
17222             hcap_command("bt_central_remove_registered_device", param);
17223         };
17224         /**
17225          * Delete the entire pairing history.<br>
17226          * 
17227          * @param {Object} param
17228          * <ul>
17229          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17230          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17231          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17232          *       // No Parameter. 
17233          *   }</pre>
17234          *   </li>
17235          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17236          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17237          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17238          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17239          *   }</pre>
17240          *   </li>
17241          * </ul>
17242          *  
17243          * @since 1.24.8
17244          * 
17245          * @see
17246          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.getRegisteredDeviceList">hcap.bluetooth.central.getRegisteredDeviceList()</a><br>
17247          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.central.html#.removeRegisteredDevice">hcap.bluetooth.central.removeRegisteredDevice()</a><br>
17248          *
17249          * @example
