17251          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17252          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17253          *      }, 
17254          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17255          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17256          *      }
17257          * });
17258          */
17259 		hcap.bluetooth.central.removeAllRegisteredDevice = function (param) {
17260             hcap_command("bt_central_remove_all_registered_device", param);
17261         };
17262         /** 
17263          * @namespace hcap.webrtc
17264          */
17265         hcap.webrtc = { };
17266         /**
17267          * Plays the video stream from local video. This is for checking local video works well or not.<br>
17268          * 
17269          * @param {Object} param
17270          * <ul>
17271          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17272          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17273          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17274          *       // No Parameter.
17275          *   }</pre>
17276          *   </li>
17277          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17278          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17279          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17280          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17281          *   }</pre>
17282          *   </li>
17283          * </ul>
17284          *  
17285          * @deprecated since 1.24
17286          * 
17287          * @see 
17288          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
17289          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
17290          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17291          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
17292          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
17293          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
17294          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
17295          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
17296          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
17297          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
17298          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
17299          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
17300          *
17301          * @example
17302          * hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo({
17303          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17304          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17305          *      }, 
17306          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17307          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17308          *      }
17309          * });
17310          */
17311         hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo = function (param) {
17312             hcap_command("webrtc_start_preview_video", param);
17313         };
17314         /**
17315          * Stops playing local video.<br>
17316          * 
17317          * @param {Object} param
17318          * <ul>
17319          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17320          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17321          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17322          *       // No Parameter.
17323          *   }</pre>
17324          *   </li>
17325          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17326          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17327          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17328          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17329          *   }</pre>
17330          *   </li>
17331          * </ul>
17332          *  
17333          * @deprecated since 1.24
17334          * 
17335          * @see 
17336          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
17337          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
17338          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17339          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
17340          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
17341          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
17342          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
17343          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
17344          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
17345          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
17346          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
17347          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
17348          *
17349          * @example
17350          * hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo({
17351          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17352          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17353          *      }, 
17354          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17355          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17356          *      }
17357          * });
17358          */
17359         hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo = function (param) {
17360             hcap_command("webrtc_stop_preview_video", param);
17361         };
17362         /**
17363          * Receives an incoming call. This API should be included the information of peer's SDP(Session Description Protocol).<br>
17364          * 
17365          * @param {Object} param
17366          * <ul>
17367          *   <li>{Number} param.localId [Required] - local(my) ID 
17368          *   <li>{Number} param.remoteId [Required] - peer(who makes a call to me) ID 
17369          *   <li>{String} param.remoteSDP[Required] - peer SDP
17370          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17371          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17372          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17373          *       // No Parameter. 
17374          *   }</pre>
17375          *   </li>
17376          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17377          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17378          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17379          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17380          *   }</pre>
17381          *   </li>
17382          * </ul>
17383          *  
17384          * @deprecated since 1.24
17385          * 
17386          * @see 
17387          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
17388          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
17389          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17390          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17391          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
17392          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
17393          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
17394          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
17395          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
17396          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
17397          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
17398          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
17399          *
17400          * @example
17401          * hcap.webrtc.incomingCall({
17402          *      "localId" : 1,
17403          *      "remoteId" : 2,
17404          *      "remoteSDP" : "{"sdp" : "v=0\r\no=- 3454157150814283647 2 IN IP4 127.0.0.1\r\ns=-\r\nt=0 0\r\na=group:BUNDLE audio video\r\..."}",
17405          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17406          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17407          *      }, 
17408          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17409          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17410          *      }
17411          * });
17412          */
17413         hcap.webrtc.incomingCall = function (param) {
17414             hcap_command("webrtc_incoming_call", param);
17415         };
17416         /**
17417          * Makes an outgoing call. This API lead to create WebRTC object and local SDP. 
17418          * The local SDP will be passed to HCAP by an event <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a>.<br>
17419          * 
17420          * @param {Object} param
17421          * <ul>
17422          *   <li>{Number} param.localId [Required] - local(my) ID 
17423          *   <li>{Number} param.remoteId [Required] - peer(who I want to call) ID 
17424          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17425          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17426          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17427          *       // No Parameter. 
17428          *   }</pre>
17429          *   </li>
17430          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17431          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17432          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17433          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17434          *   }</pre>
17435          *   </li>
17436          * </ul>
17437          *  
17438          * @deprecated since 1.24
17439          * 
17440          * @see 
17441          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
17442          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
17443          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17444          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17445          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
17446          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
17447          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
17448          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
17449          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
17450          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
17451          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
17452          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
17453          *
17454          * @example
17455          * hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall({
17456          *      "localId" : 1,
17457          *      "remoteId" : 2,
17458          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17459          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17460          *      }, 
17461          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17462          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17463          *      }
17464          * });
17465          */
17466         hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall = function (param) {
17467             hcap_command("webrtc_outgoing_call", param);
17468         };
17469         /**
17470          * Ends a call.<br>
17471          * 
17472          * @param {Object} param
17473          * <ul>
17474          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17475          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17476          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17477          *       // No Parameter.
17478          *   }</pre>
17479          *   </li>
17480          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17481          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17482          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17483          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17484          *   }</pre>
17485          *   </li>
17486          * </ul>
17487          *  
17488          * @deprecated since 1.24
17489          * 
17490          * @see 
17491          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
17492          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
17493          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17494          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17495          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
17496          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
17497          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
17498          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
17499          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
17500          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
17501          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
17502          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
17503          *
17504          * @example
17505          * hcap.webrtc.endCall({
17506          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17507          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17508          *      }, 
17509          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17510          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17511          *      }
17512          * });
17513          */
17514         hcap.webrtc.endCall = function (param) {
17515             hcap_command("webrtc_end_call", param);
17516         };
17517         /**
17518          * Sends a message to webrtc service. Predefined types of message can be passed to webrtc service. 
17519          * <br>
17520          * 
17521          * @param {Object} param
17522          * <ul>
17523          *   <li>{Number} param.remoteId [Required] - peer ID 
17524          *   <li>{String} param.rtcMsg [Required] - message which be sent to webrtc service, such as SDP, ICE configuration, and so on. 
17525          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17526          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17527          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17528          *       // No Parameter. 
17529          *   }</pre>
17530          *   </li>
17531          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17532          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17533          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17534          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17535          *   }</pre>
17536          *   </li>
17537          * </ul>
17538          *  
17539          * @deprecated since 1.24
17540          * 
17541          * @see 
17542          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
17543          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
17544          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17545          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17546          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
17547          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
17548          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
17549          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
17550          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
17551          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
17552          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
17553          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
17554          *
17555          * @example
17556          * hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage({
17557          *      "remoteId" : 2,
17558          *      "rtcMsg" : "{"type":"answer","sdp":"v=0\r\no=- 4474142502554476113 2 IN IP4 127.0.0.1\r\ns=-\r\nt=0 0\r\na=group:BUNDLE audio video..."}",
17559          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17560          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17561          *      }, 
17562          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17563          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17564          *      }
17565          * });
17566          */
17567         hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage = function (param) {
17568             hcap_command("webrtc_accept_message", param);
17569         };
17570         /**
17571          * Checks local audio. This API can test the local sound by 2-step.<br>
17572          * step1: Set the param.type as a 'microphone' to test input works well or not. It record the sound only from microphone. 
17573          * step2: Set the param.type as a 'speaker' to test the output works well or not. It plays the recorded sound from 'microphone' test.
17574          * Each step will be done by <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a>. 
17575          *  
17576          * @param {Object} param
17577          * <ul>
17578          *   <li>{String} param.type [Required] - microphone | speaker
17579          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17580          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17581          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17582          *       // No Parameter.
17583          *   }</pre>
17584          *   </li>
17585          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17586          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17587          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17588          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17589          *   }</pre>
17590          *   </li>
17591          * </ul>
17592          *  
17593          * @deprecated since 1.24
17594          * 
17595          * @see 
17596          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
17597          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
17598          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17599          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17600          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
17601          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
17602          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
17603          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
17604          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
17605          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
17606          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
17607          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
17608          *
17609          * @example
17610          * hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio({
17611          *      "type" : "microphone",
17612          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17613          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17614          *      }, 
17615          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17616          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17617          *      }
17618          * });
17619          */
17620         hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio = function (param) {
17621             hcap_command("webrtc_start_check_audio", param);
17622         };
17623         /**
17624          * Stops <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a>.<br>
17625          * 
17626          * @param {Object} param
17627          * <ul>
17628          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17629          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17630          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17631          *       // No Parameter.
17632          *   }</pre>
17633          *   </li>
17634          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17635          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17636          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17637          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17638          *   }</pre>
17639          *   </li>
17640          * </ul>
17641          *  
17642          * @deprecated since 1.24
17643          * 
17644          * @see 
17645          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
17646          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
17647          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17648          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17649          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
17650          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
17651          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
17652          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
17653          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
17654          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
17655          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
17656          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
17657          *
17658          * @example
17659          * hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio({
17660          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17661          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17662          *      }, 
17663          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17664          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17665          *      }
17666          * });
17667          */
17668         hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio = function (param) {
17669             hcap_command("webrtc_stop_check_audio", param);
17670         };
17671         /**
17672          * Sets WebRTC configuration.<br>
17673          * 
17674          * @param {Object} param
17675          * <ul>
17676          *   <li>{String} param.key [Required] - configuration key to be set.
17677          *   <li>{String} param.value [Required] - configuration value to be set.<br>
17678          *   <div>
17679          *     <table class="hcap_spec">
17680          *       <thead>
17681          *         <tr>
17682          *           <th>Key</th>
17683          *           <th>Description</th>
17684          *           <th>Read/Write</th>
17685          *           <th>Value Format</th>
17686          *           <th>Value example (default value for the predefined value set)</th>
17687          *         </tr>
17688          *       </thead>
17689          *       <tbody>
17690          *       <tr class="odd">
17691          *         <td>ice_cfg</td>
17692          *         <td class="left">STUN/TURN server infomation</td>
17693          *         <td>Read/Write</td>
17694          *         <td class="left">[version string]<br>';' '|' ':'</td>
17695          *         <td>stun:stun.l.google.com:19302;turn:89.108.113.194:3478|webrtc|webrtc</td>
17696          *       </tr>
17697          *       <tr>
17698          *         <td>peer_server_name</td>
17699          *         <td class="left">IP address of peer connection server</td>
17700          *         <td>Read/Write</td>
17701          *         <td class="left">[version string]<br>ip address</td>
17702          *         <td>192.168.0.2</td>
17703          *       </tr>
17704          *       <tr class="odd">
17705          *         <td>peer_server_port</td>
17706          *         <td class="left">Port number of peer connection server</td>
17707          *         <td>Read/Write</td>
17708          *         <td class="left">[version string]<br>integer</td>
17709          *         <td>8888</td>
17710          *       </tr>
17711          *       <tr>
17712          *         <td>user_name</td>
17713          *         <td class="left">User name to log-in</td>
17714          *         <td>Read/Write</td>
17715          *         <td class="left">[version string]<br>free format string</td>
17716          *         <td>Andy</td>
17717          *       </tr>
17718          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17719          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17720          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17721          *       // No Parameter. 
17722          *   }</pre>
17723          *   </li>
17724          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17725          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17726          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17727          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17728          *   }</pre>
17729          *   </li>
17730          * </ul>
17731          *  
17732          * @deprecated since 1.24
17733          * 
17734          * @see 
17735          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
17736          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
17737          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17738          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17739          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
17740          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
17741          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
17742          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
17743          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
17744          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
17745          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
17746          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
17747          *
17748          * @example
17749          * hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration({
17750          *      "key" : "max_height",
17751          *      "value" : "480",
17752          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17753          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17754          *      }, 
17755          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17756          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17757          *      }
17758          * });
17759          */
17760         hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration = function (param) {
17761             hcap_command("webrtc_set_configuration", param);
17762         };
17763         /**
17764         * Gets WebRTC configurations. This return the list of configrations.<br>
17765         *
17766         * @param {Object} param
17767         * <ul>
17768         *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17769         *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17770         *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
17771         *       // {String} param.configurations - configurations string.
17772         *   }</pre>
17773         *   </li>
17774         *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
17775         *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17776         *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17777         *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17778         *   }</pre>
17779         *   </li>
17780         * </ul>
17781         *  
17782         * @deprecated since 1.24
17783         * 
17784         * @see 
17785         * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
17786         * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
17787         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17788         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17789         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
17790         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
17791         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
17792         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
17793         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
17794         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
17795         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
17796         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
17797         *
17798         * @example
17799         * hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration({
17800         *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
17801         *          console.log("onSuccess : configurations = " + s.configurations);
17802         *      }, 
17803         *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17804         *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17805         *      }
17806         * });
17807         */
17808         hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration = function (param) {
17809             hcap_command("webrtc_get_configuration", param);
17810         };
17811         /**
17812          * Shows diagnostics.<br>
17813          * 
17814          * @param {Object} param
17815          * <ul>
17816          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
17817          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17818          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
17819          *       // No Parameter.
17820          *   }</pre>
17821          *   </li>
17822          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
17823          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
17824          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
17825          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
17826          *   }</pre>
17827          *   </li>
17828          * </ul>
17829          *  
17830          * @deprecated since 1.24
17831          * 
17832          * @see 
17833          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
17834          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
17835          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17836          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
17837          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
17838          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
17839          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
17840          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
17841          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
17842          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
17843          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
17844          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
17845          *
17846          * @example
17847          * hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics({
17848          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
17849          *          console.log("onSuccess");
17850          *      }, 
17851          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
17852          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
17853          *      }
17854          * });
17855          */
17856         hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics = function (param) {
17857             hcap_command("webrtc_show_diagnostics", param);
17858         };
17859          /** 
17860          * @namespace hcap.security
17861          */
17862         hcap.security = { };
17863         /**
17864          * Registers a server certificate to validate the keys from the HCAP server as part of a PKI (Public Key Infrastructure).<br>
17865          * If you want to register a server certificate, the property "browser_https_security_level" should be replaced from "1" to "0".<br>
17866          * After registration, reboot is needed.<br>
17867          * Handling (Register/Unregister) server/client certificates must be done very carefully under the control of installer or hotelier because it is done in insecure environment.<br>
17868          * If a server certificate is registered, TV will validate the public key from the HCAP server when TV requests resources to the HCAP server in the modules like HCAP MW, Ez-i and HCAP browser in charge of downloads or loads of HCAP applications.<br>
17869          * The server certificate to register can be a self-signed certificate or a CA (Certificate Authority) certificate.<br>
17870          * Only 1 server certificate is permitted in TV. Therefore to register a server certificate when another server certificate was registered, revoke(unregister) the registered server certificate first, and register the new server certificate. Or the registration for the new server certificate will be failed.<br><br>
17871          * This feature was tested with following settings in Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and the apache server as the HTTPS HCAP server.<br>
17872          * Reference : <a href="http://theheat.dk/blog/?p=1023">Create a CA, issue server/client certificates and test them via Apache</a><br>
17873          * <pre style="background-color: lightgray">
17874 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate$ mkdir demoCA
17875 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate$ cd demoCA
17876 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ mkdir certs
17877 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ mkdir csr
17878 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ mkdir newcerts
17879 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ mkdir private
17880 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ cp ../openssl.cnf .
17881 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ echo 00 > serial
17882 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ echo 00 > crlnumber
17883 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ touch index.txt
17884 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ pwd
17885 /home/user/certificate/demoCA
17886 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ vi openssl.cnf
17887 
17888 >>> Change dir in CA_default
17889 [ CA_default ]
17890 
17891 dir             = ./demoCA         # Where everything is kept
17892 >>>>
17893 dir             = /home/user/certificate/demoCA         # Where everything is kept
17894 
17895 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl genrsa -des3 -passout pass:passcode -out  private/rootCA.key 2048
17896 Generating RSA private key, 2048 bit long modulus
17897 ...........................................................+++
17898 ......................................................+++
17899 e is 65537 (0x10001)
17900 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl rsa -passin pass:passcode -in private/rootCA.key -out private/rootCA.key
17901 writing RSA key
17902 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl req -config openssl.cnf -new -x509 -subj '/C=KR/L=LGE/O=CTO CA/CN=ROOT CA' -days 3650 -key private/rootCA.key -out certs/rootCA.crt
17903 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl genrsa -des3 -passout pass:passcode -out private/jkcloud.key 2048
17904 Generating RSA private key, 2048 bit long modulus
17905 ................+++
17906 .................................................+++
17907 e is 65537 (0x10001)
17908 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl rsa -passin pass:passcode -in private/jkcloud.key -out private/jkcloud.key
17909 writing RSA key
17910 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl req -config openssl.cnf -new -subj '/C=KR/L=LGE/O=CTO/CN=jkcloud.lge.com' -key private/jkcloud.key -out csr/jkcloud.csr
17911 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl ca -batch -config openssl.cnf -days 3650 -in csr/jkcloud.csr -out certs/jkcloud.crt -keyfile private/rootCA.key -cert certs/rootCA.crt -policy policy_anything
17912 Using configuration from openssl.cnf
17913 Check that the request matches the signature
17914 Signature ok
17915 Certificate Details:
17916         Serial Number: 0 (0x0)
17917         Validity
17918             Not Before: Mar 21 06:52:38 2016 GMT
17919             Not After : Mar 19 06:52:38 2026 GMT
17920         Subject:
17921             countryName               = KR
17922             localityName              = LGE
17923             organizationName          = CTO
17924             commonName                = jkcloud.lge.com
17925         X509v3 extensions:
17926             X509v3 Basic Constraints: 
17927                 CA:FALSE
17928             Netscape Comment: 
17929                 OpenSSL Generated Certificate
17930             X509v3 Subject Key Identifier: 
17931                 3F:87:5F:F8:76:65:12:96:AF:D6:4B:BC:AA:FA:1E:36:76:5F:8A:FE
17932             X509v3 Authority Key Identifier: 
17933                 keyid:85:20:EF:03:87:EA:73:32:10:5D:B2:3B:92:42:4F:3C:66:65:6A:E0
17934 
17935 Certificate is to be certified until Mar 19 06:52:38 2026 GMT (3650 days)
17936 
17937 Write out database with 1 new entries
17938 Data Base Updated
17939 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl genrsa -des3 -passout pass:passcode -out private/client_x86Emul.key 2048
17940 Generating RSA private key, 2048 bit long modulus
17941 ...................................................................................................................................................................................................................................+++
17942 ...................................................................................................................+++
17943 e is 65537 (0x10001)
17944 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl rsa -passin pass:passcode -in private/client_x86Emul.key -out private/client_x86Emul.key
17945 writing RSA key
17946 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl req -config openssl.cnf -new -subj '/C=KR/L=LGE/O=CTO/CN=x86Emul' -key private/client_x86Emul.key -out csr/client_x86Emul.csr
17947 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl ca -batch -config openssl.cnf -days 3650 -in csr/client_x86Emul.csr -out certs/client_x86Emul.crt -keyfile private/rootCA.key -cert certs/rootCA.crt -policy policy_anything
17948 Using configuration from openssl.cnf
17949 Check that the request matches the signature
17950 Signature ok
17951 Certificate Details:
17952         Serial Number: 1 (0x1)
17953         Validity
17954             Not Before: Mar 21 06:53:26 2016 GMT
17955             Not After : Mar 19 06:53:26 2026 GMT
17956         Subject:
17957             countryName               = KR
17958             localityName              = LGE
17959             organizationName          = CTO
17960             commonName                = x86Emul
17961         X509v3 extensions:
17962             X509v3 Basic Constraints: 
17963                 CA:FALSE
17964             Netscape Comment: 
17965                 OpenSSL Generated Certificate
17966             X509v3 Subject Key Identifier: 
17967                 EE:1A:6C:59:3B:13:FA:32:A7:61:60:2A:6C:56:66:82:AB:21:CD:05
17968             X509v3 Authority Key Identifier: 
17969                 keyid:85:20:EF:03:87:EA:73:32:10:5D:B2:3B:92:42:4F:3C:66:65:6A:E0
17970 
17971 Certificate is to be certified until Mar 19 06:53:26 2026 GMT (3650 days)
17972 
17973 Write out database with 1 new entries
17974 Data Base Updated
17975 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ find
17976 .
17977 ./serial.old
17978 ./newcerts
17979 ./newcerts/00.pem
17980 ./newcerts/01.pem
17981 ./serial
17982 ./index.txt.attr
17983 ./openssl.cnf
17984 ./certs
17985 ./certs/rootCA.crt
17986 ./certs/client_x86Emul.crt
17987 ./certs/jkcloud.crt
17988 ./crlnumber
17989 ./index.txt.attr.old
17990 ./csr
17991 ./csr/jkcloud.csr
17992 ./csr/client_x86Emul.csr
17993 ./private
17994 ./private/client_x86Emul.key
17995 ./private/jkcloud.key
17996 ./private/rootCA.key
17997 ./index.txt.old
17998 ./index.txt
17999 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$
18000 
18001 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ sudo vi /etc/apache2/sites-available/default-ssl
18002 [sudo] password for user: 
18003 >>> Change as following
18004         SSLEngine on # enable for server/client certificate
18005 
18006         SSLCertificateFile    /home/user/certificate/demoCA/certs/jkcloud.crt # for server certificate
18007         SSLCertificateKeyFile /home/user/certificate/demoCA/private/jkcloud.key # for server certificate
18008 
18009         SSLCACertificateFile /home/user/certificate/demoCA/certs/rootCA.crt # for client certificate
18010 
18011         SSLVerifyClient require # for client certificate
18012         SSLVerifyDepth  10 # for client certificate
18013 
18014 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ sudo a2enmod ssl
18015 Module ssl already enabled
18016 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ sudo a2ensite default-ssl
18017 Site default-ssl already enabled
18018 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ sudo service apache2 restart
18019  * Restarting web server apache2                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         ... waiting                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     [ OK ]
18020 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$
18021          * </pre><br>
18022          * In above example, register rootCA.crt to TV as the server certificate with <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerServerCertificate">hcap.security.registerServerCertificate()</a>.<br>
18023          * And in the server, register jkcloud.crt and jkcloud.key to SSLCertificateFile and SSLCertificateKeyFile respectively if the server is the apache server.<br> 
18024          * 
18025          * @param {Object} param
18026          * <ul>
18027          *   <li>{String} param.nickname [Required] - nickname for this server certificate as 4 to 10-character string chosen from the set [a-zA-Z0-9].<br>
18028          *   <li>{String} param.certificate [Required] - certificate string of the full contents in the server certificate file (public root CA of the server certificate file) in the form of PEM (rootCA.crt in above example).<br>
18029          *   <li>{Boolean} param.enableVerifyHost [Required] - true for verifying the server to connect to has the same hostname in the certificate (if the verification is failed, the connection will be failed), otherwise false.<br>
18030          *   <li>{Boolean} param.isSelfSigned [Required] - true if the server certificate is self-signed, otherwise false.<br>
18031          *   <li>{String} param.accessCode [Required] - password as 4 to 10-character string chosen from the set [a-zA-Z0-9] to get whether this certificate is registered or not, or revoke this certificate in the future.<br>
18032          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
18033          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18034          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
18035          *       // No Parameter. 
18036          *   }</pre>
18037          *   </li>
18038          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
18039          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18040          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
18041          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
18042          *   }</pre>
18043          *   </li>
18044          * </ul>
18045          *  
18046          * @since 1.20.0
18047          * 
18048          * @see 
18049          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerClientCertificate">hcap.security.registerClientCertificate()</a><br>
18050          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterServerCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterServerCertificate()</a><br>
18051          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterClientCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterClientCertificate()</a><br>
18052          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existServerCertificate">hcap.security.existServerCertificate()</a><br>
18053          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existClientCertificate">hcap.security.existClientCertificate()</a><br>
18054          *
18055          * @example
18056          * hcap.security.registerServerCertificate({
18057          *      "nickname" : "testserver",
18058          *      "certificate" : "\
18059          *-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n\
18060          *MIIDXzCCAkegAwIBAgIJALispfP+z4ZZMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAMEYxCzAJBgNV\n\
18061          *BAYTAktSMQwwCgYDVQQHDANMR0UxDzANBgNVBAoMBkNUTyBDQTEYMBYGA1UEAwwP\n\
18062          *amtjbG91ZC5sZ2UuY29tMB4XDTE2MDMxNzAzMDUzMFoXDTI2MDMxNTAzMDUzMFow\n\
18063          *RjELMAkGA1UEBhMCS1IxDDAKBgNVBAcMA0xHRTEPMA0GA1UECgwGQ1RPIENBMRgw\n\
18064          *FgYDVQQDDA9qa2Nsb3VkLmxnZS5jb20wggEiMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBAQUAA4IBDwAw\n\
18065          *ggEKAoIBAQCwdor7TwwIIuTI8HvOBx//cBlu+xE1L/9ZAWaIRivK/O/1Bv+jTxpx\n\
18066          *5RN9RttmJle9QS8Tx6/Wf40REt9Lnc1fUCdVILSkTrcHY4Wcc5cqvt0Uz17kcaTJ\n\
18067          *Q6Ch2wiyq2ZSj2vTQAhQfV0cpvwJTYKwXCSeL8M10KZqeU/41PITp/67MzCZF+BT\n\
18068          *gTm60UTfrc/Owe8q2yn3di7wKiuEwP5WROGa/HkOrWJfkx0DjAlO79tZoUmyd4RH\n\
18069          *C6R3ST8lbCMtttDd8JGHlCSVRf9NIQc71M88vgYY7Dh9POfCfhxkVA9/ws5h7aHt\n\
18070          *t0vAqmRN6vgFhBPhmTUp+eoUl+3nf0aVAgMBAAGjUDBOMB0GA1UdDgQWBBQkXPyq\n\
18071          *koD+LlrJgYRvkiqg5KDJJTAfBgNVHSMEGDAWgBQkXPyqkoD+LlrJgYRvkiqg5KDJ\n\
18072          *JTAMBgNVHRMEBTADAQH/MA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAA4IBAQCcK/JXi0aaQ1RiToTK\n\
18073          *stYpMZjTtmiDqgpdHkhsU0H2EwVW46j4xaALzLoSWx4neREJS1KPJ4Wh6PT9554S\n\
18074          *wI/9yIjiqJlsHmU3h3FxjO5NRO9Qu+o9MeLAGAJs9M49NS0TiJYo1V7beyI5ju99\n\
18075          *xs887ac5F/Axg3Pb4sX1Wo5xTB2Bw+bKMHj0Rk+9uDrGqsrPpX39R8CL0W/1ISU5\n\
18076          *ioOvHBHeyw2PzqO4KbIXrvj0dihDBWc/SltS/4htXs4JL76rA7+Byj9AUVxrm2QK\n\
18077          *gmsignOklllYUkLdIjLPyJy8tDUFTcR4oElWN+mGME4zl0x8mCaTaPf8niBw9hfI\n\
18078          *Cymj\n\
18079          *-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n",
18080          *      "enableVerifyHost" : true,
18081          *      "isSelfSigned" : true,
18082          *      "accessCode" : "passCode1",
18083          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
18084          *          console.log("onSuccess");
18085          *      }, 
18086          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
18087          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
18088          *      }
18089          * });
18090          */
18091         hcap.security.registerServerCertificate = function (param) {
18092             hcap_command("register_server_certificate", param);
18093         };
18094         /**
18095          * Registers a client certificate and its private key for TLS and SSL client authentication.<br>
18096          * After registration, reboot is needed.<br>
18097          * If a client certificate is registered, TV will try to authenticate to the HCAP server with the client certificate in the modules like HCAP middleware, Ez-i and HCAP browser in charge of downloads or loads of HCAP applications.<br>
18098          * The client certificate to register can be a self-signed certificate or a trusted CA (Certificate Authority) certificate.<br>
18099          * Only 1 client certificate is permitted in TV. Therefore to register a client certificate when another client certificate was registered, revoke(unregister) the registered client certificate first, and register the new client certificate. Or the registration for the new client certificate will be failed.<br>
18100          * Please refer to the example code to create server/client self-signed certificates in <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerServerCertificate">hcap.security.registerServerCertificate()</a>
18101          * And register client_x86Emul.crt, client_x86Emul.key and rootCA.crt to TV as the client certificate, the client private key and the CA certificate repectively in the example code and its server environment.<br>
18102          * urlPattern and issuerCN are needed to match the HCAP app url and its client certificate automatically in HCAP browser.<br>
18103          * 
18104          * @param {Object} param
18105          * <ul>
18106          *   <li>{String} param.nickname [Required] - nickname for this client certificate as 4 to 10-character string chosen from the set [a-zA-Z0-9].<br>
18107          *   <li>{String} param.certificate [Required] - certificate string of the full contents in the client certificate file in the form of PEM (client_x86Emul.crt in above example).<br>
18108          *   <li>{String} param.key [Required] - certificate string of the full contents in the client private key file in the form of PEM (client_x86Emul.key in above example).<br>
18109          *   <li>{String} param.keyPassword [Required] - password string of the client private key ("passcode" in above example).<br>
18110          *   <li>{String} param.cacert [Required] - certificate string of the full contents in the CA certificate file of the client certificate in the form of PEM (rootCA.crt in above example).<br>
18111          *   <li>{String} param.urlPattern [Required] - url pattern string to specify sites for which HCAP browser automatically selects a client certificate if the site requests a certificate (ex. "https://jkcloud.lge.com").<br>
18112          *   <li>{String} param.issuerCN [Required] - CommonName string of the issuer of the client certificate ("ROOT CA" in above example).<br>
18113          *   <li>{Boolean} param.isSelfSigned [Required] - true if the client certificate is self-signed, otherwise false.<br>
18114          *   <li>{String} param.accessCode [Required] - password as 4 to 10-character string chosen from the set [a-zA-Z0-9] to get whether this certificate is registered or not, or revoke this certificate in the future.<br>
18115          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
18116          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18117          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
18118          *       // No Parameter. 
18119          *   }</pre>
18120          *   </li>
18121          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
18122          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18123          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
18124          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
18125          *   }</pre>
18126          *   </li>
18127          * </ul>
18128          *  
18129          * @since 1.20.0
18130          * 
18131          * @see 
18132          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerServerCertificate">hcap.security.registerServerCertificate()</a><br>
18133          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterServerCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterServerCertificate()</a><br>
18134          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterClientCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterClientCertificate()</a><br>
18135          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existServerCertificate">hcap.security.existServerCertificate()</a><br>
18136          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existClientCertificate">hcap.security.existClientCertificate()</a><br>
18137          *
18138          * @example
18139          * hcap.security.registerClientCertificate({
18140          *      "nickname" : "testclient",
18141          *      "certificate" : "\
18142          *Certificate:\n\
18143          *    Data:\n\
18144          *        Version: 3 (0x2)\n\
18145          *        Serial Number: 1 (0x1)\n\
18146          *    Signature Algorithm: sha1WithRSAEncryption\n\
18147          *        Issuer: C=KR, L=LGE, O=CTO CA, CN=ROOT CA\n\
18148          *        Validity\n\
18149          *            Not Before: Mar 21 06:53:26 2016 GMT\n\
18150          *            Not After : Mar 19 06:53:26 2026 GMT\n\
18151          *        Subject: C=KR, L=LGE, O=CTO, CN=x86Emul\n\
18152          *        Subject Public Key Info:\n\
18153          *            Public Key Algorithm: rsaEncryption\n\
18154          *                Public-Key: (2048 bit)\n\
18155          *                Modulus:\n\
18156          *                    00:a2:e3:4d:39:47:6f:9c:bb:7e:fb:90:43:8a:29:\n\
18157          *                    7f:3a:b2:4e:32:83:bd:1f:16:c1:0b:d2:cd:e7:22:\n\
18158          *                    33:f3:19:41:ea:db:ec:0a:3d:e9:4c:00:8c:e2:8d:\n\
18159          *                    57:d8:b0:12:af:50:66:df:6f:f5:65:d8:91:c0:a8:\n\
18160          *                    f6:87:b7:fa:ed:7c:32:bf:25:d3:18:a3:bc:3b:f8:\n\
18161          *                    0c:d5:bc:03:99:7d:c6:fd:72:d6:19:c7:3f:4c:7b:\n\
18162          *                    8f:1a:d8:c3:b6:15:01:82:99:a8:2d:b0:79:36:86:\n\
18163          *                    2a:cb:dc:43:a5:30:ab:fd:31:70:76:e4:01:67:73:\n\
18164          *                    d9:bd:7a:20:d9:49:f4:11:61:de:b9:6b:80:d5:83:\n\
18165          *                    5f:1b:e0:34:fa:af:3c:b9:26:84:1b:ca:16:a5:02:\n\
18166          *                    be:f9:fa:bc:19:f1:84:a9:13:7b:32:04:68:ba:c3:\n\
18167          *                    66:69:8a:b8:84:19:bf:15:72:df:37:68:83:cb:e5:\n\
18168          *                    4b:e2:59:8c:4e:e0:42:3b:ea:a6:39:85:1e:ae:41:\n\
18169          *                    c4:a6:17:06:a2:02:d6:c4:cb:53:0d:f7:2e:e7:28:\n\
18170          *                    20:35:a7:3e:02:9c:38:68:1c:d6:18:c0:39:24:1d:\n\
18171          *                    f2:96:c5:81:f1:c2:de:22:e0:d4:f0:02:72:9c:e8:\n\
18172          *                    c1:d0:28:46:60:1e:6d:52:78:f4:48:94:80:9b:01:\n\
18173          *                    dc:eb\n\
18174          *                Exponent: 65537 (0x10001)\n\
18175          *        X509v3 extensions:\n\
18176          *            X509v3 Basic Constraints: \n\
18177          *                CA:FALSE\n\
18178          *            Netscape Comment: \n\
18179          *                OpenSSL Generated Certificate\n\
18180          *            X509v3 Subject Key Identifier: \n\
18181          *                EE:1A:6C:59:3B:13:FA:32:A7:61:60:2A:6C:56:66:82:AB:21:CD:05\n\
18182          *            X509v3 Authority Key Identifier: \n\
18183          *                keyid:85:20:EF:03:87:EA:73:32:10:5D:B2:3B:92:42:4F:3C:66:65:6A:E0\n\
18184          *\n\
18185          *    Signature Algorithm: sha1WithRSAEncryption\n\
18186          *         92:a7:bd:83:65:de:c9:bd:cb:57:c0:46:c0:16:e7:7e:0a:e6:\n\
18187          *         67:96:ab:45:38:91:2a:6e:b8:5c:07:8a:58:0d:56:0b:79:e6:\n\
18188          *         00:c4:0e:ce:86:ae:07:cb:69:bf:24:d9:69:fe:59:b6:31:b9:\n\
18189          *         82:79:75:1a:64:41:45:2d:d9:83:c2:5b:f9:5c:80:1b:ea:1a:\n\
18190          *         14:c7:5e:9e:f9:1e:7e:1c:fc:a3:55:1b:9a:df:cd:38:f7:e9:\n\
18191          *         24:ac:ce:b0:91:93:a6:a8:45:99:c3:77:c8:e4:86:4c:8a:11:\n\
18192          *         35:27:40:f4:71:d6:84:db:7b:26:a7:d3:6c:9d:e5:d0:d7:c2:\n\
18193          *         96:dd:80:0f:99:24:0f:40:b1:65:d0:7f:87:4d:d3:36:b1:da:\n\
18194          *         a7:45:08:5a:2f:59:d9:84:11:a9:c4:77:fe:54:36:5f:47:d1:\n\
18195          *         3c:86:32:92:6d:04:77:61:51:4b:bf:17:88:0d:b0:26:41:12:\n\
18196          *         11:4f:cd:1f:50:b1:38:0d:7b:7c:3c:de:52:97:e3:e3:12:57:\n\
18197          *         6b:2a:7b:4d:ed:11:be:cd:7e:b8:e9:18:eb:78:b3:03:1f:87:\n\

18268          *xs887ac5F/Axg3Pb4sX1Wo5xTB2Bw+bKMHj0Rk+9uDrGqsrPpX39R8CL0W/1ISU5\n\
18269          *ioOvHBHeyw2PzqO4KbIXrvj0dihDBWc/SltS/4htXs4JL76rA7+Byj9AUVxrm2QK\n\
18270          *gmsignOklllYUkLdIjLPyJy8tDUFTcR4oElWN+mGME4zl0x8mCaTaPf8niBw9hfI\n\
18271          *Cymj\n\
18272          *-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n",
18273          *      "urlPattern" : "https://jkcloud.lge.com",
18274          *      "issuerCN" : "ROOT CA",
18275          *      "isSelfSigned" : true,
18276          *      "accessCode" : "passCode1",
18277          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
18278          *          console.log("onSuccess");
18279          *      }, 
18280          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
18281          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
18282          *      }
18283          * });
18284          */
18285         hcap.security.registerClientCertificate = function (param) {
18286             hcap_command("register_client_certificate", param);
18287         };
18288         /**
18289          * Unregisters a server certificate and deactivate the TLS authentication and the host verification.<br>
18290          * 
18291          * @param {Object} param
18292          * <ul>
18293          *   <li>{String} param.nickname [Required] - nickname for the server certificate to unregister.<br>
18294          *   <li>{String} param.accessCode [Required] - password to be used for the registration of the server certificate before.<br>
18295          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
18296          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18297          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
18298          *       // No Parameter. 
18299          *   }</pre>
18300          *   </li>
18301          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
18302          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18303          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
18304          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
18305          *   }</pre>
18306          *   </li>
18307          * </ul>
18308          *  
18309          * @since 1.20.0
18310          * 
18311          * @see 
18312          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerServerCertificate">hcap.security.registerServerCertificate()</a><br>
18313          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerClientCertificate">hcap.security.registerClientCertificate()</a><br>
18314          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterClientCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterClientCertificate()</a><br>
18315          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existServerCertificate">hcap.security.existServerCertificate()</a><br>
18316          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existClientCertificate">hcap.security.existClientCertificate()</a><br>
18317          *
18318          * @example
18319          * hcap.security.unregisterServerCertificate({
18320          *      "nickname" : "testserver",
18321          *      "accessCode" : "passCode1",
18322          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
18323          *          console.log("onSuccess");
18324          *      }, 
18325          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
18326          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
18327          *      }
18328          * });
18329          */
18330         hcap.security.unregisterServerCertificate = function (param) {
18331             hcap_command("unregister_server_certificate", param);
18332         };
18333         /**
18334          * Unregisters a client certificate and its private key, and deactivate the TLS authentication.<br>
18335          * 
18336          * @param {Object} param
18337          * <ul>
18338          *   <li>{String} param.nickname [Required] - nickname for the client certificate to unregister.<br>
18339          *   <li>{String} param.accessCode [Required] - password to be used for the registration of the client certificate before.<br>
18340          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
18341          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18342          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
18343          *       // No Parameter. 
18344          *   }</pre>
18345          *   </li>
18346          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
18347          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18348          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
18349          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
18350          *   }</pre>
18351          *   </li>
18352          * </ul>
18353          *  
18354          * @since 1.20.0
18355          * 
18356          * @see 
18357          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerServerCertificate">hcap.security.registerServerCertificate()</a><br>
18358          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerClientCertificate">hcap.security.registerClientCertificate()</a><br>
18359          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterServerCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterServerCertificate()</a><br>
18360          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existServerCertificate">hcap.security.existServerCertificate()</a><br>
18361          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existClientCertificate">hcap.security.existClientCertificate()</a><br>
18362          *
18363          * @example
18364          * hcap.security.unregisterClientCertificate({
18365          *      "nickname" : "testclient",
18366          *      "accessCode" : "passCode1",
18367          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
18368          *          console.log("onSuccess");
18369          *      }, 
18370          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
18371          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
18372          *      }
18373          * });
18374          */
18375         hcap.security.unregisterClientCertificate = function (param) {
18376             hcap_command("unregister_client_certificate", param);
18377         };
18378         /**
18379          * Returns whether a server certificate was registered or not.<br>
18380          * 
18381          * @param {Object} param
18382          * <ul>
18383          *   <li>{String} param.nickname [Required] - nickname for the server certificate.<br>
18384          *   <li>{String} param.accessCode [Required] - password to be used for the registration of the server certificate before.<br>
18385          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
18386          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18387          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) { 
18388          *       // {String} param.nickname - nickname for the server certificate.
18389          *       // {Boolean} param.exist - true if the server certificate was registered.
18390          *   }</pre>
18391          *   </li>
18392          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
18393          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18394          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
18395          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
18396          *   }</pre>
18397          *   </li>
18398          * </ul>
18399          *  
18400          * @since 1.20.0
18401          * 
18402          * @see 
18403          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerServerCertificate">hcap.security.registerServerCertificate()</a><br>
18404          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerClientCertificate">hcap.security.registerClientCertificate()</a><br>
18405          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterServerCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterServerCertificate()</a><br>
18406          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterClientCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterClientCertificate()</a><br>
18407          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existClientCertificate">hcap.security.existClientCertificate()</a><br>
18408          *
18409          * @example
18410          * hcap.security.existServerCertificate({
18411          *      "nickname" : "testserver",
18412          *      "accessCode" : "passCode1",
18413          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
18414          *          console.log("onSuccess");
18415          *      }, 
18416          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
18417          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
18418          *      }
18419          * });
18420          */
18421         hcap.security.existServerCertificate = function (param) {
18422             hcap_command("exist_server_certificate", param);
18423         };
18424         /**
18425          * Returns whether a client certificate was registered or not.<br>
18426          * 
18427          * @param {Object} param
18428          * <ul>
18429          *   <li>{String} param.nickname [Required] - nickname for the client certificate.<br>
18430          *   <li>{String} param.accessCode [Required] - password to be used for the registration of the client certificate before.<br>
18431          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
18432          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18433          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) { 
18434          *       // {String} param.nickname - nickname for the client certificate.
18435          *       // {Boolean} param.exist - true if the client certificate was registered.
18436          *   }</pre>
18437          *   </li>
18438          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
18439          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18440          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
18441          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
18442          *   }</pre>
18443          *   </li>
18444          * </ul>
18445          *  
18446          * @since 1.20.0
18447          * 
18448          * @see 
18449          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerServerCertificate">hcap.security.registerServerCertificate()</a><br>
18450          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerClientCertificate">hcap.security.registerClientCertificate()</a><br>
18451          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterServerCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterServerCertificate()</a><br>
18452          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterClientCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterClientCertificate()</a><br>
18453          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existServerCertificate">hcap.security.existServerCertificate()</a><br>
18454          *
18455          * @example
18456          * hcap.security.existClientCertificate({
18457          *      "nickname" : "testclient",
18458          *      "accessCode" : "passCode1",
18459          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
18460          *          console.log("onSuccess");
18461          *      }, 
18462          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
18463          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
18464          *      }
18465          * });
18466          */
18467         hcap.security.existClientCertificate = function (param) {
18468             hcap_command("exist_client_certificate", param);
18469         };
18470         /** 
18471          * @namespace hcap.iot
18472          */
18473         hcap.iot = { };
18474         /**
18475          * Requests to set the bridge status.<br>
18476          * If the bridge status is changed, <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_bridge_status_changed">{Event} iot_bridge_status_changed</a> will be delivered.<br>
18477          * In "scan" mode, a bridge can terminate the "scan" mode and change to "normal" mode by the timeout (the timeout is different binding by binding).<br>   
18478          * 
18479          * @param {Object} param
18480          * <ul>
18481          *   <li>{String} param.bridgeUid [Required] - bridge UID.<br>
18482          *   <li>{String} param.status [Required] - "scan" for scan status, "normal" for normal (non-scan) status.<br>
18483          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function. Request for the same status returns <i>onSuccess</i> and it has no effect.
18484          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18485          *   param.onSuccess = function () {
18486          *       // No Parameter. 
18487          *   }</pre>
18488          *   </li>
18489          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
18490          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18491          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
18492          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
18493          *   }</pre>
18494          *   </li>
18495          * </ul>
18496          *  
18497          * @since 1.22.2
18498          *
18499          * @see
18500          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_binding_ready">{Event} iot_binding_ready</a><br>
18501          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_thing_discovered">{Event} iot_thing_discovered</a><br>
18502          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_bridge_status_changed">{Event} iot_bridge_status_changed</a><br>
18503          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_thing_registered">{Event} iot_thing_registered</a><br>
18504          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_thing_rejected">{Event} iot_thing_rejected</a><br>
18505          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_component_reported">{Event} iot_component_reported</a><br>
18506          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_thing_unregistered">{Event} iot_thing_unregistered</a><br>
18507          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_thing_meta_data_changed">{Event} iot_thing_meta_data_changed</a><br>
18508          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_set_component_result_received">{Event} iot_set_component_result_received</a><br>
18509          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_factory_reset_result_received">{Event} iot_factory_reset_result_received</a><br>
18510          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.getBridgeStatus">hcap.iot.getBridgeStatus()</a><br>
18511          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestRegisterThing">hcap.iot.requestRegisterThing()</a><br>
18512          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestRejectThing">hcap.iot.requestRejectThing()</a><br>
18513          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.getThingList">hcap.iot.getThingList()</a><br>
18514          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.getBindingIdList">hcap.iot.getBindingIdList()</a><br>
18515          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestSetComponent">hcap.iot.requestSetComponent()</a><br>
18516          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestUnregisterThing">hcap.iot.requestUnregisterThing()</a><br>
18517          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.setThingNickname">hcap.iot.setThingNickname()</a><br>
18518          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestSynchronizeThing">hcap.iot.requestSynchronizeThing()</a><br>
18519          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.getFrameworkStatus">hcap.iot.getFrameworkStatus()</a><br>
18520          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestFactoryReset">hcap.iot.requestFactoryReset()</a><br>
18521          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.getVersions">hcap.iot.getVersions()</a><br>
18522          * 
18523          * @example
18524          * hcap.iot.getThingList({
18525          *      "thingType": "ThingBridge",
18526          *      "onSuccess": function(s) {
18527          *          console.log("getThingList onSuccess");
18528          *          hcap.iot.requestSetBridgeStatus({
18529          *              "bridgeUid": s.thingList[0].thingUid,
18530          *              "status": "scan",
18531          *              "onSuccess": function() {
18532          *                  console.log("requestSetBridgeStatus onSuccess");
18533          *              },
18534          *              "onFailure": function(sf) {
18535          *                  console.log("requestSetBridgeStatus onFailure : errorMessage = " + sf.errorMessage);
18536          *              }
18537          *          });
18538          *      }, 
18539          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
18540          *          console.log("getThingList onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
18541          *      }
18542          * });
18543          */
18544         hcap.iot.requestSetBridgeStatus = function (param) {
18545             hcap_command("iot_request_set_bridge_status", param);
18546         };
18547         /**
18548          * Gets the bridge status.<br>
18549          * 
18550          * @param {Object} param
18551          * <ul>
18552          *   <li>{String} param.bridgeUid [Required] - bridge UID.<br>
18553          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
18554          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18555          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
18556          *       // {String} param.status - "scan" for scan status, "normal" for normal (non-scan) status.
18557          *   }</pre>
18558          *   </li>
18559          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
18560          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18561          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
18562          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
18563          *   }</pre>
18564          *   </li>
18565          * </ul>
18566          * 
18567          * @since 1.22.2
18568          * 
18569          * @see
18570          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_binding_ready">{Event} iot_binding_ready</a><br>
18571          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_thing_discovered">{Event} iot_thing_discovered</a><br>
18572          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_bridge_status_changed">{Event} iot_bridge_status_changed</a><br>
18573          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_thing_registered">{Event} iot_thing_registered</a><br>
18574          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_thing_rejected">{Event} iot_thing_rejected</a><br>
18575          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_component_reported">{Event} iot_component_reported</a><br>
18576          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_thing_unregistered">{Event} iot_thing_unregistered</a><br>
18577          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_thing_meta_data_changed">{Event} iot_thing_meta_data_changed</a><br>
18578          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_set_component_result_received">{Event} iot_set_component_result_received</a><br>
18579          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_framework_status_changed">{Event} iot_framework_status_changed</a><br>
18580          * <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_factory_reset_result_received">{Event} iot_factory_reset_result_received</a><br>
18581          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestSetBridgeStatus">hcap.iot.requestSetBridgeStatus()</a><br>
18582          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestRegisterThing">hcap.iot.requestRegisterThing()</a><br>
18583          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestRejectThing">hcap.iot.requestRejectThing()</a><br>
18584          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.getThingList">hcap.iot.getThingList()</a><br>
18585          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.getBindingIdList">hcap.iot.getBindingIdList()</a><br>
18586          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestSetComponent">hcap.iot.requestSetComponent()</a><br>
18587          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestUnregisterThing">hcap.iot.requestUnregisterThing()</a><br>
18588          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.setThingNickname">hcap.iot.setThingNickname()</a><br>
18589          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestSynchronizeThing">hcap.iot.requestSynchronizeThing()</a><br>
18590          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.getFrameworkStatus">hcap.iot.getFrameworkStatus()</a><br>
18591          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.requestFactoryReset">hcap.iot.requestFactoryReset()</a><br>
18592          * <a href="hcap.iot.html#.getVersions">hcap.iot.getVersions()</a><br>
18593          *
18594          * @example
18595          * hcap.iot.getBridgeStatus({
18596          *      "bridgeUid": "Zigbee:ZHA",
18597          *      "onSuccess": function(s) {
18598          *          console.log("getBridgeStatus onSuccess : status = " + s.status);
18599          *      }, 
18600          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
18601          *          console.log("getBridgeStatus onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
18602          *      }
18603          * });
18604          */
18605         hcap.iot.getBridgeStatus = function (param) {
18606             hcap_command("iot_get_bridge_status", param);
18607         };
18608         /**
18609          * Requests registration for a discovered thing.<br>
18610          * If the discovered thing is registered, <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_thing_registered">{Event} iot_thing_registered</a> will be delivered and <a href="_global_.html#event:iot_component_reported">{Event} iot_component_reported</a> may also be delivered subsequently.<br>
18611          * 
18612          * @param {Object} param
18613          * <ul>
18614          *   <li>{String} param.thingUid [Required] - UID of the discovered thing to register.<br>
18615          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
18616          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18617          *   param.onSuccess = function () {
18618          *       // No Parameter. 
18619          *   }</pre>
18620          *   </li>
18621          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
18622          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
18623          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
